loans.name: Carlito

texts.en:
“The only failure in life is the failure to try,” Carlito says. He is 49 years old, married, and blessed with four children. His children are currently in high school and college.  Carlito’s wife is a teacher.

Carlito has run a hog raising business for almost 22 years. He started his business primarily with hogs for fattening. Now, Carlito has a large pig farm, which contains a number of sows that give birth to many piglets. Despite the challenges he has encountered in managing his business, he did not lose his hopes and tried everything to overcome them.

Carlito is requesting a loan of P30,000 to buy feed for the maintenance of his hogs. Carlito hopes to further improve his business in order to help his wife in sustaining their children’s needs in school.

loans.use: to buy feed for the maintenance of his hogs.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a Palestinian young man, who is married and has two sons and one daughter. He is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. He also has a project of raising birds for sale.
 
Ali has a store for selling air conditioners and spare parts. He wants to purchase more air conditioners and spare parts, as he prepares to open a second branch of his store.  He would like to have a variety of items for sale in order to increase his income. He does not have enough to pay for the additional items, so he needs to complete the amount with a loan of $3,000 from FATEN. 

When Ali gets the loan, he will have a better collection and will have the ability to open the second store branch. In this way, he will increase his income and improve his family life. Ali is photographed next to his store.

loans.use: to purchase more air conditioners and spare parts for air conditioners.

loans.name: Kum

texts.en:
Mrs. Kum is a 51-year-old married woman who resides in the Steung Sen district in the Kompong Tom province. Mrs. Kum has operated a business as a local farmer since 1979 with her husband, Mr. Oun, who is 54 years old. Aside from cultivating rice, the couple also grows potatoes on their farmland for more profit. They typically earn an average of $8.7USD per day. 

They have three children, all of whom are single. Two of their children always help them work on the farm when they get some free time from school. In order to improve her business, Mrs. Kum would like to request some funds from Kiva to purchase a pumping machine and seeds. In the future, Mrs. Kum plans to enlarge her business and support all of her children so they can go to the university.

loans.use: to purchase a pumping machine and seeds.

loans.name: Neang

texts.en: Neang, 23 years old, resides in Siem Reap which is known as a province that full of ancient temples and tourism. He is a "Tok Tok" driver earning $8 per day. He lives with his parents and four siblings; one is studying and the other three are working earning $16 per day for all. Every month, he has to spend $83 on food, $15 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. He would like to request a loan of $450 to buy a new "Tok Tok" for for himself to use to run a "Tok Tok" service. He also plans to rent a place to sell souvenirs near the temple.

loans.use: To buy a "tok tok" for his business.

loans.name: Kiden

texts.en:
Kiden is a 55-year-old married woman with ten children, six of whom are in school. She has a business selling charcoal in Kator in South Sudan. She has been in this business for seven years.

Kiden requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to enable her to purchase more charcoal for sale. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Yi

texts.en: Yi, 59 years old, is a motor taxi driver earning $7 per day. His wife is staying home. They live together with one child, who is 8 years old and studying in school. Every month, Yi has to spend $50 on food, $8 on electricity, $15 on school fees, $5 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. He would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy a new motorbike for his work because his current motorbike has no taxation (mean he bought it with no tax certificate that make the price low) so he can’t take customers to town otherwise he will need to pay for the tax certificate. Yi wants to support his child to study and at least finish high school.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for his work.

loans.name: Hashem

texts.en:
Hashem is from Iraq. He is 30 years old, married, and a father of three children.

Since 2007, Hashem has owned a market, which sells soft drinks, juices, vegetables, cheese and dairy products, and household items. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs, and has sufficient experience in this field. His market is situated in a crowded area, so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He is requesting loan of $2400 in order to purchase a showcase, to make sliding doors and an outdoor ceiling, and to purchase more foodstuffs. He aims to gain more profits, which will enable him to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a showcase, foodstuffs, and to make sliding doors and an outdoor ceiling.

loans.name: Erickson

texts.en:
Erickson is 31 years old and still single. He lives in a village with his beloved parents who are now old and infirm. He aims to earn more income to satisfy their needs and save for their future. He owns and operates a motorcycle transport in their village to earn income. He has been in this business for more than one year and usually earns profits of 6,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month. 

He wants to ask an additional capital of 5,000 PHP to buy gasoline, wheels and spare parts for his motorcycle transport to provide better service. He believes that through patience and hard work, he will increase his income and save for his future.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, wheels, and spare parts for his motorcycle transport

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en: Mwanamisi is on track to repay her first loan in full and on time. She and her family are doing well and her business has grown steadily since receiving the loan. She now wants more assistance so she kindly requests another loan of 30,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Minala

texts.en:
Minala is a 30-year-old married woman with two children in school. She has a business of selling breads in Kator in South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years. 

Minala requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to enable her purchase more bread for sale. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more bread for resale.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a 30-year-old married woman with three children, one of whom goes to school. She has a business selling beer in Kator in South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years. 

Jackline requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to enable her purchase more beer for sale. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more beer for sale.

loans.name: C13503 Abishyizehamwe Group

texts.en:
Agnes is 26-year-old woman with one child who is eight years old. For four years she has owned a small shop which sells various products such as rice, sugar, cosmetics, and so on. Her business is open from 5 a.m. until 10 p.m. every day. 

Agnes and her business are well known in the region, which is the reason why she is the leader of the group called "Abishyizehamwe" in the local language. She and her group, which consists of two women and three men, have requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to purchase more products for their businesses. 

Agnes and her team need this loan in order to expand their product offerings and satisfy the demands of their customers. If this satisfaction is reached, Agnes and the other group members hope to earn more profits. With these profits she expects to save money for her future and to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more goods like rice, sugar, cosmetics, and so on.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To complete the  purchase of a new taxi.

loans.name: Kean

texts.en: Kean, age 49, is a hard working man who lives in the Baray district of Kompong, Thom proivince. Kean has a life partner in his wife who is a rice cultivator as well as a pig raiser. They are blessed with eight children. Three of his children are single and attending public school, while the other five are ready married and live separately. Everyday Kean transports his firewood to sell in a local market by using animal power, but unfortunately, his cow is too old to do this work. Therefore, Kean is seeking for a loan to buy some buffalo to transport his firewood. In the future, Mr. Kean hopes that he’ll be able to build a wooden house that is bigger and stronger than the old one.

loans.use: to buy some buffalo to transport firewood.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a responsible father who is now 31 years old. He aims to improve his standard of living to support his family and send his two children to school. Farming is the main source of their income, but due to financial difficulty, Joseph operates his motorcycle transport in their village to earn additional income. 

Joseph is asking for PHP 5,000 to buy spare parts and gasoline for the motorcycle transport to provide better service. He believes that through this loan  his motorcycle  will be used  more often. Joseph hopes that in the future he will increase his income and give his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and gasoline for his motorcycle transport vehicle

loans.name: Katherine

texts.en:
Katherine is 35 years old with three children all of whom are in  school. She is a widow who has a business selling beer in Kator branch in South Sudan. She has been in this business for five years.
Katherine has requested this loan through BRAC, South Sudan to enable her to purchase more beer for sale. Katherine will use the extra income from this loan for building a house in future.

loans.use: to able to purchase more beer for sale.

loans.name: Abdulrahman

texts.en: AbdulRahman is a 23 year old young man. He is a blacksmith with a decent salary.  He has one sister and wants to pay the university fees for her, but he hasn't enough money to pay, so he needs to take a loan of $500 from FATEN. When AbdulRahman gets the loan which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will pay the university fees for his sister. This will enable her to complete her education and improve the standard of living of her family. AbdulRahman is photographed in a FATEN branch.

loans.use: To pay the university fees for his sister.

loans.name: Ondua

texts.en:
Ondua is a 30 year old married woman with three children, one of whom is in school. She has a business of selling clothes in Kator branch in South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.
Ondua has requested a loan through BRAC South Sudan to able to purchase more clothes for sale. She will use the profits from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 60 years old and now a widow. She lives in a village with two adult children. They own and manage a rice farming business and a welding shop to earn income.The family has had this business for more than 30 years and is now earning a profit of P8,000 a month.  They work hard and endure hardships to earn income and satisfy their needs. 

Due to the high cost of commodities and transportation, Remedios aims to improve their welding shop and make it viable source of income. She is requesting  a loan of P15,000 to buy a welding rod, steel rods, G.I.sheets and paint to be use in the welding shop to provide  better service. She believes that through this loan, they will improve the business and earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy a welding rod, steel rods, G.I. sheets and paint to use in her welding shop

loans.name: Aneta

texts.en:
Aneta is a 28 year old a married woman with three children two of whom are in the school. She has a business of selling breads in Kator branch in South Sudan. She has been in this business for five years.
Aneta has requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to be able her purchase more breads for sale. She will use the extra income for building a house for sale.

loans.use: to purchase more breads for sale.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita is married with five children who are in school. She is engaged in a hog raising business. She has been in this business for over four years. Jovita’s dream is to uplift her family  out of poverty.
Jovita needs  additional capital to sustain her business. She is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase feed for the maintenance of her hogs. Jovita believes that impatience never commanded success that’s why she is keeping on being patient and hardworking. Jovita hopes that her dream becomes reality through her earnings from the business.

loans.use: to purchase feed for the maintenance of her hogs.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 54-year-old man, and he is married with four sons and three daughters. He is a school teacher with a decent salary. 

Mohammad has his own project which is a grocery store. He wants to purchase more groceries so he can have a better collection for sale to increase his income, but the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay, so he needs to take a loan of $1,300 from FATEN. When Mohammad gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will pay to purchase more groceries and have a variety of products and groceries for sale. He will then have the ability to compete and sell more, in order to have a better income and provide better life conditions for his family. 

Mohammad is photographed in his grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries for sale.

loans.name: Mizhgona

texts.ru: Мижгона  умная, честная  девушка. Она занимается купля продажей сладости на престижном рынке города. Она очень активная девушка, ей приятно обслуживать свои клиенты и она с удовольствием занимается этим. Она продает широкий ассортимент конфеты и печенье. Когда Мижгона была маленькая, её мать занималась этим бизнесом, а она помогла своей матери. Мижгона сама самостоятельно успешно ведет этот бизнес уже более 7 лет и у неё очень хороший опыт. Она хотела бы получить займ в размере 1100$ США для покупки нового ассортимента конфета.
texts.en: Mizhgona is a smart and honest young woman.  She is involved in buying and selling sweets at a prestigious city market.  She is a very active young woman. She likes providing good service to her customers and is satisfied by it.  She sells a wide variety of candy and cookies.  When Mizhgona was little, her mother was involved in this business, and she used to help her mother.  Mizhgona has been independently running this business for over 7 years and has a good experience.  She wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $1100 for the purchase of a new assortment of candy.

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of candy

loans.name: San

texts.en: San is a 27 year-old woman and the mother of two school-age children from Baray district of Kompong Thom province.  San has run a small business as a seller for years. In front of her house, there are lots of mixed products that she sells to her customers such as canned foods, groceries, packaged food etc. From this business, she can earn around $2.7USD per day. San also relies on the income from her husband who transports firewood for selling. During the rainy season, this couple is concerned that they’ll face difficulties because they don’t have any animals for plowing their field, so they have to spend a lot of money to hire their neighbor’s animals for farming. So San is asking for a loan from HKL and Kiva in order to buy a cow for plowing as well as for hauling the firewood.

loans.use: to buy a cow for plowing as well as for hauling  firewood.

loans.name: Kulukan's Group

texts.en:
Kulukan is the leader of this group. She is 55 and unfortunately a widow, and has raised a son and a daughter. Her son provides tractor driver services and her daughter studies at university. In order to earn money for her livelihood, Kulukan breeds poultry and cultivates agricultural products such as wheat and potatoes. Ten years ago she purchased forty hens and she was selling about 30 eggs a day. 

At the moment Kulukan's monthly profit is about 6000 soms. Kulukan has applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase ten hens for breeding and 200 liters of fuel for collecting the harvest. In the future, with the profits gained from the business she plans to improve the family’s living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – people (building human capital and taking care of customers as well as society), planet (remaining environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and fuel for collecting the harvest.

loans.name: Lina Fe

texts.en:
Lina Fe is a hard-working mother who sells AVON, Natasha and MSE products in her village to help her husband in financing the education of their children. She is now 47 years old and has three school-aged children. Due to financial difficulty, she is hoping to improve her business and increase her income to satisfy the family's basic needs and support the education of their children. 

In this regard, she wants to sell more AVON, Natasha and MSE products but she has inadequate capital, therefore, she wants to ask for 16,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy more of these products to sell in her village. She believes that this loan will help her to improve her business through her patience and hard work.

loans.use: to buy AVON, Natasha and MSE products to sell in her village

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 54 years old and has four children. They live happily in a rural community, planting and harvesting vegetables for sale. Due to the high cost of school fees and commodities, some of their children did not pursue their studies. 

At this time, she would like to plant more vegetables with the expectation of increasing her production. But due to inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan of 20,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy seeds and fertilizers to sustain her vegetable production. 

She believes that the loan will help her to increase her yields. She is hoping that she is going to harvest a large volume of vegetables and earn a higher income to support her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers to sustain her vegetable production

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 33 years old, married, and has three children. Rosemarie has been running her sari-sari (general) store for five years. She earns about 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a day. 

According to Rosemarie, through the income generated from her business she has been able to pay daily allowances to send her children to school. 

She wishes for a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy grocery items such as canned goods  and noodles to sell in her sari-sari store. In the future, Rosemarie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as canned goods and noodles to sell

loans.name: Florina

texts.en: Florina is from the village of Bugallon, Cauayan city, Isabela. She is 49 years old and has been engaged in the piggery business for 10 years. She says it is not easy work to take on this occupation. Her business serves as a source of income for the family that helps provide for their daily needs. Now she is requesting a loan of 7,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to purchase feed and vaccines to sustain her hog raising business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vaccines to sustain her hog raising business.

loans.name: Fares

texts.en:
Fares is a 46-year-old married man with one son and two daughters. He is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. Fares has a general store for selling cameras, DVDs, phone and computer accessories, etc. 

He wants to purchase more of these items for sale to help him improve his business and increase his income, but the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay, so he needs to take out a loan of $2,000 from FATEN. 

When Fares gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will purchase a collection of items for sale. In this way he will improve his business and compete with others by selling more, thus increasing his income and improving his family's living conditions. Fares is photographed in his store.

loans.use: To purchase more products for sale.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys desires to bring her family out of poverty. She plans to maintain and develop her hog-raising business for the future of her family. Gladys is married and blessed with two children. Her husband is a farmer, planting rice in the Philippines.

Gladys has been three years in the business. She usually earns 2,000 Philippines pesos (P) per head for her pigs that she has taken care of for four months. Gladys wants to buy additional piglets to raise; that’s why she is asking for a loan of P15,000.

She hopes to maintain her business and be able to send her children to school until college so they can become professionals someday.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James used his previous loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy seedlings. His farm produced a lot of vegetables, which he sold and got more income to pay off his loan and cater for his family's needs. He was also able to pay school fees comfortably for his children because his business improved.

James has requested for another loan of 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy two cows and animal feeds.

loans.use: To buy two cows and animals feeds.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a responsible housewife who owns and manages a variety store in her village. She aimed to improve her business to supplement her husband's income and support their family's needs. Despite hardships and difficulties in life, they are trying their best to make the business profitable. 

She wants to increase her product offerings to satisfy her customers' needs, but due to financial difficulty, she is asking for a loan of 7,000 Philippines pesos to buy canned goods, breads, noodles, eggs, beverages, soaps and seasonings to sell in their village. She believes that this loan will help her to improve the business and makes it a viable source of income.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, breads, noodles, eggs, beverages, soaps and seasonings to sell.

loans.name: Raghda

texts.en:
Raghda is a 27-year-old young woman. She is married with one son and one daughter. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. 

Raghda wants to purchase new home furniture such as living room furniture, bedroom furniture, etc., but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay for it, so she needs to take a loan of $500 from FATEN. When Raghda gets the loan, which will be repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to purchase the furniture she needs for her house, and this will offer better life conditions to her family. 

Raghda is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead in the FATEN branch.

loans.use: To purchase new home furniture.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah is a hardworking businesswoman aged 26. She is married and blessed with one child. For the last six years, she has been managing a salon to support her family. She has employed one person to help her to manage the business. She faces the major challenge of competition, but she has retained some of her customers because of her good customer care. 

In the next five years, she wants to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy hair chemicals and braids for her business.

loans.use: To buy hair chemicals and braids.

loans.name: Artak

texts.en:
Artak is 28 years old. He lives in Gandzakar village, in the Tavush area, with his wife, his child, his parents and his brother. 

After serving in the Armenian army he has joined in his family occupation: animal breeding and land cultivation. On their farm, Artak and his family breed cows, chickens, turkeys and piglets. They produce cheese and sell it to fellow villagers. Also they grow fruits and vegetables.
 
Simultaneously with farming, Artak and his brother run a fruits and vegetables trading business that they carry out from their car in neighboring villages and Ljevan city as well. They sell both their farm’s fruits and vegetables and purchased production. 

Artak needs a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy new pigs for his farm, fodder for his farm animals and a lot of various fruits and vegetables for his trading business.

loans.use: To buy pigs for his farm, fodder for his farm animals and a lot of various fruits and vegetables for his trading business.

loans.name: Farig

texts.ru:
On yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione, posolok Ahmabeyli  vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Farig 55 let. On jenat i imeyet 4 detey.
Eto uje vtoraya ssuda Fariga , on ochen blagodaren lenderam i Kive za pervuyu ssudu, on smog xorosho razvit svoy biznessa. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit yesho korov. Uje 12 let kak Farig zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov.
texts.en: Farig is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the town of Fuzuli and now lives together with his family in Ahmabeyli village of the Fuzuli region.  He is 55 years old, married and has four children.  This is Farig's second loan, and he is very grateful to Kiva for the first loan because he was able to develop his business well.  He currently needs 2000 AZN in order to buy more cows.  Farig has been involved in animal husbandry for 12 years and breeds cattle.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Judith

texts.fr:
Cliente de 37 ans, elle se lance dans le commerce des divers, il  y'a bientôt 7 ans.Ayant déjà bénéficie de 3 prêts auprès de Hope Congo, elle a rembourse sans difficultés et a fait des épargnes considérables.Ses ventes ont augmentes de 50.000frs a 100.000 frs par jour.
Pour ce quatrième prêt , étant a la veille de la rentrée scolaire, elle change de stratégies en changeant son activité et elle profite de l'opportunité pour acheter des fournitures scolaires tel que  cartons des cahiers, des cartables, des gourdes, des stylos, des ardoises,des crayons de couleurs et tout autres articles nécessaires.
Tres entreprenante, elle a un fort esprit de créativité qui l'amène a aller vers l'avant.Elle élève sans probleme les enfants qui sont a sa charge et est entrain d'investir pour construire sa maison.
texts.en: Judith is a 37 year old client who has been selling various items for the past 7 years. Having already benefitted from 3 loans from Hope Congo, she never had trouble repaying these loans and was able to save a considerable amount of money. Her sales grew from 50,000 frs to 100,000 frs a day [approximately 55 USD to 110 USD]. She is asking for this fourth loan in order to stock up on school supplies, in advance of the back-to-school period. She is changing the type of items she is selling, and wants to take the opportunity of the upcoming school year to purchase notebooks, pens, pencil, slates, colored crayons and other school supplies. She is very entrepreneurial and has a strong spirit of creativity which pushes her forward. She is raising several children under her care without difficulty and is also planning to build her own home.

loans.use: purchase cartons of notebooks, pens, pencils, backpacks and slates.

loans.name: Jarkynai's Group

texts.en:
Jarkynai is the leader of this group. She is 36 and married to a constructor, whose monthly salary is about 5,000 KGS. Together with her husband, she is bringing up two daughters and two sons, all of whom study at school. 

In order to earn money to meet the daily needs of the family, she breeds livestock. Ten years ago, with an initial investment of 10,000 KGS, Jarkynai opened a canteen. Her monthly profit from this business is about 6,000 KGS. This profit made it possible to save money to purchase a vehicle. 

At the moment she has saved some money but she needs additional funds to purchase a cow. For this purpose, she applies for the loan. 

In the future Jarkynai wishes to open a café in the center of the village. There are no cafés for celebrating various events.


--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Phylis

texts.en:
Phylis is a single woman, age 49, blessed with two children. 

For the last two years, she has been selling doughnuts to earn a living. She also does dairy farming to earn extra income. She has retained her business because of her good reputation with her customers. 

In the next five years, she wants to become successful in her business. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to buy ingredients such as cooking fat and wheat flour.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as cooking fat and wheat flour.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Due to financial difficulty, Danilo operates a motorcycle transport in their village to generate additional income to support his family. He is now 47 years old and and has three school-age children. He endures hardships and difficulties in life for he wants to continue sending his children to school in order to give them a better life. He has been in this business for almost nine years and usually earns a profits of PHP 7,000 a month, which he uses for their food and the allowances of their children.

Due to the high cost of commodities, he wants to ask for an additional capital of PHP 5,000 to buy gasoline and spare parts for the maintenance of his motorcycle to provide a better service. He believes that this loan will help a lot to improve the sources of his income.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and spare parts for the maintenance of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a focused business woman, age 49. She is married and blessed with three children who are still in school. 

For the last year, she has been managing a salon to earn a living. She also sells herbal hair chemicals to earn extra income. 

In the next five years, she wants to become successful in her business. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy a hair drier.

loans.use: To buy a hair drier.

loans.name: Mariesa

texts.en:
Mariesa, 32, is single. She has been engaged in hog raising for one year. She is able to earn PHP 2,000 per head from the pigs she takes care of for four months. Mariesa’s business serves as her source of income and enables her to help her parents financially.

Because of the high cost of feed supplies nowadays, Mariesa wants to borrow a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to buy feed for the maintenance of her hogs. Some part of the loan will be used to buy additional piglets to raise.

loans.use: to buy feed for the maintenance of her hogs and buy additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Kenneth is a determined business man, age 44. He is married and blessed with three children. 

For the last three years, he has been operating a motorbike transport business and a retail shop business to earn a living. He has retained his business because of his good reputation with his customers. 

In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. He dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future. With the loan of 100,000 KES, he wants to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Gune

texts.en:
Gune, 30, is married and has six children, all of whom are in school.

She has a business of selling breads in Kator Branch in South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Gune requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to enable her to purchase more breads for resale.

She will use the extra income from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more breads for sale.

loans.name: Soeng

texts.en:
Soeng, 24, is a young married woman who has been living in the Baray district of Kompong Thom province, Cambodia. Soeng is married and has two children. One of them is studying in a local state school. 

Recently, Soeng bought some piglets for feeding, and she hopes that she’ll be able to sell them in three or four months after breeding. From her business, Soeng normally makes a profit about 1.5 USD per day. Unfortunately, Soeng has noticed that her pigs are not big enough due to the lack of food. That’s why she would like to request some funds to buy many sacks of pig feed to fatten her pigs. 

In the future, Soeng hopes that she’ll be able to own a store for selling mixed products in front of her house and that she can send all her children to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy many sacks of pig feed to fatten her pigs.

loans.name: Asylkan's Group

texts.en:
Asylkan is the treasurer of this group. She is 54 and unfortunately she is a widow. She has raised three sons, all of whom work in construction. 

In order to earn money, Asylkan breeds livestock. She keeps a cow with a calf and sheep. Every day she sells dairy products and twice a month she resells sheep. In this way, she earns about 5,000 KGS per month. This profit made it possible for her to build a shed for keeping livestock. 

With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase more livestock for breeding, fattening and further reselling. In the future, with the profits gained from the business, she wants to finish the construction of her house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Ronnel

texts.en:
Ronnel is 20 years old and still single. He graduated from college last year but due to lack of job opportunities, he is engaged in selling AVON, Natasha and MSE products to help his parents earn income. He aims to earn and save more income for his own future. 

He wants to ask for an additional capital of P5,000 to buy AVON, Natasha and MSE products to sell in their village. He believes that through patience and hard work, he will sell more of the products and increase his income. He is hoping that in the future, he will make the business viable and profitable.

loans.use: to buy AVON, Natasha and MSE products to sell.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is 40 years old, a married woman with four children, all four of whom are in school. She has a business selling charcoal in Kator in South Sudan. She has been in this business for six years.

Margret requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase more charcoal for sale. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Ayat

texts.en:
Ayat is a 26-year-old young woman who is married and has one son. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with modest salary and he also works as a taxi driver. 

Ayat wants to share with her husband in completing the price of purchasing a new taxi, but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay for her share, so she needs to take a loan in the amount of $1,500 from FATEN. When Ayat gets the loan which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to share with her husband and purchase a new taxi. This will enable her husband to work extra hours and increase his income to provide better living conditions for the family. 

Ayat is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead of her.

loans.use: To complete the price of purchasing new taxi.

loans.name: Santo

texts.en:
Santo is a 29-year-old carpenter and is married to Ermina, a 27-year-old lady. They are blessed with three children: Regina, 6, in kindergarten; Peter, 4 and Fajar, 1. 

In addition to working as a carpenter, Santo also runs another business renting a tractor to farmers. Santo has been running the business for two years. He has a plot of land so he desires to utilize it by planting various vegetables such as “kangkung”, mustard greens, spinach and tomatoes. He decided to run the new business as the income generated from tractor rental is unstable. Due to the lack of a water supply in his village, Santo plans to dig a well to irrigate his little  farm.  

Therefore he is requesting a loan of IDR 5,000,000 from TLM. Santo wants to spend the loan to dig a well and to purchase a pump.  Santo hopes that TLM will approve his loan application.

loans.use: to dig a well and to purchase a water pump.

loans.name: Zakhir

texts.ru:
Zakhir jenat i imeyet 3 detey. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione, posolok Bala Bahmanli vmeste so svoyey jenoy i detmi. Zakhir 44 qoda. On uje 2 qoda kak reshil zanatsya skotovodstvom i razvodit ovec. Do etogo on zanimalsya pticevodstvom i razvodil gusey. Eto vtoraya ssuda ZAkhira on ochen blagodaren lenderam i Kive za pervuyu ssudu. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit ovec dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva skota. 

http://partners.kiva.org/lend/76514
texts.en: Zakhir is married and has three children.  He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the town of Fuzuli and now lives together with his wife and children in the Bala Bahmanli village of the Fuzuli region.  He is 44 years old.  He decided to get involved in animal husbandry two years ago and now breeds sheep.  Zakhir was previously involved in bird farming and bred geese.  This Zakhir's second loan, and he is very grateful to Kiva lenders for the first loan.  He currently needs 2000 AZN in order to buy sheep and increase livestock quantity.

loans.use: to buy sheep and increase livestock quantity

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a moulding machine and motorbike.

loans.name: Harison

texts.en: Harison is a married man aged 34 and blessed with three children who are still in school.  For the last six years, he has been working as a mechanic to support the family. He has employed two people to help him to manage the business. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. He is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy vehicle spare parts for his business.

loans.use: To buy vehicle spare parts.

loans.name: Firaddin

texts.ru: Firaddin jenat i imeeyt 2 detey. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom , on pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey lubimoy jenoy i detmi. Firaddin 29 let. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit produkti dlya prodaji. Uje 4 goda kak Firaddin zanimayetsya prodajey pishevix produktov. Etomu biznessu ona nauchilsya u svoyego otca kotoriy toje imel magazin.
texts.en: Firaddin is married and has two children.  He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the town of Fuzuli and now lives together with his beloved wife and children in the Fuzuli region.  He is 29 years old.  He currently needs 2000 AZN to buy products for sale.  Firaddin has been involved in selling food products for four years.  He learned this business from his father, who also had a store.

loans.use: to buy products for sale

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en: Maribel is 31, married and has two infant children. She works retailing gasoline in their village to supplement her husband's income. She has operated this business for more than six years and earns a profit of P6,000 a month. She wants to sell more gasoline to increase her income, but due to inadequate capital, she wants to ask for an additional capital of P8,000 to buy additional stock of gasoline to sell in their village. She believes that this loan will help her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of gasoline to sell in their village.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase new home appliances.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a married man and blessed with two children, both of whom attend school. For the past six years, he has been running a tailoring business to earn a living. He has employed two people to help him manage the business. He faces the major challenge of competition.

In the next 5 years, Charles wants to expand his business. With 50,000 Kenya shillings (KES), he will buy fabric for making clothes.

loans.use: To buy fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase cotton piqué, satiny cotton, silk, gabardine and poplin in various colors

loans.name: Celine

texts.fr:
Femme remarquable de 48ans responsable ayant 5 personnes en charge. Commerçante des friperies. Elle à fait preuve d’un bon remboursement lors de son troisième  prêt. Le prêt lui appris la gestion de stock, comment tenir un journal de caisse et grâce à cela ses revenus journaliers ont augmentés de 35.000frs à 70.000frs. 

Avec l’octroi du quatrième prêt, elle va augmentée son stock pour faire accroître son capital en achetant divers ballots de friperie non utilisé comme les draps, des nappe de table, des torchons et serviettes non utilises. 

Elle à améliore ses conditions de vie  de ses 4 enfants, qui en plus ont été inscrits dans des institutions privées; elle tient à aller jusqu'au bout de son objectif, toujours avec Hope pour qu'elle accomplisse ses ambitions qui sont d’avoir un dépôt de ballots de friperie.
texts.en:
Celine is a remarkable 48-year-old woman who is responsbile for 5 persons. She sells cloths, and repaid her third loan without problems. The loan taught her stock management and how to maintain a cash journal. Thanks to it, her daily revenues increased from XOF 35'000 to 70'000 (ca US$ 70 to 140).

With her fourth loan, she will increase her stock in order to bolster her working capital, by buying various bales of new cloths, such as sheets, tablecloths, dishcloths, and towels. 

She improved the standard of living of her four children, who are now registered in private institutions. She's determined to reach her goal, together with Kiva's partner, Hope, in order to have her own cloth bales warehouse.

loans.use: to buy bundles of cloths, sheets and towels

loans.name: Rovshan

texts.ru: On jenat i imeyt 3 detey. Rovshan 51 qod. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom, pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so sovyey semyoy. Rovshan seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva skota. On uje 7 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov.
texts.en: Rovshan is married and has three children.  He is 51 years old.  Rovshan is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the town of Fuzuli and now lives together with his family in the Fuzuli region.  Rovshan currently needs 2000 AZN to buy cows and increase livestock quantity.  He has been involved in animal husbandry for seven years and breeds cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en:
Leonardo is 27 and married with one infant child. He aims to improve his family's status of living to give them a better life. He has operated a motorcycle transport in his village for almost four years and usually earns a profits of 4,800 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month. 

He requests a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy gasoline and spare parts, and to renew his motorcycle registration. He believes that this loan will help him to make the business grow and become a viable source of income. In the future, he believes that he can uplift his family's status of living and give them a better life.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and spare parts, and to renew his motorcycle registration.

loans.name: Akef

texts.en:
Akef is a 22-year-old single man from Madaba, Jordan. 

Akef has his own blacksmith shop and he is requesting a loan of 1500 Jordanian Dinars (JOD) to purchase more aluminum and iron to expand his business. He is looking to purchase a car for moving the aluminum and iron to cut transportation costs. 

An aspiration of Akef's is to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase aluminium other metals for his blacksmith shop

loans.name: Bulud

texts.ru: Bulud yavlyayetsya IDP personom, pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. On jenat i imeyet odnogo rebonka kotoriy uchitsya v shkole. Bulud rodilsya v 1970 godu. On uje 11 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya razvitiya svoyego biznessa.
texts.en: Bulud is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the town of Fuzuli and now lives together with his family in the Fuzuli region.  He is married and has one child, who attends school.  Bulud was born in 1970.  He has been involved in animal husbandry for 11 years and breeds cattle.  He currently needs 2000 AZN in order to buy cattle and develop his business.

loans.use: to buy cattle and develop his business

loans.name: Rusif

texts.ru: Rusif 26 let. On jenat i imeyet odnogo rebonka kotoriy rodilsya nedavno. V svazi s etim yemu nujno uvelichet kolichestvo svoyego yejemesechnogo budjeta. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit kuricci dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva dlya prodaji. Rusif yavlyayetsya IDP personom, pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey lubimoy jenoy i rebonkom. Uje 3 qoda kak on zanimayetsya pticevodstvom i razvodit kuric.
texts.en: Rusif is 26 years old.  He is married and has one child, who was recently born.  Because of this, he needs to increase his monthly budget.  Rusif currently needs 2000 AZN to buy chickens in order to increase its quantity available for sale.  Rusif is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the town of Fuzuli and now lives together with his his beloved wife and child in the Fuzuli region.  He has been involved in bird farming for three years and breeds chickens.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is 33 years old. He lives with his mother in Ddmashen village, Sevan area. Since 2003 Armen has been working for the police and at the same time he and his mother are engaged in land cultivation and animal breeding.

Armen and his mother breed cows, sheep, pigs, and chickens. He sells the produced dairy products to fellow villagers, and the meat to butchers. He uses the rest of the agricultural produce for his family's needs. He also grows wheat and oats, which he uses as fodder for his farm animals. Thanks to farming, Armen provides for his family and now he intends to buy three more cows. This will help him to sell more dairy products and thus to increase his family income in the future. Therefore, he needs a loan of 1,000,000 Armenia drams (AMD).

This is Armen’s third loan from Nor Horizon and he has never been delayed in his repayments.

loans.use: To buy three more cows for his farm.

loans.name: Elshad

texts.ru: Elshad yavlyayetsya IDP personom, pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. On jenat i imeyet dvux detey. Elshad 51 let. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva molochnogo produkta dlya prodaji. Uje 13 let kak on zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. Elshad prodayot molochniye produkti v magazini.
texts.en: Elshad is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the town of Fuzuli and now lives in the Fuzuli region together with his family.  He is married and has two children.  Elshad is 51 years old.  He currently needs 2000 AZN in order to buy cattle and increase quantities of milk products for sale.  He has been involved in animal husbandry for 13 years and breeds cattle.  Elshad sells milk products to stores.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy jeans, gabardine pants, polo shirts, shirts and T-shirts.

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona is a 26-year-old married woman and mother of two children. She opened a mobile shop in 2007 in order to help her husband in their family's income. Mona is a hardworking woman, and she updates her business regularly with new mobiles and technologies. Most of Mona's customers are neighbors, relatives, and friends, in addition to passers-by.

Mona is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to increase her merchandise through buying new mobile phones, accessories, and recharge cards. Mona will also invest her loan in helping her husband do maintenance to the power generator necessary for completing his business.

This is Mona's first cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower. She will work hard to make this investment a good one, as she hopes the other one will help in expanding her shop to start dealing with new technologies.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with mobile phones, accessories, and recharge cards.

loans.name: Darlene

texts.en:
Darlene believes that success is the sum of effort. She 21 years old and single. Darlene wants to help her parents in a simple manner. For the past year, she has run a hog-raising business through her perseverance and hard work. Darlene is grateful for her monthly profit of 2,000 PHP each month.

Darlene is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to buy piglets to raise. Her loan will help to maintain her business and increase her income so that she will be able to financially support her parents. Darlene hopes that her loan will have a positive effect on her business.

loans.use: to buy piglets to rais.

loans.name: Sare Sahara/ Pellital Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Pellitala été créé en juillet 2008  lors de l’inauguration leur banc villageois. Il compte 14 femmes qui habitent toutes le même village. Elles font toutes le petit commerce.

Madame Mariama (assise à l’extrême droite), est responsable. Elle est âgée de 39 ans, mariée et mère de 02 enfants.

Elle est vendeuse de beignets dans son village. Elle pratique cette activité depuis plus de 5 ans.

Son crédit va lui permettre d’acheter de la farine en quantité et divers ingrédients pour la préparation de beignets.

Avec les bénéfices elle compte appuyer son mari dans les charges familiales.
texts.en:
Pellitala Group was established in July 2008, when the local Banc Villageois was inaugurated. The group is made up of 14 women who live in the same village. They all work as resellers.

Mrs. Mariama (sitting on the far right in the photograph) is responsible for the group. She's 39 years old, married, and the mother of two children. For more than five years, she's been selling donuts in her village.

Her loan will enable her to buy a large quantity of flour, and various ingredients needed to make donuts. With her profits, she intends to help her husband with the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy flour and other ingredients needed to make donuts

loans.name: Camp De Garde / Tessito Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Tessito  est créé en Novembre  2006  au jour de l’inauguration du banc villageois. Il est composé de 17 femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame  MARIEANDRE,  (debout en cinquième position de la gauche vers la droite), est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 37 ans, est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Elle vend des vêtements pour enfants  et des cuisses de poulet.  Activité qu’elle pratique depuis plus de 05 ans.

Avec ce prêt elle compte acheter des vêtements pour enfants en vu des les revendre durant la rentrée des classes.

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront d’épargner  et  de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge alimentaire et scolaire.
texts.en:
The Tessito group was created in November 2006, on the day the "banc villageois" was inaugurated. It is composed of 17 women who live in the same neighborhood. Their principal activity is small-scale retailing. 

Madame  Marieandre  (standing fifth, left to right), is the leader of the group. She is 73, married and the mother of five children. She sells children's clothing and chicken thighs, as she has been doing for five years now.

With this loan she counts on buying children's clothing to sell during the back-to-school period. 

The profit from her business will permit her to put aside savings and help her husband with food expenses and school fees.

loans.use: to buy children's clothing for resale.

loans.name: Camp De Garde / Kambeng Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Kambeng  est créé en Novembre  2006  au jour de l’inauguration du banc villageois. Il est composé de 26 femmes qui toutes vivent dans même quartier. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Aissatou  (debout en troisième position de la gauche vers la droite) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 36 ans, est mariée et mère de 03 enfants.

Elle vend des légumes activité qu’elle pratique depuis plus de trois ans.

Avec ce prêt elle compte acheter des légumes pour la revente.

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront d’épargner  et de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la scolarité des enfants et de la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en:
The Kambeng group was created in November 2006, the day of the inauguration of the "banc villageois". It is composed of 26 women who all live in the same neighborhood. They all have small-scale retailing as a principle activity. 

Madame Aissatou  (standing, third from left to right) is the leader of the group. She is 36, married, and the mother of three children. She sells vegetables as she has been doing for more than three years now. With this loan she intends to buy vegetables for resale. 

The profit from her business will permit her to put aside savings and to help her husband pay the school fees for their children as well as daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Israa'

texts.en:
Israa' is a 23-year-old woman who is married to a blacksmith.  Israa' is a conservative woman, so her husband’s photograph, taken in his workshop, appears here.  Her husband earns a decent income and also works in the agriculture sector. 

Israa’ is requesting a loan to purchase a new blacksmith kit and iron for her husband so that he may improve his business. She needs to take a loan from FATEN that she will repay on a monthly basis. Her loan will positively impact her husband’s work and increase his income which will enable him to provide a better standard of living for their family. 


About this loan:

FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to purchase a blacksmith kit and iron

loans.name: Hikmat

texts.ru:
Hikmat uje 7 let kak zanimayetsya prodajey tovarov dlya remonta( kraski, laki, kleyi,rastvoriteli i t.d). Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit tovari dlya remonta dlya prodaji.
 Hikmat jenat i iemyet odnogo rebonka. Yemu 35 let. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselencem iz Fuzuli goroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey drujelubnoy semyoy.
texts.en: Hikmat has been involved in selling merchandise for repairs (paint, stainer, glue, paint thinner, etc.) for seven years.  He currently needs 2000 AZN to buy repair merchandise for sale.  Hikmat is married and has one child.  He is 35 years old.  He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the town of Fuzuli and now lives in the Fuzuli region together with his friendly family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for sale

loans.name: Campde Garde /mame Diarra Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Mame Diarra est créé en Novembre  2006  au jour de l’inauguration du banc villageois. Il est composé de 23 femmes qui toutes issues du même quartier. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Dalanda ,  (Assise en deuxième position de la  gauche vers la droite), est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 65 ans, est mariée et mère de 07 enfants.

Elle est  vendeuse de crème glaces et de jus dans son quartier  depuis plus de 15 ans.

Avec ce prêt elle compte acheter en quantité les différents produits pour la préparation de jus et crème glacée.

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge des besoins domestiques et de renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
The Mame Diarra group was created in November 2006, the day of the inauguration of the "banc villageois". It is composed of 23 women who are all from the same neighborhood. Their principle activity is small-scale retailing. 

Madame Dalanda (seated in second position from left to right) is the leader of the group. She is 65, married and the mother of seven children. She has been selling ice creams and juice in her neighborhood for more than 15 years. With this loan she counts on buying various products in large quantity for making juice and ice cream. 

The profit from her business will permit her to help her husband with the day-to-day expenses of the household and to add to her savings.

loans.use: to buy in large quantity the various products needed for making juice and ice cream.

loans.name: Thaer

texts.en:
Thaer is a 22-year-old man from Madaba, Jordan. 

He has a party supply shop and he is requesting a loan of 1,500 Jordanian Dinars (JOD) to purchase chrome chairs for parties instead of the ones that he rents from outside. 

Thaer is looking to expand his business by purchasing more supplies and moving the shop downtown.

loans.use: To purchase chrome chairs for the shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase cattle and fodder

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en:
Sabah is a 28-year-old married woman from Madaba, Jordan. She sells blankets from her home and she is requesting a loan of 500 Jordanian Dinars (JOD) to purchase more. 

Sabah is looking to increase her family's income.

loans.use: to purchase more blankets from Aqaba

loans.name: Araz

texts.en:
Araz is a hardworking father who is responsible for taking care of his wife and two children. His family is the driving force for his work. Every day, early in the morning, Araz leaves to take care of his farmland, which he irrigates and fertilizes so his crops will produce. When the harvest comes, he can sell good quality products to increase his income.  His monthly income is about 350 USD and his wife and children also help him with his business. He has seven years of experience in this field. 

Araz is requesting a 900 AZN loan to buy seed, fertilizer, and other necessary supplies for cultivating his family’s land and increasing crop production. This will be his second loan and he has a good credit history.

loans.use: purchase seed, fertilizer, and tools

loans.name: Sikilo Ouest Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sikilo   est né depuis la création du banc villageois portant le même nom en 1998. Il est composé de 27 femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Adama,(assise en troisième de la  gauche vers la droite), est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 59 ans, est mariée et mère de 07 enfants. Elle vendeuse d’articles divers au marché de son quartier.  Activité qu’elle pratique depuis plus de 05 ans.

Avec ce prêt elle compte acheter des vêtements pour enfants en vu des les revendre durant la rentrée des classes.

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge alimentaire et scolaire.
texts.en:
The Sikilo group was established after the creation in 1998 of the banc villageois which has the same name. The group is made up of 27 women who all live in the same neighborhood. Their main activity is small-scale retail. 

Adama, (seated, third from the left) is the group's leader. She is 59 years old, married, and the mother of 7 children. For more than five years she has been selling various items at the local market. With this loan she plans to buy children's clothes to re-sell at the beginning of the school year. The profits will allow her to help her husband in paying for food and education.

loans.use: to buy children's clothes to re-sell at the beginning of the school year.

loans.name: Rana

texts.en:
Rana is 26 years old. Together with her husband, she has raised three children. Rana is an experienced bread baker. She has been doing this business for more than five years. She bakes the traditional bread at home. Having many customers, Rana is selling the majority of her products just from her home. Her monthly profit from selling bread is about $200. 

Now, Rana is requesting a loan of 1,500 Azerbaijani New Manats (AZN). She is good client of AqroInvest, and once before, she had a loan from Kiva through AqroInvest. She is planning to purchase flour, which is the basic requirement of her business, at a wholesale price. AqroInvest CU has been a fundamental part of Rana´s business, having provided loans that have been used to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase flour.

loans.name: Chancel Yannick

texts.fr:
Client de27 ans, il se lance dans la vente des habits ' il y'a de cela 10 ans , celibataire sans enfant, a la fin de ses etudes universitaires , n'ayant pas pu trouve du travail il se lance dans la vente des habits hommes , comme les vestes, pantalons en jeans, polos, et tous habits a la mode , selon la saison.
Il a fait de ce commerce son travail, il vend en moyenne 40.000 frs a 90.000 frs par jour;
Etant deja un client qui a beneficie de 3 prets , a son quatrieme cycle, il veut renforcer le stock de ses vetements en achetant des pantalons en lin, jeans, gabardine, des chemises a la mode et tous ce dont qu'interesse les hommes.
Il rembourse avec succes et a l'intention de faire des grosses epargnes et toujours en respectant les regles de gestion apprises sur le journal de caisse et la gestion de stocks.
Il a deja commence a faire des voyages pour aller acheter a l'etarnger et Cotonou, tres fier de lui , il a pour ambition d'ouvrir un grand magasin a pret a porter.
texts.en:
This 27-years-old client has run a clothes selling business for about ten years. He is single, with no children, and after graduating from college, as he could not find a job, he started selling menswear, such as jackets, trousers, jeanswear, polo shirts, suits and all fashionable items, depending on the season. With this business he makes a daily revenue between 40,000 and 90,000 francs.
This is his fourth loan as he already benefited from three previous ones. His intention is to increase his stock by purchasing linen trousers, jeanswear, gabardines, fashion shirts and other men fashion items. 
So far he has succesfully paid back and intends to make large savings and always follow the rules of business and inventory management learned through the community bank journal.
He has already begun to travel to buy supplies abroad as well as in Cotonou. Very proud of himself, he hopes to open a ready-to-wear fashion store.

loans.use: to purchase trousers, jeanswear, shirts, t-shirts, marinier style shirts, polos, jackets

loans.name: Sare Sahara / Kawral Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe kawral a été créé en juillet 2008  lors de l’inauguration leur banc villageois. Il compte 14 femmes qui habitent toutes le même village. Elles font toutes le petit commerce.

Madame Mariama(assise à l’extrême droite), est responsable. Elle est âgée de 53 ans, est mariée et mère de 08 enfants. Elle a en charge  une belle fille.

Elle vendeuse de lait caillé dans les marchés  hebdomadaire aux environs de son village. Activité qu’elle exerce de puis plus d’une décennie.


Son prêt va lui permettre de mieux s’approvisionner en lait pour la revente.

Les bénéfices lui serviront et de soutenir son mari dans les charges familiales et d’augmenter son épargne.
texts.en:
The Kawral group was formed in July 2008 just after the local credit association was founded. The group is made up of 14 women who all live in the same village. They are all sales women by trade. 

Madame Mariama (sitting on the far right) is the group leader. She is 53 years old, married, has 8 children, and also has a step-daughter in her care. She sells curds in the weekly markets in the nearby towns, and has been involved in this trade for over a decade. 

Her loan will enable her to purchase milk for re-sale. The profits that she generates will enable her to support her husband with the family expenses, and to put some money aside as savings.

loans.use: to purchase milk for re-sale

loans.name: Sakit

texts.en: Sakit is a hard-working, persistent entrepreneur from Agsu. Three years ago he decided to try opening his own small grocery sales business. Today, his business is successful and he is looking to expand it further. Sakit has requested a loan of 1000 Azerbaijanian Manat (AZN) so that he can purchase additional items for his store. He plans to increase the variety of items which are in high demand. Sakit is married and has two children. One of his goals for his business is to be able to help his children as much as he can.

loans.use: purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Alovsat

texts.ru: Alovsat rodilsya v 1978 qodu. Uje 8 let kak on zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. Alovsat jenat i imeyet 2 detey kotoriye uchatsya v shkole. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmete so svoyey jenoy i lubimimi detmi. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva molochnogo produkta, On delayet sir, yogurt i kefir iz moloka, prodayet ix v magazini.
texts.en: Alovsat was born in 1978.  He has been involved in animal husbandry for eight years and breeds cattle.  Alovsat is married and has two children, both of whom attend school.  He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the town of Fuzuli and now lives in the Fuzuli region together with his wife and beloved children.  Alovsat currently needs 2000 AZN to buy cattle in order to increase the volume of milk product.  He makes cheese, yogurt and buttermilk from milk, and sells these products to stores.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Maarif

texts.en:
Maarif is 47 years old, married, and is the father of three children. He is a hard-working man who has fought to provide for his family and educate his children. 

Maarif is an enterprising man who constantly tries to do things better and to improve, day after day. He works hard in his fields where he spends as much time as possible providing the necessary care, fertilizing his land and spraying to prevent diseases that might affect his yield, which is $150 currently. He sells his crops in the Agsu central bazaar.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Elshan

texts.en:
Elshan is married with two children. He has been involved in animal husbandry for more than five years. Elshan is an honest, smart and conscientious person. He buys and sells cattle and he learned this business from his father and grandfather, who were in the same business before him. Elshan observed and helped them and now his wife and son help him.

Elshan is requesting a 900 AZN loan to buy livestock and expand his business and increase his profit. He wants to provide for his family and maintain good living conditions for them.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and fodder

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha is a 33-year-old female from Madaba, Jordan. She is married and a mother of three children.

Maha is doing jameed (traditionA. food made from yoghurt) from home and selling it to the neighbors and family.

Maha is requesting a loan of 600 JD to purchase raw materials needed to make jameed.

Maha is looking to improve her family's living conditions by increasing her income.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make jameed

loans.name: Emina

texts.en:
Emina is 53 years old and is single without children. For more than ten years, she has run a shop in Agsu city where she sells clothing for women and children. Emina’s brother helps her to run the business. 

Emina is requesting a 1,000 AZN loan to purchase additional seasonal clothing and expand her business. She promises to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Fidaa'

texts.en:
Fidaa' is 32 years old and is married with four sons and two daughters. She is a conservative woman so her husband is photographed instead in her grocery store. Fidaa’s husband runs a billiard game store and earns a decent income. Fidaa' runs a grocery store but does not have enough money to increase the variety of items she sells.

Fidaa’ is requesting a loan from FATEN to purchase grocery items to increase her competitiveness and profit. This will improve her family’s living conditions. She will repay her loan on a monthly basis.


About this loan:

FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items to sell

loans.name: Mammadaga

texts.en:
Mammadaga is 53 and married with two children. Since he was a child, he has dedicated himself to the cattle and sheep breeding industry. He has been described as a very spirited and strong person whose successes are directly applied to his family. Mammadaga raises livestock to sell. His business provides the only income to support his family and they really need it. His monthly profit is 200 USD and his wife helps to raise and look after the cattle and sheep. 

Mammadaga is requesting an 800 AZN loan to purchase more livestock.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and sheep

loans.name: Watheq

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 31 years old, married and a father of one child. He lives with eight family members.

Watheq has owned a market since 2002, selling foodstuffs, household items and accessories. He has more than seven years of experience, and he has a deep understanding of local consumers. He has a good reputation and he is well-known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $3000 loan in order to purchase a diesel generator and to add more products for his market. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a diesel generator and to add more foodstuffs for his market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase items to sell in his shop

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is from Iraq. He is 23 years old, married, and has two children.

Ali has worked in the seed and fertilizer trade since 2009. He sells rice, and all kinds of grain and wheat. He has sufficient experience in this field and a good reputation. His shop is situated in a crowded area where there are many customers passing by.

He decided to apply for $2400 loan in order to renovate his shop’s floor and walls, and to add additional items. He aims to gain more profits in order to enable himself to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to renovate his shop’s floor and walls, and to purchase additional items.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 50 years old; he is married and has seven children. To earn a living, he does carpentry. He has been in the business for six years and has employed three people. He also does farming to boost his income.  

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to manage his business well. Charles has requested 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy timber, nails and velvet.

loans.use: To buy timber, nails and velvet.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 32 years old, married and the father of two children.

Ahmad has owned a market since 2004, selling foodstuffs, household items and accessories. He has more than seven years of experience and he has a deep understanding of local consumers. He has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $2,500 loan in order to purchase a diesel generator and to add more items for his market. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a diesel generator and more items for his market.

loans.name: Sawsan

texts.en:
Sawsan is a 33-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan. 

Sawsan is doing embroidery from home and is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase raw materials such as beads and cloth.

Sawsan is looking to expand her business and customer base so that she can increase her family's income and improve their life conditions..

loans.use: To purchase beads and cloth

loans.name: Nawras

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 29 years old, married, and lives with her husband and four children.

Nawras has been a tailor since 2008. She makes, repairs, and alters clothing professionally, including suits, coats and trousers for women, men and kids. She has good experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers and knows about their needs. She has a good reputation and she is becoming well known in her surrounding areas.

She is requesting $1,200 to purchase an industrial sewing machine and to add more supplies like buttons, zippers and thread. She is aiming to gain more profits to offer her the opportunity to provide a better life for her family as a whole.

loans.use: To purchase an industrial sewing machine and to add more supplies like buttons, zippers and thread.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase shirts, ties, polos, t-shirts and socks.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen, a 28-year-old married father of a two-year old child, has been selling fruits and vegetables for seven years now, employing two people to assist him. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Stephen has learned how to save his money and has been trained in business management skills. This has helped him to run his enterprise well.

Hoping to grow it into a wholesale operation, Stephen is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy more vegetables and fruits to sell.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Safa'a

texts.en:
Safa'a is a 39-year-old female from Al Hashmi, Jordan.

Safa'a is designing web pages and she is requesting a loan of 400 JD to purchase a personal computer.

Safa'a started her business at nternet cafes. Then she purchased her own computer and started her own business from home.

Safa'a is looking to train her husband and some of her sisters to make web pages and she is willing to update her PC and purchase a laptop.

loans.use: to purchase a personal computer

loans.name: Suleiman

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 43 years old, married, and lives with his wife and three children.

Suleiman has been an owner of an herbal shop since 2010. Selling and preparing medicinal herbs and natural herbs, including herbal teas and seeds, he has more than ten years' experience in the types of herbs and their benefits. He has a good reputation, and his shop is situated in a crowded area where there are a good number of customers passing by.

He is requesting a $1,000 loan in order to pay the annual rent for his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a furniture-making machine.

loans.name: Wassim

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 30 years old, married, and a father of one child.
