Wassim has been the owner of a bookshop since 2007. He also has a photocopier in his shop and he sells stationery. He has more than four years' experience in this field and a good reputation. He is well known, and his shop is situated in a crowded area where there are a lot of customers passing by. 

He decided to apply for a $3,000 loan in order to purchase a color photocopier and a generator. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a color photocopier and a generator.

loans.name: Nadzua

texts.en:
Nadzua is a single woman with two children. One of her children attends school while the other is all grown up. She has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

She has operated a livestock purchasing and selling business for the past four years; her potential clients are local customers. She faces a major challenge of transportation. She dreams of expanding the business to a point of selling cattle in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase more goats for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access business loans.

loans.use: To purchase more goats for sale

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 26 years old, married, and the father of one child.

Hussein has been the owner of a barber shop since 2004. He has more than 7 years' experience, and he has a deep understanding of local consumers. He has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $3,000 loan to renovate and fix his shop’s ceiling, doors, and floor. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: To renovate and fix his shop’s ceiling, doors, and floor.

loans.name: Atheer

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 25 years old, married, and lives with his wife and five family members, two of whom also work.

Atheer has been the owner of an electronics games shop since 2010, such as play station and other games for teenagers and children. He has 2 years' experience in this field. He decided to open his business because it’s easy and profitable. He has a good reputation, and his shop is situated in a crowded area where there are a lot of customers passing by. 

He is requesting a $2,000 loan in order to fix and repair his shop’s ceiling and floor. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunities to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to fix and repair his shop’s ceiling and floor.

loans.name: Mohssen

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 53 years old, married, and a father of one child who works with him.

Mohssen has been the owner of a bakery since 2010. He produces and sells flour-based food baked in an oven, such as bread, cakes, pastries and pies. He has sufficient experience in this field and a good reputation. His bakery is situated in a crowded area where there are a good number of customers passing by.

He is requesting a $2,000 loan in order to purchase two stone ovens and barrels for oils. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase two stone ovens and barrels for oils.

loans.name: Hanadi

texts.en:
Hanadi is a 40-year-old married woman from Irbid, Jordan and she has two children.

Hanadi is requesting a loan of 1,000 JD to purchase a sweing machine and she is looking to purchase more new machines for her shop so that she can help with her children education.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Hamlet

texts.en:
Hamlet was born in 1965. He lives in Vanadzor city with his family, which consists of his wife and three children: two daughters and a son. Hamlet’s elder daughter graduated from Vanadzor branch of Yerevan teachers' training institute last year, his younger daughter is a pupil, and his son now is getting a higher education in Yerevan.
 
Hamlet’s specialization is electrical engineering, but he has never worked in his specialty. Hamlet runs his own business where he produces jewelry. He has equipped a room in his home where he has been working more than 20 years. Hamlet performs not only private orders but also sells his production to his regular customers from the Vanadzor gold market.   

Thanks to his business, Hamlet supports his family and pays for his son’s education. He was able to buy the necessary furniture for his home and to pay for his elder daughter’s education. 

This is Hamlet’s second loan from Nor Horizon and now he is asking for a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy materials for his business.

loans.use: To buy gold and other materials for his business

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance is a married woman with five children. Four of the children attend school and one is too young for school. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to providing the family's basic needs. She has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

She has operated a vegetable grocery business for the past five years. Her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of transportation. She dreams of establishing a bigger vegetable grocery in the future.

With the KSHS 30,000, she wants to purchase a grocery stand and to buy small packets of Omo detergent for sale. She decided to join Yehu to acquire working capital.

loans.use: To purchase a grocery stand and small packets of Omo detergent to sell

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 27-year-old married man, father of one child, living with his precious family in Ain.

Ali has been working at furniture making for 15 years, and this long experience gave him customers' trust. Ali opened his own factory in January 2011 and he is working hard on improving it. Ali's customers have big faith in him, because he started this business very early; he was very young when he learned this job which gave him a special touch.
 
He is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to  buy necessary machines and tools for his business. This is Ali's first experience as Al Majmoua borrower, so he is looking forward to investing future loans in expanding his business more and more through buying updated machines.

To help with his family's income and expenses, Ali also own a school bus which he works on during the school season, and he is working hard on improving this business as much as he can.

loans.use: To buy necessary machines and  tools for his business.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 60 years old, married, and the father of six children.

Hussein has been the owner of a bakery since 2006. He produces and sells flour-based food baked in an oven, such as bread, cakes, pastries and pies. He has sufficient experience in this field and a good reputation. His bakery is situated in a crowded area where there are a good number of customers passing by.

He is requesting a $2,800 loan in order to pay the annual rent and to buy an electric dough machine. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent and to buy an electric dough machine.

loans.name: Esha

texts.en:
Esha is a single woman with one school-going child. She lives in a rental house with electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and house rent. 

She has operated a beauty salon for the past three years; her potential clients are friends and relatives. She faces a major challenge of competition from other beauty salon operators. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase a blow dryer and cosmetics for her business. She decided to join Yehu because it offers a variety of loan products.

loans.use: To purchase a blow dryer and cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for purchasing new home furniture to replace the old.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 34-year-old married woman from Madab, Jordan and a mother of four children. She has been doing embroidery from home and she is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase raw materials needed for her business.

Mariam is looking to improving her business and increasing her family's income.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials needed for her business.

loans.name: Maytham

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 25 years old, single, and lives with parents.

Maytham has been the owner of a fabric shop since 2009, selling various types of fabrics suitable for furniture and curtains.  He has sufficient experience in this field from his previous work. He has a good reputation and his shop is situated in a crowded area where there are a lot customers passing by.

He is requesting a $3,000 loan in order to pay the annual rent for his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his shop.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is a 43-year-old married woman from Madaba, Jordan.

Aisha sells clothes from her home and she is requesting a loan of 800 JD to purchase more clothes.

An aspiration of Aisha's is to customize a room at her home to sell the clothes from.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is a married woman with no children. Her husband is a businessman who helps provide for the family's basic needs. She has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and paraffin. 

Nyamvula has operated a retail shop for the past twenty-eight years, and her potential clients are her neighbors and passersby. Transportation is a major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 80,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sugar bags and bales of corn flour. She decided to join Yehu because of the development with already existing clients.

loans.use: To purchase sugar bags and bales of corn flour.

loans.name: Inshirah

texts.en:
Inshirah is a 50-year-old woman, and she is married with one daughter. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. He is also a taxi driver. 

Inshirah wants to help her husband repair and paint the taxi, but the amount of money she has isn't enough. So, she needs to take a loan from FATEN. When Inshirah gets the loan, she will be able to help her husband repair and paint the taxi. This will improve the taxi's condition and enable her husband to work extra hours to increase the family's income which in turn will improve the family's living conditions. Inshirah is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed next to the taxi the family owns.


About this loan product:

FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: To pay for repairing and painting the taxi.

loans.name: Kumria

texts.en:
Kumria is a 26-year-old woman who lives in Sana'a, Yemen. She obtained a secretarial diploma after high school. She is single and lives with her parent and two sisters who are all totally dependent on the income of Kumria's business to cover their living expenses.

Kumria started her business, which is selling stationery and beauty supplies as well as antiques and gifts, three years ago exactly after her high school. The idea of the business came to her as a result of the difficult living conditions she and her family faced and the ambition of overcoming such a difficult life. Kumria sold some pieces of gold that were available to her family and borrowed from her relatives in order to make up capital when she began her business.

Kumria took a loan of 80,000 Yemeni Rials from Al-Amal Bank in order to purchase more stationery supplies for the new school year as well as to purchase other beauty materials in order to meet the demand of her clients in her neighborhood.

In the future, Kumria plans to expand her business by opening a new independent business in beauty supplies. She is also saving for her sister, who is studying in a private university.

loans.use: to purchase stationery and beauty supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a deep freezer, fryer, and utensils.

loans.name: Najah

texts.en:
Najah is a 41-year-old married woman, a mother of four and she is from Madab, Jordan.

Najah is requesting a loan of 600 JD to purchase mobile prepaid cards in order to sell them on installments.

An aspiration of Najah's is to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions.

Due to culturA. issues, Najah refused to upload her picture, so her husband appears in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase prepaid mobile cards

loans.name: C 1904 Turwubake Group

texts.en:
Daphrose is 44 years old and married with six children, ages eight to eighteen years old. She also takes care of two people. She is the leader of this group which is called “TURWUBAKE” in the local language.  She is in the middle in the white dress. 

Daphrose sells animals like cows, small fish, chicken, etc., and she has been working for three years. She currently employs one person to help her, and her business is open from 6 am to 6 pm every day.

Daphrose and her group have requested a loan from the Kiva lenders in order to expand their businesses and to purchase many animals such as cows, small fish, chicken, etc. to sell. With any profits from the loan, Daphrose and her team would like to satisfy the basic needs of their families, reinvest in their businesses, and start saving for their futures.

loans.use: To purchase many animals such as cows, small fish, chicken, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
Mishi is a married woman with eight school-going children. Her husband is a teacher who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Mishi has been a food vendor for the past seven years, and her potential clients are her friends and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of fluctuating prices of commodities in the market. She dreams of owning a hotel in the future.

With the 30,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, corn flour, beans and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu because of the low loan interest rates and variety of loan products.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, corn flour, beans and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase dozens of diapers, baby jackets, knitted goods, blankets, bedsheets and clothespins.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman with six children, three of whom attend school and the other three are grown-up. Her husband is a businessman who helps provide for the family. She has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 

Asha has operated a tailoring shop for the past fifteen years, and her potential clients are her neighboring community members. Seasonality is a major challenge as demand is high during the holidays. She dreams of establishing a dress-making college in the future.

With the 50,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase clothing material for her business. She decided to join Yehu to get working capital.

loans.use: To purchase clothing material for her business.

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en:
Abeer is a 35-year-old married woman from Madaba, Jordan and she is a mother of five children.

Abeer is requesting an educationA. loan of 300 JD to finance her son's education.

Due to culturA. issues, the client refused to upload her picture so the man in the picture is her son.

loans.use: to educate her son

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 31 years old, married and has a 4-year-old child. She sells eggs to earn a living. She previously sold vegetables. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Esther has improved her business because she has been trained in business management skills. Esther hopes to open other outlets of her business in the future. She has requested a loan of 30,000 KES to open a retail shop.

loans.use: To open a retail shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ready-to-wear outfits for children and women, and also shoes.

loans.name: C1907 Abagamijiterambere Group

texts.en:
Josiane, 29 years old, is married, has four children between 3 and 7 years old and takes care of one person. She is the leader of this group called “ABAGAMIJITERAMBERE” in the local language. Josiane has been selling various good such as rice, sugar, salt, flour, etc. for seven years. In the photo, she is the second person on the left in the first row. 

Josiane and her group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to expand their businesses and purchase more goods to sell. With any profits from the loan, Josiane and her team would like to satisfy their families' basic needs, reinvest in their businesses and start saving for their future.

loans.use: To purchase various good such as rice, sugar, salt and flour

loans.name: C1903 Abisunganye Group

texts.en:
Prisca, 25 years old, is married and has four children between the ages of 8 and 16 years old. She is the leader of a group called "ABISUNGANYE" in the local language. Prisca (in green clothes in the middle of the photo) has 10 years of experience selling shoes. Her business is well-organized. She works from 6 a.m. until 7 p.m. every day.

Prisca has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more shoes. With any profit, Prisca and her team will be able to save for the future and pay school fees for their children.

loans.use: To purchase shoes to resell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a single woman with two children who attend school. She lives in a rental house with electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Grace has operated a business selling tea leaves for the past three years; her potential clients are her friends, neighbors and relatives. She faces a major challenge of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business. Grace plans to use this KES 20,000 loan to purchase tea leaves for sale. She decided to join Yehu because of low loan interest rates.

loans.use: To purchase tea leaves for sale.

loans.name: Abdi

texts.en:
Abdi is a hardworking 30-year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with two children. For the last three years, Abdi has been operating a taxi business to support his family. In the next 5 years, he wants to become successful in his business.

Abdi is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES to buy insurance for his vehicle. Since he decided to join Faulu Kenya, Abdi has been able to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To buy insurance

loans.name: Marvin Antonio

texts.es:
Marvin, continua trabajando con préstamos, los cuales necesita para fortalecer el negocio y comprar la materia prima para el comedor y  la pupuseria, de esa forma podrá tener más ingresos económicos. Lo que necesita comprar es carnes, arroz, aceite, bebidas (gaseosas y jugos), todo pues, para atender de manera eficiente a la clientela.
El sueño de Marvin, ampliar su negocio, mejorar en sus ganancias y que su familia tenga una mejor vida.
texts.en: Marvin continues working with loans, which he needs to strengthen his business and buy the ingredients for his restaurant, and in this way he will be able to earn more income. He needs to purchase meats, rice, oils, beverages (soft drinks and juices) and other items to tend to his customers efficiently. Marvin's dream is to expand his business, increase his revenue and for his family to have a better life.

loans.use: to buy furnishings and materials to prepare for his food sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To  buy medicine

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
La formación el presente comité inicio gracias a una D. las miembros, ella Contacto con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en la Zona. Ellas tienen actividades diferentes algunas emprenderán una nueva labor y cuentan con un  ingreso fijo. El comité se Denomina Mujeres Luchadoras están en el Tercer Ciclo   con 15 integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas, solidarias  y responsables entre ellas, las mismas poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor para realizar actividades para el Grupo.
Una D. las miembros es la señora Mercedes, quien se dedica a la venta D. ropa hace ya un tiempo, nos dice que por medio D. su trabajo y sacrificio ella ha podido salir adelante y ayudar a su familia. Una D. sus metas es seguir creciendo por medio D. su negocio, lo cual podrá hacer invirtiendo en el.
Solicita el crédito para la compra D. prendas D. todo tipo, como ser remeras, pantalones y demás, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
The formation of this existing committee came about thanks to one of its members. She contacted her neighbors and friends in order to start this local committee. They have different business activities. Some have started a new venture while others have an established source of income. This committee is named “Mujeres Luchadoras” (Women Fighters) and is starting its third loan cycle with 15 members. The group is known in its neighborhood for being unified, supportive, and responsible. The members possess a great entrepreneurial spirit as they engage in their group activities.

One of the members is Sra. Mercedes, who has been selling clothes for some time. She says that through her work and sacrifice, she has been able to move forward and help her family. One of her goals is to continue growing through her business, so she wants to be able to invest in it. She is requesting a loan to buy clothing of all types such as t-shirts, trousers, and other items so that she can restock her inventory and satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to purchase clothing of all types to sell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is married and blessed with two children, both of whom attend school. For the last two years, he has been managing a retail shop to support the family. Peter also rents out houses for more income. In the next 5 years, he wants to become an employer. Peter is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to buy sugar, cooking fat, rice and soap for resale.

loans.use: To buy sugar, cooking fat, rice and soap

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian is a hardworking 47-year-old businesswoman. She is married and blessed with two children who are still in school. For the last nine years, Lilian has been selling fried groundnuts to earn a living. She previously sold fish. In the next 5 years, she wants to manage a cereal shop. Lilian is requesting a loan of 30,000 KES to buy groundnuts for her business. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to embrace the culture of saving.

loans.use: To buy groundnuts

loans.name: Ana Luz

texts.es:
Ana, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijas 10 y 4 años, ella se dedica a la elaboración de  hamacas, este oficio lo aprendió debido a que no hay trabajo y que su familia todos hacen este oficio, trabaja todos los días no tiene un horario establecido ya que en su casa las elabora.
El préstamo lo necesita para comprar más materia prima: hilos de seda y  cáñamo, debido a que sus clientes le piden un pedido de varias hamacas, por eso tiene que tener suficiente materia prima para poder cubrir la demanda del producto.
El sueño de Ana es mantener siempre a sus clientes y tener más ingresos, y en el futuro mejorar su casa y darle lo necesario a su familia.
texts.en:
Ana lives with her husband and two daughters, ages 10 and 4. She makes hammocks and learned this trade because there are no jobs. Her entire family engages in this business. Ana works every day, but she does not have a set schedule. She works out of her home.

Ana needs this loan to buy more materials, such as silk and hemp thread. Her customers have placed orders for different hammocks, but she does not have enough materials to meet the demand for her product. Ana’s dream is to always have customers so that she can earn more income. In the future, she wants to improve her home and provide for her family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy materials such as silk and hemp thread for making hammocks.

loans.name: Philister

texts.en:
Philister is married and has three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has no electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over one year, Philister has operated a business selling fish at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high transportation costs. Philister dreams of expanding her business in the future. She plans to use this KES 20,000 loan to purchase bundles of fish for resale. Philister decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To open another outlet of his business.

loans.name: C 1681 Turwanyubunebwe Group

texts.en:
Marguerite, 42 years old, is married and has seven children between 2 and 16 years old. She is the leader of this group called “TURWANYUBUNEBWE” in the local language. Marguerite has operated a business selling Irish potatoes for twenty years.

Marguerite has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to expand her business by buying fertilizer to grow the potatoes to sell. With any profits from the loan, Marguerite and her team would like to satisfy their families' basic needs, reinvest in their businesses and start saving for their future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to grow potatoes  for sale.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a retail shop selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. The high cost of transportation is a major challenge for Nancy. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 30,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, corn flour, sugar and tea leaves for her retail shop. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, corn flour, sugar and tea leaves for her retail shop.

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
Dominic is a married man and blessed with four children. For the last fifteen years, he has been selling clothing to earn a living. He has employed one person to help him manage the business. 

In the next five years, he wants to manage a wholesale business selling used clothing. He is requesting a loan of 30,000 KES to buy men's trousers to sell. Since he decided to join Faulu Kenya, he has been able to educate his children and improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy men's trousers to sell.

loans.name: C 1683 Turwanyubukene Group

texts.en:
Charles is 53 years old and married with seven children between eleven and twenty years old. He is the leader of the group called "TURWANYUBUKENE" in the local language, which means "fighting poverty." This group is commonly known for selling Irish potatoes. 

Charles has been in this business for about thirty years, and his business hours are from 6 am until 8 pm every day. He currently employs three people to help him. Charles is the last person on the left side of the picture.

Charles and his team have requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to cultivate more Irish potatoes to sell. With this loan, Charles and his team will hopefully earn more profit, which in turn will allow them to keep reinvesting in their business for better financial stability. In addition to that, they will continue improving their families' lifestyles, and they will be able to buy cows to fertilize their fields.

loans.use: To cultivate more Irish potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Cipriano

texts.en:
Cipriano is a married man who is blessed with four children, all of whom attend school. For the last nineteen years, he has been quarrying to make a living. He also farms to increase his income. 

In the next five years, he wants to become the supplier of vegetables and building stones in his region. He is requesting a loan of 100,000 Kenyan shillings to buy insecticides and fertilizer. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to embrace the culture of saving.

loans.use: To buy insecticides and fertilizer.

loans.name: Virgen Del Pilar Group

texts.es:
El Comité D. Mujeres D. nombre Virgen del Pilar se conformó en fecha en el año 2008, con mucho esfuerzo ya  se encuentran en el octavo ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa. Además del trabajo independiente D. cada una, también desarrollan actividades en forma conjunta  para recaudar fondos con el fin D. contar con un capital dentro del grupo, a la vez se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos que es la D. trabajar para apoyar económicamente a sus familias en especial.
La D. la Sr. Flavia se dedica a la venta D. comidas D. toda variedad, nos comenta que mediante su trabajo  pudo mejorar bastante su actividad y su nivel D. vida e ingreso económico. Dice que D. a poco y gracias a su esfuerzo y con la ayuda D. su marido ella ha podido crecer en su negocio.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. los insumos para la elaboración D. los alimentos que prepara, como ser carne, pollo, condimentos y demás.
texts.en:
This Women’s Committee is named “Virgen del Pilar” and was established in 2008 with great effort. The members are in their eighth loan cycle and have worked together in a united fashion as part of the program. In addition to each of their independent businesses, they also developed fundraising activities in which they have worked together in order to accumulate capital for their group. They help one another so that they can accomplish their objectives, which includes providing financial support for their families.

Sra. Flavia sells all types of food. She says that through her work, she has been able to improve in her activities, her standard of living, and her financial income. Flavia says that thanks to her efforts and with the help of her husband, she has been able to grow her business a little bit at a time. She is requesting a loan to buy supplies for preparing her dishes such as meat, chicken, condiments, and other items.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, condiments, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Jesús Nazareno Group

texts.es:
El comité llamado Jesús Nazareno está integrado por 17 mujeres muy trabajadoras. Formaron su grupo ya que le encanto la forma D. trabajar D. sus vecinas que forman parte D. otro grupo. Comentan que son conocidas en el barrio por la buena organización que tienen.
Una D. las miembros es la señora Enriqueta, quien es la Presidenta del grupo, comenta que todo su esfuerzo es por darle a su familia una vida digna y decorosa, sin privaciones como las que ella tuvo que pasar. Ella se dedica a la venta D. ropa, comenta que tiene muchos clientes que siempre compran D. ella, tiene muchos pedidos con los que le gustaría poder cumplir.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. prendas como ser camisas, pantalones y demás, lo cual le ayudará a cumplir con los pedidos D. sus clientes.Ella como las integrantes están muy satisfechas con los créditos que recibe D. la fundación, porque gracias a ello pueD. ir aumentando sus ingresos y D. esa manera ayudar al sustento D. su hogar.
texts.en:
This committee is called “Jesús Nazareno” and consists of 17 hardworking women. They started this group because they liked seeing their neighbors who were part of another group and how they worked. They say that they are known in their neighborhood for being well-organized.

One of the members is Sra. Enriqueta, who is the President of the group. She says that all of her efforts are focused on providing her family a decent and dignified life without the hardship that she had to endure. Enriqueta sells clothing. She says that she has many customers who always buy from her. They have many orders, so she would like to be able to fulfill them.

She is requesting a loan to buy clothes such as shirts, trousers, and other items so that she can complete the orders from her customers. Like the other members, Enriqueta is very satisfied with the loans she has received from Fundación Paraguaya. Thanks to the loans, she has been able to increase her income and help sustain her household.

loans.use: to buy clothing for eventual resale.

loans.name: Kodzo Atsu

texts.fr:
Kodzo est un homme âgé de 22 ans. Il est marié à une ménagère et n’ont pas encore d’enfant.
Kodzo travaille comme tôlier depuis 2007. Il répare des voitures cabossées ou rouillées en changeant les tôles et les peintures à toutes les personnes désireuses, et son garage se trouve à quelques mètres du site de la foire Togo 2000 à Lomé. Il achète ses approvisionnements sur place à Lomé.
Kodzo a requis son deuxième  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des tôles et des peintures pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Il veut réinvestir les revenus supplémentaires de son travail dans l’achat d’un terrain. 
Dans les prochaines années, Kodzo voudrait agrandir son garage de tôlerie. Il dit qu’avec les profits, il prévoit de fonder une famille heureuse.
texts.en:
Kodzo is a 22-year-old man. He is married to a housewife and has no children. Kodzo has been a sheet metal worker since 2007. He repairs dented and rusted cars by replacing the sheet metal and paint for anyone who needs it, and his garage is located a few meters from the site of the Togo 2000 fair in Lomé. He buys his supplies on-site in Lomé.
Kodzo is requesting his second loan through WAGES to buy sheet metal and paint to better satisfy his customers. He wants to reinvest any additional profits into his business and buy a plot of land. 
In the coming years, Kodzo would like to increase the size of his sheet metal working garage. He says that with his profits, he plans on creating a happy family.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal and paint.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is a married man with five children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, he has operated a business selling coconuts at the market and door-to-door to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in his business. He dreams of establishing a wholesale shop to sell his products. 

With the 10,000 KES loan, he wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Wardja

texts.fr:
Wardja est un homme âgé de 34 ans. Il  est marié à une couturière et père de 3 enfants. 
Wardja travaille comme chauffeur depuis 2007. Il  conduit un taxi interurbain destiné aux déplacements des passagers de Lomé et ses environnants. Il travaille seul et sa difficulté principale du moment est que sa voiture a une panne de moteur.
Wardja a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter un moteur pour la réparation de sa voiture. 
Dans les prochaines années, Wardja voudrait voir sa voiture travailler sans panne. Il dit qu’avec les profits, il prévoit rendre sa famille heureuse.
texts.en:
Wardja is a 34-year-old man. He is married to a dressmaker and has 3 children.
Wardja has been a chaffeur since 2007. He drives a taxi and transports passengers from Lomé and the surrounding areas. He works alone and his main difficulty for the moment is that his car's motor has broken down.
Wardja his requesting his second loan through WAGES to buy a new motor for his car. 
In the coming years, Wardja would like for his car to work without breaking down. With his profits, he plans on making his family happy.

loans.use: to buy a new motor.

loans.name: San Blas Group

texts.es:
El comité llamado San Blas, es D. la Ciudad D. Caacupé, está integrado por 14 mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras, que día a día luchan por poder darle a sus familias todo lo mejor. Ellas son todas vecinas y amigas D. esa ciudad, todas son muy conocidas en el barrio por el trabajo en conjunto que realizan.
La señora Irma es la presidenta D. dicho comité, vive con su marido e hijos, se dedica a la venta D. ropas. Formó parte D. su grupo ya que es la primera vez que alguien se acerca a ofrecerle una ayuda para aumentar sus ingresos. Comenta que por medio D. su trabajo logra ayudar a su familia con los gastos D. la casa.
Ella solicita el crédito para el abastecimiento D. su negocio por medio D. la compra D. ropas, con lo cual podrá cumplir con sus clientes y tener más variedad.
texts.en:
This committee is named “San Blas” and is from the city of Caacupé. It consists of 14 hardworking and determined women who strive day after day to proviD. all the best for their families. They are all neighbors and friends who live in the city. All of them are well-known in their neighborhood for the work they perform together as a group.

Sra. Irma is the president of this committee. She lives with her husband and children. Irma sells clothes. She joined this group because someone, for the first time, offered her assistance with increasing her income. Irma says that through her work, she has been able to help her family with the household expenses.

She is requesting a loan for restocking her business, so she will buy clothes in order to complete the orders from her customers and offer them more variety.

loans.use: to buy clothing for eventual resale.

loans.name: Holalie

texts.fr:
Holalie est une femme âgée de 27 ans. Elle est célibataire. 
Holalie travaille comme une revendeuse depuis 2007. Elle achète et revend des produits de beauté de femmes genre les laits corporels, les parfums, les maquillages, les tissages à toutes ces clientes au marché de Hédzranawoé à Lomé. Elle achète les produits auprès des grossistes de Lomé. Elle travaille  seule.
 Holalie a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter ces produits de beauté. Elle veut avec ses revenus supplémentaires, agrandir sa marchandise.
 Dans les prochaines années, Holali voudrait avoir une grande boutique. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit avoir une vie heureuse.
texts.en:
Holalie is 27 years old and single. She has been working as a trader since 2007 and sells feminine beauty products such as body lotions, perfumes, make-up and hair weaves. She sells her merchandise at the market of Hédzranawoé in Lomé, and buys her products from the wholesalers in town. She works alone.

Holalie is requesting her first loan from WAGES so that she can restock on beauty products. She plans to use her extra revenue to expand her product range and, sometime in the next few years, would like to own a large shop. She will use her profits to live a happy life.

loans.use: to restock on beauty products.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr:
Ablavi est une femme âgée de 43 ans. Elle est divorcée et mère de 3 enfants.
Ablavi travaille comme une revendeuse depuis 2004. Elle est à la fois restauratrice, revendeuse de maïs et d’haricot à toutes les personnes nécessiteuses dans un quartier.  Elle achète ses produits auprès des grossistes de Lomé. Son véritable problème du moment est sa faible capacité financière.
Ablavi a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des sacs de maïs et d’haricot, des produits nécessaires à la restauration. Elle pense utiliser les profits supplémentaires de ses activités pour offrir une bonne éducation aux enfants. 
Dans les prochaines années, Ablavi voudrait agrandir son commerce. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit  rendre sa famille heureuse.
texts.en:
Ablavi is 43 years old,  divorced and the mother of 3 children. She has been working as a retailer since 2004, selling corn and beans to customers in her area, and also owns a restaurant. She buys her products from the wholesalers in Lomé but is currently suffering from a lack of adequate funds.

Ablavi is requesting her third loan from WAGES in order to buy bags of corn and beans that she needs for her business. She plans to use any additional profits she earns to pay for her children´s education. Over the next few years, she wants to expand her business and plans to use the profits to make her family happy.

loans.use: to restock on cereal, etc.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Maria tiene ya más de cuatro años dedicándose a la venta de ropa usada y nueva. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para invertir en comprar ropa de inviernos para mujeres, hombre y niños ya que sus clientes le están solicitando este tipo de mercancía, antes de que llegue el invierno ya estar preparados.
Doña Rosa Maria es madre soltera y tiene dos hijas bajo su responsabilidad y a  quienes que terminen una carrera profesional. 
Desea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio ya que los gastos familiares y escolares sean cubiertos con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo como maestra. 
La señora Rosa Maria ya ha tenido un crédito con KIVA el cual pago puntual, espera contar con su cooperación para este préstamo que será para invertir en su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa Maria has been selling new and used clothing for more than four years. She is requesting a loan to buy winter clothing for women, men, and children. Her customers want to be prepared, so they are requesting this type of merchandise before winter arrives.

Doña Rosa Maria is a single mother and has two daughters who are her responsibility. She wants them to finish a professional degree. Rosa Maria wants to repay this loan using the earnings she generates from her business. The family and school expenses are covered by the salary she receives from her job as a teacher.

Rosa Maria has already had one loan with Kiva which was repaid on time. She hopes to have assistance with this loan so that she can invest in her business.

loans.use: to buy winter clothing for women and men.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is a married man with seven children, four of whom attend school. Three have already graduated from school. He owns a house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees for his children.

For the past eleven years, he has operated a retail shop, selling to his neighbours and passersby. He also operates a butcher shop, where he sells meat and roasts goat meat for customers. He faces a major challenge of price fluctuation in his business. He dreams of expanding to meet his customers' needs in the future.

With the 100,000 KES loan, he wants to purchase goat meat for his butcher shop. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase goat meat for his butcher shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to restock on fabrics including silk, cotton, satin, cotton piqué, linen and terylene.

loans.name: Aboudala

texts.fr:
Aboudala est un homme âgé de 34 ans. Il est marié à une revendeuse de céréales et ont ensemble 2 enfants.
Aboudala travaille comme un revendeur depuis 2009. Il est restaurateur dans son bar-restaurant. Il sert à ses clients des plats de spaghettis, de riz et de pâtes à base du maïs à Lomé. Il achète ces produits d’approvisionnement au marché de Hédzranawoé à Lomé.
Aboudala a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des boissons et d’aménager son bar-restaurant. Il pense avec ces profits supplémentaires, s’acheter un terrain.
Dans les prochaines années, Aboudala voudrait agrandir son bar-restaurant. Il dit qu’avec les profits, il prévoit avoir une famille prospère.
texts.en:
Aboudala is a 34-year-old man.  He is married to cereal retailer and the couple have two children together.

Aboudala has been working as a retailer since 2009.  He manages a bar-restaurant which he owns.  He serves his customers spaghetti, rice and corn-based pasta dishes in Lomé.  He buys his supplies in the Hédzranawoé market in Lomé.

Aboudala has requested his first loan from WAGES in order to buy drinks and to fit out his bar-restaurant.  He plans to use the additional profits he makes to buy a plot of land.

In the coming years, Aboudala would like to expand his bar-restaurant.  He says that, with the profits he makes, he expects to have a prosperous family.

loans.use: to buy drinks and to fit out his bar

loans.name: Tapiracuai Poty Group

texts.es:
El comité Tapiracuai Poty se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la comunidad. Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo y sobre todo demuestran mucho entusiasmo para emprender algo nuevo. Actualmente el grupo cuenta con 14 integrante, donde todas ellas trabajan dentro de un ambiente de mutua cooperación y ayuda.
Una de las miembros es la señora Miguelina, ella se dedica a la venta de ropas de todo tipo, como ser pantalones, remeras, camisas y demás. Comenta que por medio de su trabajo ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia y paliar los gastos que diariamente surgen en el hogar.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas para la posterior venta, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The committee “Tapiracuai Poty” was established as a result of several neighbors from the community joining together. The members have formed a very unified and capable group in which they work together in activities to strengthen their camaraderie. Above all, they have demonstrated great enthusiasm as they start this new endeavor. The group currently has 14 members who all work in a spirit of mutual cooperation and helpfulness.

One of the members is Sra. Miguelina. She sells clothing of all types such as trousers, t-shirts, shirts, and other items. She says that through her work she has been able to move her family forward and provide for the daily household expenses. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy clothes for eventual resale so that she can restock her inventory and fulfill the orders from her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothes for eventual resale.

loans.name: Odo Trust Bank Group

texts.en: Esther is 44 years old. She is divorced and has three children. She has been selling roasted plantains and yams at Nyamebekyere, a suburb of Berekum, for the past two years. She deems it a big opportunity to expand her business. She wants to use the loan to buy more yams and plantains to increase her inventory. She hopes to improve sales so she can save more for her children’s education and also add another business. Esther belongs to the community group called “ODO” which means Love Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to the loan and support one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase plantains and yams in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cosmetics for resale from a catalog of beauty products she represents

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise, such as used clothing and basic grains.

loans.name: Lucia Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Lucia Elizabeth es casada, tiene 20 años de edad, cursó los nueve años de educación,  no tiene hijos, se dedica a la atención a una tienda de consumo en general, inició este trabajo junto con sus padres y ahora lleva 2 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su conyugue quien se dedica al comercio a la venta de ropa.

solicita un créditos para utilizarlo en la compra de cosas para la tienda, dulces, golosinas, aguas gaseosas, jugos, lácteos, etc. Espera en el futuro ver su negocio grande.
texts.en:
Sra. Lucia Elizabeth is 20 years old, married, and finished nine years of her education. She does not have children. Lucia manages a store where she sells general consumer products. She started this business with her parents and now has two years of experience. Lucia has the support of her husband, who is a clothing merchant.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy products for her store such as candy, sweets, water, sodas, juices, dairy products, and other items. She hopes to see her business get bigger in the future.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a machine for pumping water

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha, necesita un nuevo préstamo para mejorar su capital de trabajo, tener lo necesario de materia prima; hilos de seda de diferentes colores,ella esta muy contenta porque los prestamos le han ayudado para mejorar su negocio y mantener materia prima para la produccion.
texts.en: Martha needs a new loan to increase her working capital. She needs raw materials and silk thread in different colors. She is very happy because the loans have helped her improve her business and have raw materials for making products.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make hammocks, such as silk thread, wood canes, and cuffs.

loans.name: Octaviano

texts.es:
El Señor Octaviano tiene 52 años y está casado con la Señora Hermogena que tiene 43 años, ellos tienen 2 hijas de 26 y 16 años.
El Señor Octaviano se dedicaba a la venta de frutilla ambulante, un día decidió comprar dos cajas de media y vender juntamente con la frutilla, las dos cajas de media las vendió en medio día, como le fue muy bien con las medias decidió seguir con esto. El Señor Octaviano en la actualidad ademas de tener su pequeño puesto de ventas donde vende todo tipo de cosas, como ser billetera, lentes de sol, pilas, cintos de cueros, remeras. Mas adelante quiere seguir ampliando su stock de los productos que vende.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de billeteras, lentes de sol, pilas, cintos de cueros, y demás para la venta en su negocio.
texts.en:
Octaviano is 52 years old and is married to Hermogena who is 43 years old. They have two daughters who are 26 and 16 years old. 

Octaviano made his living as a street vendor selling strawberries. One day he decided to buy two boxes of stockings and sold them along with strawberries. He sold the two boxes of stockings in half of a day. Since it went very well with the stockings, he decided to continue with this. Currently Octaviano, in addition to having his small stand where he sells all types of things such as wallets, sunglasses, batteries, leather belts, and t-shirts, would like to expand his stock of products sold.

He is requesting a loan to buy wallets, sunglasses, batteries, leather belts, and other things to sell at his business.

loans.use: to purchase wallets, sunglasses, batteries, leather belts, and t-shirts.

loans.name: Tania Carolina

texts.es:
Tania, solicita nuevamente un préstamo, porque lo necesita para incrementar su negocio para tener variedad y tener más clientes, y aumentar en sus ganancias; comprara mariscos en distintas especies, pescado, camaron, filetes.
Ella ha logrado mantenerse en el negocio a traves de los prestamos, ya que son oportunos y rapidos.
texts.en: Tania requests a new loan because she needs it to grow her business in order to have more variety and more clients and to increase her profits. She will buy different types of shellfish, fish, shrimp, and fillets. She has been able to stay in business due these loans, since they are timely and fast.

loans.use: to buy seafood like shellfish, fish, shrimp, and fillets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bundles of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Spirit Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
In a group of eight men, Samuel, aged 37, is the leader who sees to it that the group accesses the loan capital, organizes them for group meetings and ensures that all repayment schedules are met accordingly.

Samuel is the father of three children (a set of triplets) who are aged 7. He has already secured admission for them in one of the basic schools in the locality where they live.

As the bread winner, Samuel works very hard to ensure that the needs of his family are adequately met. He is a trader who deals in electrical appliances of all sorts.  It is his desire to put his children on a higher pedestal in life in terms of academics and business so as to make life less difficult for them. 
Having been in the trading business for one year, Samuel intends to save and acquire an additional two shops to expand his business.

Since trading is a source of livelihood to many in most communities in Ghana, the Spirit group members are all into all kinds of trading activities.
The group requests a loan to enable them to procure goods and raw materials in bulk to revamp their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase electronic appliances

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming products.

loans.name: Rolando Elias

texts.es:
Rolando, se dedica a vender trapeadores (de toalla y de tela) el mismo los elabora junto con su esposa, tambien vende CD Y DVD, ya tiene siete años de hacer este oficio,  todos los días salen a venderlos en los pueblos cercanos de lunes a domingo solo que van a cada pueblo el día de comercio.
El préstamo lo necesita para comprar materiales: toalla, tela para elaborar trapeadores, CD Y DVD, teniendo más surtido el negocio y venderlos con más facilidad, y de esa manera podrá obtener más ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia.
El propósito de Rolando es tener un negocio en un puesto estable y siempre mantener la elaboración de trapeadores, de esa forma la familia mejorara su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rolando sells mops (terry-cloth and clothe), and he makes these together with his wife. He also sells CDs and DVDs and has been doing this for seven years. They go to the surrounding villages to sell them every day, from Monday to Sunday, but they only go to each village on market day. 

He needs the loan to buy materials: cloth and terry-cloth to make mops, CDs and DVDs. By having more stock in the business and selling it more easily he will be able to get more income to support his family. 

Rolando’s goal is to have a business in a stall and to keep on making mops. In this way the family will have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy terry-cloth and cloth to make mops.

loans.name: Absa

texts.fr: Habitant dans une ville située à l'ouest du Sénégal,son activité principale est le commerce.Ce prêt est destinée à l'achat de produits halieutiques (poissons fumées, poissons séchées) et d'autres produits de mer pour les revendre sur le marché local. Vue que son activité marche bien, elle veut augmenter son pouvoir d'achat pour mieux répondre à la demande des clients. Elle veut aussi appuyer son mari sur les dépenses quotidiennes de la maison avec le bénéfice qu'elle a dans son commerce
texts.en: This borrower lives in a town in the west of Senegal.  Her main business activity is buying and selling.  She will use this loan to buy fish (smoked fish and dried fish) and other seafood to sell in her local market.  As her business is doing well, she would like to increase her purchasing power in order to better respond to her customer demand.  She would also like to support her husband in covering their daily household expenses through the profits that she makes in her business.

loans.use: to buy fish and seafood

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN ANTONIO” el banco se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad de Huanchac, en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.
La  socia Marcia; tiene 43 años de edad,  la socia es casada; la socia tiene 2 hijos; la socia es Licenciada en Turismo de profesión y después de trabajar por muchos años en el área de hotelería, la socia decidió independizarse y abrir su propia empresa de eventos, la socia tiene una empresa encargada de decorar, de la música y animación, de los aperitivos, de los platos de fondo, de las cenas elegantes, de los matrimonios, de bautizos, de cumpleaños y de todo evento que se diese en la bella ciudad D. Cusco, la socia es muy experimentada en cuanto a diversos buffet para toda ocasión y a la ambientación de los locales que se escojan para los eventos a realizarse ella ve cada detalle y sus trabajadores son muy profesionales.
La socia desea el crédito para invertir en su empresa y comprar copas nuevas para vino blanco, vino rojo y agua. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de copas.
La socia Cleofe es la sra que esta en la parte superior la encontre en su lugar de trabajo porque ella estuvo de viaje.
Los otros socios desean invertir en sus diferentes negocios como tienda de abarrotes, estudios, en gastos personales.
La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
M.ía belongs to the "San Antonio" communal bank, which is located in the community of Huachac, in the province and department of Cusco. M.ía is 43, married, and has two children. 

She has a university degree in Tourism Management, and after working for many years in the hotel industry, she decided to become independent, and open her own event planning company.  Her company takes care of the decorating, the music and the entertainment, the appetizers, and the main dishes, for elegant dinners, weddings, baptisms, birthdays, and every event that is held in the beautiful city of Cusco. 

She is very experienced with regard to different buffets for every occasion, and in the settings chosen for the holding of events. She sees to every detail, and her workers are very professional. She wants the loan in order to invest in her business and to buy new glasses for white wine, red wine, and water.  

Cleofe is the woman shown in the upper part of the photo, pictured in her place of work, because she was on a trip when the photo was taken. 

The other members wish to invest in various businesses, such as a grocery stO., and to pay for education and personal expenses.   

M.ía is grateful for the support she has been granted and is committed to making her instalment payments on time.

loans.use: To buy glasses for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Elena ya ha tenido crédito con KIVA el cual ha sido para invertir en su negocio. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para invertir en comprar más mercancía de ropa para niño, bebes, dama y juguetes nuevos. Ya que no cuenta con el capital necesario y no quiere descapitalizar al negocio. 
Doña Rosa Elena es viuda y sus hijos ya están casados, este ingreso es el que tiene para salir adelante. 
Con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio planea pagar el crédito ya que sus hijos le ayudaron a pagar sus gastos personales. 
Espera contar con su cooperación en este préstamo ya que es muy importante invertir, antes de que llegue la navidad.
texts.en:
Rosa Elena has already had loans with Kiva, that she has used to invest in her business.

She is applying for another loan to buy more merchandise, such as children's, women's and baby's clothing, as well as new toys.  This is because she  doesn't have the necessary working capital, and doesn't want to take capital out of the business. 

Rosa Elena is a widow, and her children are already married. This income is what helps her move forward. With the earnings she gets from her business, she plans to pay off the loan, since her children have helped her pay for her personal expenses. 

She hopes to have your cooperation in this loan, since it is important for her to buy merchandise before Christmas arrives.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as clothing and toys, to sell in her business.

loans.name: John Group

texts.en:
Esther is the leader of a trust bank group made up of six women and a man. She sees to it that the group accesses the loan amount, organizes them for group meetings and ensures that all repayment schedules are met accordingly.

Esther is a mother of six children between 1 and 15.  According to her, all but the last born are currently in school.
She works very hard to support her husband in providing for the family. She is a food vendor. Esther has run a chop (food) bar for four years.

She desires to establish a modern restaurant and educate her children to the university level.

Since trading is a source of livelihood to many in most communities in Ghana, others members of the group are into all kinds of trading activities.
The group requests the loan to enable them procure goods and raw materials in bulk to revamp their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients

loans.name: Patricia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Patricia, esta soltera vive con sus padres tiene un tienda de productos básicos: arroz, azúcar, frijoles, el negocio lo tiene en su casa por eso no tiene un horario establecido para a tender  a sus clientes de lunes a domingo.
Necesita el préstamo para fortalecer  su negocio y comprar arroz, azúcar, jabón, detergentes ofrecerles más variedad a sus clientes y poder obtener más ingresos.
El propósito de Patricia surtir más su negocio, tener más variedad y aumentar en sus ganancias, de esa forma ayudar a sus padres para los gastos de la casa.
texts.en: Patricia is single and lives with her parents. She has a store with basic goods: rice, sugar, and beans. She runs the business out of her home and for that reason she doesn’t have set hours in order to serve her customers between Monday and Sunday. She needs a loan to strengthen her business and to  buy rice, sugar, ham, and detergents, to offer more variety to her customers, and to be able to get more profits. Patricia’s goal is to further stock her business, to have more variety, and to increase her income. That way she can help her parents with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, ham, and detergents for her business.

loans.name: Nely

texts.es: Nely  de 53 años es viuda y tiene un hijo en la edad de 30 años. Ella vive al suroccidente de Barranquilla donde  vende mercancía variada, negocio que inició cuando por la necesidad de generar ingresos, su amiga le dejó una mercancía para que la vendiera y ganara dinero; allí empezó su aventura de negocios, que ha extendido hasta el día de hoy,  con la comercialización de una gran variedad de productos que compra directamente y muchas veces mediante guías especializadas. Su negocio crece diariamente porque su clientela se ha fidelizado y hace pedidos a los que no puede responder oportunamente, esa es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará nuevas líneas de productos como prendas de vestir, que vienen en las revistas con grandes descuentos para el fin de año. Su sueño es tener una casa propia y ampliar su negocio para lograr mayores ingresos.
texts.en: Nely is 53 years old and a widow. She has a son who’s 30 years old. She lives southwest of Barranquilla where she sells various merchandise. She started the business because she needed the income. Her friend gave her merchandise in order to sell it and earn money. That’s how she began her business venture which has continued to this day with the purchase of a great variety of products that she buys directly and many times through specialty vendors. Her business grows every day because her clientele has been loyal, and they have orders that they cannot fill conveniently. That is the reason she comes to Kiva, first financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will buy new product lines like clothing that comes from catalogues with major discounts for the end of the year. Her dream is to have her own home and to grow her business and get better income.

loans.use: to buy clothing that comes from catalogues with major discounts.

loans.name: Jose Miguel

texts.es:
José de 51 años de edad, es soltero, vive en su casa propia, la cual cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Olmos que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

La actividad que desarrolla José es la agricultura, cuenta con sus propias tierras de cultivo donde siembra yuca y maíz, una vez que realiza su cosecha sus productos los ofrece a los diferentes mercados de Lambayeque – Chiclayo y así puede obtener ingresos para cubrir sus gastos de su hogar.  También cuenta con mototaxi, la cual trabaja medio tiempo, permitiendole obtener otro ingreso económico para su familia.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles para comprar fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras como su producto y para brindarle mantenimiento a su mototaxi, con la finalidad de obtener mejoras económicas para su familia.  José es un padre de familia que se preocupa por que los suyos tengan comodidades y mejores oportunidades para seguir saliendo adelante.
texts.en:
José is 51 years old, single, and lives in his own home which has running water and electricity. His home is in the rural district of Olmos which belongs in the Lambayeque department. This district is known for agriculture and animal breeding. 

José works in agriculture, and he has his own farm land where he grows yucca and corn. Once he harvests his products he sells them in different markets in Lambayeque – Chiclayo, and he’s able to make enough to cover his household costs. He also has a moto-taxi in which he works part-time, enabling him to get another source of income for his family. 

He has asked for a loan of 3000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy fertilizer to improve his fields as well as his crop. He will also do some maintenance work on his moto-taxi with the goal of improving his family’s financial standing. José is a parent who is concerned about whether those because those in his care have what they need and have better opportunities to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to improve his fields and crop and to do maintenance work on his moto-taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to restock on fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
María, vive con su esposo y tres hijos D. 9, 6 y 3 años, tiene una tienda D. productos básicos: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, café, detergentes, debido que hay mucha demanda D. clientes comienza su jornada D. 6 am a 7 pm, todos los días D. lunes a domingo. 
Ella necesita el préstamo para fortalecer su negocio y comprar más mercadería como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, gaseosa, boquitas, galletas y poder mejorar su inventario y obtener más beneficios.
El propósito D. María es siempre mantener su tienda surtida y D. esa manera mantener a sus hijos D. las ganancias que obtenga.
texts.en:
María lives with her husband and three children, ages nine, six, and three. She has a store where she sells staple products like rice, beans, sugar, coffee, and detergent. Due to her customers’ wishes, she begins her work day at 6 am and ends at 7 pm every day, Monday through Sunday.
She needs the loan to improve her business and to purchase more merchandise – such as rice, beans, sugar, soda, sweets, and cookies, and also to be able to improve her inventory and earn more profits.
María aims to always keep her store well-supplied, and in that way be able to care for her children with the profits she earns.

loans.use: To purchase rice, beans, sugar, soda, sweets, and cookies.

loans.name: Grupo Brisas 6 Group

texts.es:
Irene y su grupo Brisas 6, se encuentra ubicado en L. ciudad D. Santo Domingo, en una comunidad D. pocos recursos localizada al norte D. L. capital D. L. República Dominicana, ellos se dedicar a L. venta D. diferentes artículos como: Ropas, cosméticos, calzados, salones D. belleza, tienda D. comestibles, entre otros. 

Irene es casada y tiene 3 hijos, por los cuales trabajan arduamente para darle una vida estable. Sus sueños como familia es tener recursos suficientes para poder vivir bien y cubrir sus necesidades, tener un buen negocio que genere buenos ingresos para cambiar sus vidas a una mas prospera. 

Irene está muy emocionada D. recibir su tercer préstamo en Esperanza Internacional, sus anteriores prestamos han sido invertido en L. compra D. carnes, para su carniceria, especialmente D. cerdo para preparar tocino. ElL. está planeando comprar 100 libras D. carnes. Piensa utilizar los beneficios D. su negocio ahorrar y reparar su vivienda. Irene y todos los demas miembros del grupo, les dan las gracias por su apoyo!!!
texts.en:
Irene and her group, Brisas 6, are located in Santo Domingo in one of the poor areas north of the capital of the Dominican Republic.  They sell different articles such as: clothing, cosmetics, shoes, and have a beauty shop, a grocery store, etc,

Irene is married and has 3 children for whom she works very hard to give a stable life.  Her dreams for the family are to have enough resources so that they can live well and to be able to cover their needs.  She wants to have a good business that will generate a good income to change their lives to a more prosperous one.

Irene is excited to receive her third loan with Esperanza Internacional.  Her previous loans have been used to buy meat for her butcher shop, especially pork to make bacon.  She is planning on buying 100 pounds of meat.  She will use what she gets from her business to save and repair her house.  Irene and all the group members give their thanks for your support!!

loans.use: to buy meat

loans.name: Disciples Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
In a group of six members made up of five women and a man, Abena, aged 47, is the leader who sees to it that the group accesses the loan capital, organizes them for group meetings and ensures that all repayment schedules are met accordingly.

Abena is married and has five children who are between the ages of 10 and 17. She says all are in school.  Abena works very hard to support her husband in providing for the family. She is a food vendor and wants to use the loan to buy food stuffs and other ingredients in bulk.

She desires to build a house for her family.  Abena has been in the chop (food) bar business for four years.

Since trading is a source of livelihood to many in most communities in Ghana, the other group members are into all kinds of trading activities and food processing business.  The group requests a loan to enable them procure goods and raw materials in bulk to revamp their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients

loans.name: Milagros Del Pilar

texts.es:
Milagros de 21 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijo en su casa propia,  cuenta con servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona rural del departamento de Piura.  Toda esta zona sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Milagros se dedica a la elaboración, venta de chicha de jora (es una bebida rica elaborada a base de maíz y  muy consumida en el norte del Perú), esta actividad lo realiza desde hace varios años, ya que es una costumbre que ha pasado de generación en generación. Últimamente se ha incrementado la venta de la chicha de jora en la zona donde vive, lo que le ha favorecido para poder incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  

Teniendo la oportunidad de crecer Milagros a solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de harina de maíz para la elaboración de chicha de jora,  con la finalidad de obtener mayores ganancias y así sus clientes aumenten, para solventar el crédito otorgado y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Milagros is twenty-one years old and lives with her husband and child in their own home which has light and water service in the rural region of the Department of Piura. All the inhabitants of this region make a living through agriculture, ranching, and handicrafts.

Milagros makes and sells chicha de jora (a tasty beverage made from corn and very popular in northern Peru). She has been doing this for several years, since it is a custom handed down from generation to generation. Lately, chicha de jora sales in the region where Milagros lives have increased, which has allowed her to be able to increase her revenue and improve her family’s quality of life.

Having the opportunity to grow, Milagros has requested a loan of 1000 PEN [$375] from Edpyme Alternativa to purchase a greater quantity of corn flour to use to prepare chicha de jora. Her goal is to earn greater profits and also increase her customer base. In this way she can repay the loan awarded and improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase a greater quantity of corn flour to use to prepare chicha de jora.

loans.name: Deggo De Seguel Group

texts.fr: Deggo de seguel est un groupement constitué de 5 femmes. Elles habitent dans la même localité et leur activité principale est le commerce. Deggo est représenté par Madame Astou qui évolue dans le secteur du commerce de fruits (clémentine )  depuis plus de 15 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants. Elle est est membre de l'un des guichets de l'U-IMCEC et sollicite un crédit de 250 000 prévu pour l'achat de fruits  qui seront destinés a la vente. L'objectif recherché est le développement de son son activité de commerce ainsi que celui des membres respectifs du groupe. Elle souhaite accroitre ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie sociale de sa famille en soutenant son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes du foyer.
texts.en: This group is made up of five women. They live in the same town and their principal activity is sales. Deggo is represented by Madame Astou, who has been in the fruit-selling business (clementines) for the past 15 years. She is married and the mother of 7 children. She is a member of one of UIMCEC's branches, and is asking for a loan of 250,000 francs in order to buy fruit to resell. Her objective is to grow her business as well as the business of the other members of her group. She hopes to increase her revenues and improve the living conditions of her family by supporting her husband in the management of day-to-day household costs.

loans.use: To purchase fruit for resale

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria de 35 años de edad, vive con su familia en casa de sus padres, cuenta con los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona urbana del distrito de San Pedro de Lloc que pertenece al departamento de La Libertad.  Esta zona es agrícola y ganadera.

Gregoria se dedica a la preparación y venta de humitas (productos que se realiza a base de maiz fresco), su producto lo prepara en su domicilio, desde hace 8 años,  cuenta con su propia clientela y tambien realiza pedidos y con los ingresos que obtenga podra cubrir sus necesidades familiares.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa  de 1000 nuevos soles para la compra de insumos, con el fin de seguir elaborando sus humitas,  para ofrecerle a sus clientes y así obtiene ganancia para tener una mejor calidad de vida.  Gregoria es una mujer de empuje, trabajo y dedicación que loúnico que desea es que sus hijos sean cada vez mejores para salir adelante en la vida.
texts.en:
Gregoria is thirty-five years old and lives with her family in her parents’ house, which has basic services and is located in the urban district of San Pedro de Lloc in the Department of La Libertad. This is an agricultural and ranching region.

Gregoria prepares and sells humitas (products made from fresh corn). She has been preparing her product in her home for the past eight years, has her own customer base, and also fills special orders. With the revenue she earns, she is able to cover her family’s necessities.

She has requested a loan of 1000 PEN [$375] from Edpyme Alternativa to purchase ingredients to continue preparing humitas, and to be able to offer them to her customers. In this way, she will earn profits and have a better quality of life. Gregoria is a driven, hard-working, and dedicated woman, and all she desires is that her children continue to benefit from her efforts and get ahead in life.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients, such as fresh corn, to continue preparing humitas.

location.town: San Pedro de Lloc - Pacasmayo - La Libertad

loans.name: Azucena Margarita

texts.es: Azucena,esta nuevamente solicitando préstamo, que lo utilizara para surtir y tener más variedad de verduras y comprar: repollo, lechuga, cebolla,tomates, de esa forma tendra productos frescos para  los clientes, estos prestamos le han ayudado para mantenerse en el comercio de frutas y verduras, fortaleciendo esta fuente de ingreso.
texts.en: Azucena is requesting a new loan to buy a wider variety of vegetables to have available such as: cabbage, lettuce, onions, and tomatoes so she can offer fresh produce to her customers.  These loans have helped her stay in the fruit and vegetable business by strengthening her source of income.

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Word Of God Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
In a group of 10 made up of nine women and a man, Augustine, who is 53 years old, leads the group to access the loan capital. He also organizes them for group meetings and ensures that all repayment schedules are met accordingly.

Industrious Augustine is the father of six children who are between 8 and 20 years old. He says all are currently in school.  As the bread winner, Augustine works very hard to ensure that the needs of his family are adequately met. He is into poultry farming.  It is his desire to give all of his children the best education he can afford.  Having been in the poultry rearing business for three years, Augustine intends to save and put up a building to house his family.

Most of the group members are into all kinds of trading activities.  The group requests for a loan amount to enable them to procure goods and raw materials in bulk to revamp their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase poultry feed

loans.name: Segundo Guillermo

texts.es:
Segundo de 47 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en el distrito de zaña que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.  Los pobladores de ésta zona se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y turismo.

Segundo  maneja su mototaxi (transporte que se utiliza para movilizarse en distancias cortas, con un cupo máximo de 3 personas) desde hace algunos años aproximadamente, está actividad lo realiza en la misma zona donde vive, a pesar de la gran cantidad de personas que realizan el mismo trabajo, él trata en lo posible, desde muy temprano movilizar una buena cantidad de pasajeros a sus diferentes destinos, y así pueda tener mayor cantidad de ingresos para solventar sus gastos y necesidades de su hogar.
