texts.en: Mrs. Lim is 52 years old and married with four children. Three of her children are already married and have started new families of their own. Mrs. Lim earns a living by runing a pig fattening business in the Kompong Thom province of Cambodia. Lim is borrowing some funds from Kiva through HKL to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Lim is working hard toward her dream. She wishes to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. 
Merlita has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages .
Merlita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Merlita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is from the village of Bugallon. She is 39 years old, married and has three school-aged children. She owns and operates a retail store in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 18 years.

She joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Janet is requesting a loan of 18,000 PHP to purchase grocery items such as canned goods, biscuits and other ingredients to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees for her children.

loans.use: purchase grocery items such as canned goods, biscuits and other ingredients to sell.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 4 children. 
Rogelio has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. He has had this business for 11 years. He requested a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages .
Rogelio has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future,Rogelio hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 41 years old, married and has four children.  To make a living, Leonida has been managing her sari-sari store for ten years. She earns about P120 (Philippine Peso) a day for these activities.

According to her, through the income generated from her business, she has been able to give daily allowances to her children in school.

She wishes for a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, and biscuits to sell in her sari-sari store. In the future, Leonida hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, and biscuits to sell

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en:
Vergie is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 
Vergie has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Vergie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future,Vergie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Ronelie

texts.en: Ronelie is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with four children.  Ronelie has a pigpen that sells grown and matured pigs.  She has had this business for nine years.  She requested a loan for PHP 9,000 to buy animal feed for the pigs.  Ronelie has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Ronelie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy animal feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Kang

texts.en: Mr. Kang is one of the villagers of Kompong Speu province who has been engaged in the agricultural business since 1979. He would like to expand his farming business. However, due to the lack of capital to buy cows for plowing, Kang could not run his business operation well. Therefore, Mr. Kang would like to request a loan to buy cows for plowing the rice crop as well as other crops. With Kiva’s loan, Mr. Kang hopes that he’ll able to develop agriculture and make more income. Mr. Kang lives together with his wife and three daughters who are now working as garment factory workers in Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

loans.use: to buy cows for plowing the rice crop as well as other crops.

loans.name: Tesmaniada

texts.en:
Tesmaniada is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 
Tesmaniada has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages .
Tesmaniada has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Tesmaniada hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Teresita has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Teresita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Teresita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for her store.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 7 children. 

Judith has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 11 years. She requested a loan for 11,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Judith has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Judith hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy the raw ingredients needed for making snacks and viands.

loans.name: 03.03.94 Thiệu Trung Thiệu Hóa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lai works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Lai is 53 years old and married with 3 children. She is the group leader of the 94 Thiệu Trung solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. She lives and works in Thiệu Hóa district, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.

In 2005, Lai joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Lai has successfully repaid 6 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Lai has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Lai faces in her business is a lack of capital.

With her business profit, Lai hopes for her business to do well, to buy land of her own, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Anargul's Group

texts.en:
Anargul is the leader of this group. She is 45 and married to a taxi driver. Together with her husband, she is raising three daughters. The older daughter works in Russia, the second is a student, and the youngest daughter is pre-school aged (under seven). Five years ago, Anargul purchased two cattle and since that time she has been engaged in cattle breeding. Reselling cattle after fattening, she earns about 3000 soms per month.  With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase more cattle for breeding. In the future, Anargul plans to build a shed to keep cattle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Keo is a conscientious 35-years old woman.  She is married and has five children. All of her children are single, but some attend school. 

Keo makes products that help people produce fire, especially for housewives in and around the community.  She typically earns $1.50 per day.  Her husband is a policeman. 

Keo wants to obtain a $600 loan to purchase a second hand motorcycle for her husband, as well as for the use of her family. 

In the future, Keo plans to use her profits to expand her business and to repair her home.

loans.use: to purchase a second-hand motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Yahya

texts.en:
Yahya, a 27-year-old single man is living in a modest house that belongs to his grandparents. He has nine siblings. Some of them are married.     

Yahya owns a kiosk business selling various stocks such as instant noodles, sugar, soaps, candies, mobile phone credit recharge, lubricants etc. The business is located beside his residence. He has been running the business for one year. 

According to Yahya, the income generated from the business enables him to support his parents in covering their daily needs and benefits the community as well since the village is situated quite far from the town. Yahya plans to add more stock requested by the customers but he needs capital to do so. Therefore, Yahya is requesting a loan of IDR 10,000,000 from TLM. He would like to spend the loan on business stock such as rice, sugar, petrol and kerosene as well as to renovate his kiosk. Yahya is expecting that TLM will assist him by providing him with the loan.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, petrol, and kerosene and renovate his kiosk

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is from the village of Villa Concepcion, Cauayan, Isabela.  She is 41 years old, married with four children.  Nora has managed her retail store for many years.

According to Nora, the income generated from her business enables her to give daily allowances to her school-age children.

Now, she is requesting a loan P15,000 (Philippine pesos) to purchase additional stock, such as various snacks, canned goods and noodles to sell in the local community.  She hopes that she can get the loan she requested, to further develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items such as various snacks, canned goods and noodles to sell.

loans.name: Medie

texts.en:
Medie works hard every single day, because she wants to give her family a good quality of life.

She is 45 years old and lives with her family in the village of Villa Concepcion, Cauayan city, Isabela.  She hopes to maintain her business for the future of her family.

At this time, Medie aims to improve her retail store business but she doesn't have enough capital.  Therefore, she is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy grocery items such as coffee, sugar, canned goods and noodles to sell.  Medie hopes to maintain her business for the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy groceries items to sell.

loans.name: Bargek's Group

texts.en:
Bargek is the leader of this group. She is 63 and unfortunately, she is a widow.  Bargek has raised three sons, the youngest lives with her and the other two live independently.  

Eleven years ago with an initial investment of 5000 Soms,  Bargek purchased two animals and since then has been breeding livestock.  Reselling livestock after fattening, she earns about 3000 Soms per month.  

With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase more livestock for breeding, fattening and for further reselling.  

In the future, Bargek plans to purchase a piece of land to start building a house for her sons.


--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan is a rice farmer. She is the mother of two school-age children, who live with her. She has been farming with her husband for years, and this business is their sole source of income. 

They can make around $10 per day to support their family.  Chan has only a few plots of land for growing rice.  

By using Kiva’s loan, Chan wishes to buy additional farmland to gain more profits from their efforts.  Chan’s goal are to provide her children with better opportunities to join a university and to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy additional farmland.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha, 30, is a farmer who earns $3 per day.  Her husband earns $8 per day as a worker.  They have three children, one is studying and the other two are too young to be in school. 

Every month, she spends $83 on food, $5 on electricity, and $10 on other expenses.  Sokha requests a loan of $1000 to buy a hand tractor for farming that she can also rent to other farmers when they need to plow their fields. 

She used to lose money as a farmer, but doesn't want to change her career because Sokha doesn’t know what else she could do to earn a living.

loans.use: to buy a hand tractor for farming.

loans.name: Kuluipa's Group

texts.en:
Kuluipa is the treasurer of this group. She is 47 years old and married to a constructor. Together with her husband, she brings up two sons and two daughters. The older daughter works in Bishkek and the other children study at school. 

Six years ago Kuluipa saved 3000 soms from her salary and purchased two animals for breeding.  Since that time she has engaged in livestock breeding.  

At the moment, she plans to repair their house, but she needs additional funds to purchase building materials.  Kuluipa applied for a loan to make the repairs. 

In the future, Kuluipa wants to provide her children with a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase building materials to repair the house

loans.name: Rain

texts.en:
Rain, 42 years old, is planting yams and cashews with her husband.,  She earns $6 per day.  They have five children, two are studying and other three are working.  Each earns $3.50 per day.  

Every month, she has to spend $99 on food, $5 on electricity, $15 on school fees and $10 on other expenses.  

She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy cashews wholesale with the intent to resell at a profit.  

Before, she used to rent a plantation to grow her crop but she lost money.  Now Rain only buys wholeshale and can make a good income to her family. 

She wants to support her children's university education, so that they can have good jobs.

loans.use: to buy cashews wholesale.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha has successfully payed off her first Kiva loan and she and her family are doing very well. 

Mwanasha has decided to start a new business.  She requestss KES 40,000 to start a water distribution business, to purchase water tanks and taps for sale.

loans.use: to purchase water tanks and taps for her new water business.

loans.name: Rysbu's Group

texts.en: Rysbu is the leader of this group. She is 45 and married to a constructor. Together, they have raised two sons and a daughter. The older son earns money by providing mobile repairing services, and the other two children live independently from their parents. Eight years ago, with an initial investment of 15,000 soms, Rysbu purchased a cow; since that time, they have bred cattle for making additional money to meet the family's needs. With money received from the loan, she plans to purchase more cattle for breeding. In the future, she plans to purchase a piece of land to start building a house. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Nary

texts.en:
Nary, 55 years old, is a grocery seller who earns $5 per day. She is a single mother and lives at home alone because all of her children are working far from home. 

Every month, she has to spend $40 on food and $15 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,200 to buy more grocery goods to sell in her small store. Before, she was a tailor, but she quit to sell grocery items at home instead so that she could make more income.

loans.use: To buy more grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Sarn

texts.en: Sarn, 30 years old, is a garment factory worker who earns $3 per day. Her husband is a Tok Tok driver (a motorcycle-based taxi) who earns $7 per day. The couple has one 4-year-old son. Every month, Sarn has to spend $50 on food, $3 on electricity, $5 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $800 to buy a new Tok Tok for her husband's Tok Tok service. This loan will help her husband earn better income than before. She wants to repair her house when she has enough money.

loans.use: To buy a new Tok Tok (a motorcycle-based taxi)

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with three children, one of whom is attending school, while the other two are working. Her husband who is employed contributes to providing for the family's basic needs. She has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her child. 

She has operated as a food vendor for the past three years. Her potential clients are her neighbors and friends. She faces a major challenge of fluctuating prices of commodities in the market. She dreams of establishing a hotel business.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, maize flour, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu because of low loan interest rates.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, maize flour, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Bumarjan's Group

texts.en:
Bumarjan is the leader of this group. She is 38 and together with her husband, who works as an executive director of the wood factory, is raising four sons. All the children study at school. Bumarjan is engaged in livestock breeding. At the moment she keeps ten farm animals. With money received from the loan, she wants to increase the number of livestock. In the future she wishes to purchase a piece of land to build a house for the sons.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 10 children. 
Flordeliza has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages .
Flordeliza has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Flordeliza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To  purchase bundles of maize flour, sugar and cooking oil for his business.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 
Josefina has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Josefina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Josefina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley is a married man with two school-going children. He has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for his family and school fees for his children. 

He has operated a vegetable grocery for the past three years; his potential clients are his neighbors. He faces a major challenge of transportation. He dreams of expanding his business.

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to purchase vegetables for his business. He decided to join Yehu to get financial assistance through loan-taking.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables for his business.

loans.name: Reynalda

texts.en:
Reynalda is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.
 
Reynalda has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 26 years. She requested a loan for 15,000 Philippines pesos to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Reynalda has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Reynalda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Janneth

texts.en:
Janneth is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 
Janneth has a shop that sells soaps, detergents, canned goods & noodles. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 12,000 to buy soaps, detergents, canned goods & noodles for sale.
Janneth has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Janneth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy soaps, detergents, canned goods & noodles for sale

loans.name: Nasibahon's Group

texts.en: Nasibahon is the leader of this group. She is 54 and married to a driver, whose monthly salary is 3000 soms. Together with her husband, she has raised a son, who is 25 and works in construction. In 1994, Nasibahon purchased a piece of land, where she cultivates wheat and cotton. Selling some part of the harvest, she earns money for a livelihood. In this way she earns about 3,000 soms per month; this profit made it possible to repair the house and to purchase two cows for breeding. With money received from the loan, Nasibahon wants to purchase 200 kg of mineral fertilizers. In the near future, she plans to build a sauna. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children.
 
Helen has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 10,000 Philippines pesos to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Helen has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Helen hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Isha Adama

texts.en:
This is 36-year-old Isha Adama. She is a widow and has four children, aged 20, 18, 11 and 9 years; they are all school-going children. 

In 2003, Isha Adama inherited this provisions and syrups (medicine) business from her husband. For the past eight years, Isha Adama has successfully managed this business. 

"This business is the only thing my husband left for me; it is the only source of livelihood for me and my children,” said Isha Adama. 

Working seven days a week and 15 hours a day, she earns about 1,000,000 Sierra Leone leones (Le) every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le3,000,000. Isha Adama requires a loan in order to buy  peak powdered milk (one carton @ Le420,000), soft drinks (five crates @ Le30,000), stout drink (10 crates @ Le88,000), beer (five crates @ Le 49,000), pure drinking water (100 bundles @ Le3,000), and amoxicillin syrup (two cartons @ Le500,000). 

She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 250,000. In the future, Isha Adama plans to build a dwelling house and a shop, and support her children’s education. High transportation costs and inflation are her business challenges. Competition in her area of business is low. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy peak powdered milk (one carton @ Le420,000), soft drinks (five crates @ Le30,000), stout drink (10 crates @ Le88,000), beer (five crates @ Le 49,000), pure drinking water (100 bundles @ Le3,000), and amoxicillin syrup (two cartons @ Le500,000).

loans.name: Praxides

texts.en:
Praxides is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children.
 
Praxides has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Praxides has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Praxides hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.
 
Mary Jane has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 16,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Mary Jane has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Mary Jane hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Thelma has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Thelma has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Thelma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Foday

texts.en:
This is 47-year-old Foday. He is married and has four children, aged 19, 16, 15 and 13 years. In 1986, Foday established his used-clothing business. He began his business after moving from Kono (where mining is the main economic activity) to Makeni (where petty trading is the main business activity). 

Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about 1,200,000 Sierra Leone leones (Le) every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Foday has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy used clothing: T-shirts (two bales @ Le550,000), ladies blouses (two bales @ Le700,000), skirts (two bales @ Le650,000) and jeans jackets (one bale @ Le1,200,000). 

He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Foday plans to open a big shop and an account for his old age. He is excited and hopes to finish his building and educate his children. Competition is keen but he usually buys good products that meet his customers' demands.   

He is assisted by his family members, and he serves 50 customers per day because of his quality stock.  He travels to Freetown to buy his business stock by public transport. He is hardworking and honest. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy used clothing: T-shirts (two bales @ Le550,000), ladies blouses (two bales @ Le700,000), skirts  (two bales @ Le650,000) and jeans jackets (one bale @ Le1,200,000).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy animal feeds for the ducks and ducklings.

loans.name: Saidu Alie

texts.en: This is 42-year-old Saidu Alie. He is married and has five school-going children who are 5, 8, 12, 18 and 18 years old. In 2005, Saidu Alie established his essential drugs and provisions business. He began his business when he completed his certificate in Mental Health Counseling. As a health worker, he thought it wise to be dealing in essential drugs since in his area there is no drugstore. Working 7 days a week and 13 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan of Le 3,000,000. Saidu Alie requires a loan in order to buy Amoxicillin syrup - 1  box @ Le 500,000, Dexorange syrup - 10 bottles @ Le 100,000, mebendazole - 24 boxes @ Le 40,000, peak milk tins - 2 cartons @ Le 140,000, and cornflakes - 4 cartons @ Le 90,000. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 400,000. In the future, Saidu Alie plans to open another pharmacy and provision shop.  He is very excited and ready to battle to the top, he said. He wants his children to attain a higher learning certificate. Saidu Alie is assisted by his wife. He usually gets his goods from his supplier in Freetown twice a month and sometimes thrice, depending on the sales.  He always travels by public vehicle.  He is a hard working and consistent businessman.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more medicine for his pharmacy

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Evelyn has a duck pen where she raises and sells ducklings & duck eggs. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy animal feed for her ducks & ducklings.

Evelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Evelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for ducks & ducklings

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en: This is 27-year-old Kadiatu.  She is married and has three children who are 7, 5 and 2 years old. In 1999, Kadiatu established her imported foodstuffs business. She began her business out of the need to service the neighbors and provide a livelihood for her family. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,300,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of Le 5,000,000. Kadiatu has already received and successfully repaid three loans and now requires a new loan in order to buy more imported foodstuffs for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Kadiatu plans to continue providing support to her children.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for more imported foodstuffs for her business

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Nenita has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy raw ingredients for making snacks & viands.

Nenita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Nenita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks & viands

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en: This is 30-year-old Mamie.  She is married with three children who are 14, 7 and 2 years old. She has two additional dependents she cares for. They live with her because they are her late brother’s children. In 2005, Mamie established her clothing business. She began her business out of the need to cater for school uniforms. She gained experience from her sister who sells textiles. Working 6 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,200,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Mamie has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy additional clothing for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Mamie plans to improve the lives of her family. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
This is 41 year-old Kadiatu.  She is married and has 2 children aged 15 and 10. 

In 2008, Kadiatu established her house decoration business. She began her business because she wanted to be self employed and have a reliable means of helping her husband provide livelihood for their family. She takes care of decorations for houses. This business attracts a lot of customers. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,200,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Kadiatu has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to improve her stock. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. 

In the future, Kadiatu plans to move to a concrete shop in the city centre and educate her children on to university level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more decorations to sell

loans.name: Migue

texts.en:
Migue is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children.
 
Migue has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Migue has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Migue hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Samart

texts.en: Samart, 63 years old, is a flower tree seller who earns $6 per day. She is a single mother with two children and both of them are working as construction workers earning $9 per day for all. Every month, she has to spend $80 on food, $20 on electricity, and $50 on transportation. She would like to request a loan of $800 to buy construction material for her son doing construction work. She hopes that her son’s career will make better income so that he can support himself and the family also.

loans.use: To buy construction material for her son

loans.name: Borey

texts.en: Borey, 24 years old, is a garment factory worker who earns $4 per day. Her husband is also working in the factory earning $4 per day. They have four children. Two of the children are studying and the other two are staying at home. Every month, she has to spend $90 on food, $20 on electricity, and $40 on school fees. She would like to request a loan of $800 to buy a motorbike for traveling to work. She doesn’t want to change her job because she doesn’t have knowledge to do another job beside this. She wants to support her children to study and at least finish high school.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for travelling to work

loans.name: Dy

texts.en: Growing agriculture crops is the major economic sector of Cambodian people who live in Siem Reap province. One of them is Mrs. Dy, 64, who has been involved in agricultural business for ages. Mrs. Dy’s husband also has the same business as her, and they are working together on their existing farmland. They are blessed with three children, all of whom are attending a local school. Dy has grown mixed crops on her land such as rice, potatoes, corns and other kinds of beans. She is requesting a loan to buy mineral fertilizers, pesticide and a pumping machine to keep her crops growing well in good condition. In the future, Mrs. Dy wants to send all of her children to the college to become well-educated people.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers, pesticide and a pumping machine.

loans.name: Charlyn

texts.en:
Charlyn is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.

Charlyn has a food shop or carenderia that sells viands like adobo, caldereta and afritada. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy raw ingredients for making viands.

Charlyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Charlyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making viands.

loans.name: Sreyly

texts.en: Sreyly, 29, is a garment factory worker who earns $4 per day. Her husband is also working in the factory and earns $4 per day. They have four children; all of them are studying. Every month, she has to spend $70 on food, $15 on electricity, $40 on school fees and $12 on transportation. She would like to request a loan of $400 to buy some goods to sell to her co-workers. She saw the others sell goods in the factory and make some income, so she follows and she can get some profit from it. She wants to support her children to at least finish high school.

loans.use: to buy some goods to sell to her co-workers in the factory.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children.

Marilou has a tailoring shop that provides dress and uniform repairs. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for PHP 14,000 to buy raw materials needed for tailoring.

Marilou has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Marilou hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials needed for tailoring.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.

Delia has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Delia has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Delia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Desa

texts.en:
Desa is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Desa has a junk shop that buys and sells papers, bottles and metals. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy recycled papers, bottles and metals to sell.

Desa has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Desa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy recycled papers, bottles & metals to sell

loans.name: Salon

texts.en:
Salon is 29 years old and is a masseuse. She earns $4 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns $5 per day. They have three children, two are studying and one is too young for school. 

Every month, she has to spend $75 on food, $3 on electricity, $7 on school fee, $15 on transportation and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy a motorbike to travel to work. Her husband wants to extend his career and will buy more construction material when they have enough money. She wants to support her children to study so they can at least finish high school.

loans.use: buy a motorbike to travel to work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Jonalyn has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for eight years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Jonalyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jonalyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Gwendolyn

texts.en:
Gwendolyn is 37, married and has four school-age children. She owns and manages a variety store in their village to earn additional income. She wants to improve her business and increase her income to satisfy their needs and finance the education of their children. Despite problems and difficulties in life, they are striving hard to earn and save to give their children a better future.

She wants to ask for an additional capital of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, beverages, junk food, breads, soaps, seasonings and soft drinks to sell in her variety store. She believes that through this loan she will increase her product offerings and improve her business. She hopes that in the future, she will make her business grow as she continues to work and manage her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages, junk food, breads, soaps, seasonings and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida, 36, lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Nida has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, beverages and electronic loads from several networks like GLOBE and SMART. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to more buy canned goods, snacks, beverages and electronic loads.

Nida has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Nida hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, beverages and electronic loads.

loans.name: Rex

texts.en:
Rex, 29, lives in the Philippines. He is married.
 
Rex has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, beverages and rice by the kilogram. He has had this business for five years. He has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy more canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Rex has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Edelyn

texts.en:
Edelyn, 40, lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.

Edelyn provides a jeepney or multipurpose cab service, with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy tools and pay for gasoline for the maintenance of her service.

Edelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline for the maintenance of her service.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel, 29, lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.

Maricel has a karaoke shop that provides entertainment, with customers paying 5 pesos per song. She has had this business for two years. She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy tools and pay for the electricity for the maintenance of the videoke.

Maricel has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for electricity for the maintenance of the videoke.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sweet potatoes, bananas, pork chops, potatoes, and vegetables to cook and sell.

loans.name: Miraflor

texts.en:
Miraflor, 21, lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.

Miraflor has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for resale.

Miraflor has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia, 42, lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child.

Lydia has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy more canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Lydia has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith, 37, lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children.

Faith has a shop that sells fish, such as milk fish and sardines. She has had this business for eight years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy more fish to sell.

Faith has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha, 50, lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.

Editha with her husband  has a  motorcycle transport  business where her husband operates their motorcycle and a food shop that sells chicken and pork barbecue in the afternoon session. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients needed for chicken barbecue and help for the maintenance of the motorcycle.

Editha has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for chicken barbecue.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more groceries to have a better selection for sale.

loans.name: Sari

texts.en:
Sari, 45 years old, is a food seller and earns $3.50 per day. Her husband is a farmer and earns $4 per day. They have three children, one of whom is studying and the other two are working, which earns the family another $9 per day. Every month, she has to spend $40 on food, $10 on electricity, $15 on school fees, $10 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $700 to buy a camera to be a photographer. This loan will help her family to have a new career that can better support the family. She wants to repair her house when she has enough money.

loans.use: To buy a camera to be a photographer.

loans.name: Sum

texts.en:
51-year-old Mrs. Sum is from the province of Kompong Thom, and she has been raising pigs for some time in order to support her family. With this business, she has been able to manage the daily household expenses. Every day she has to devote a lot of effort and time to care for her pigs; however, she enjoys doing her business for a living. 

Her plan for the future is to expand her pig raising business and reach a level of financial stability. She would also like to buy two additional cows for breeding this year. She said that this loan will be very useful for her to help the family increase their profit. She lives with her husband and her two school aged-children.

loans.use: to buy two additional cows for breeding.

loans.name: Magdalina

texts.en:
Magdalina is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. She has a tailoring shop that makes and sells school and office uniforms. She has had this business for 20 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy raw materials needed for the tailoring shop. Magdalina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials needed for the tailoring shop.

loans.name: Sophorse

texts.en:
Sophorse, 38 years old, is a housewife. Her husband is a construction worker and earns $10 per day. They have three children, 11, 4 and 2 years old, one of whom is studying. Every month, she has to spend $66 on food, $7 on electricity, $5 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $800 to buy construction materials for her husband's career. This loan will help her family to have enough money to buy construction equipment that can support her husband's career and make more income.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for her husband's career.

loans.name: Michelle Lyn

texts.en:
Michelle Lyn is a responsible housewife who aims to improve their status of living. She owns and manages a variety store to generate income. She has been in this business for almost eight years and usually earns a profit of about P8,000 which she utilizes for their basic necessities and saves for future emergencies. 

She aimed to increase her product offerings to satisfy her customers' needs, but due to inadequate capital, she is asking for an additional P10,000 to buy load wallet (prepaid cell phone time), rice, soft drinks, beverages, junk foods and seasonings to sell in her variety store. She is hoping that through this loan, she will improve the business and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy load wallet (prepaid cell phone time), rice, soft drinks, beverages, junk foods, and seasonings to sell.

loans.name: Analy

texts.en: Analy is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. She has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Analy has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Eoun

texts.en:
Eoun, 38 years old, is a housewife. Her husband is a construction worker and earns $4 per day. They have four children; two are studying and the other two are working; each earns $4 per day. Every month, she has to spend $66 on food, $7 on electricity, $5 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy pigs to feed and sell. She wants to repair her house to be better for living because now it is very old and not in good condition. For the children, she only hopes to support them to study in secondary school because she is afraid she has no ability to support them to the higher class.

loans.use: To buy pigs to feed and sell.

loans.name: Phemie

texts.en:
Phemie is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. She has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for one year. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Phemie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Phally

texts.en: Phally, 27 years old, is a garment factory worker and earns $2.50 per day. Her husband is a Tok Tok (motorcycle) driver who earns $10 per day. This couple lives with their parents and they have no children yet. Every month, she has to spend $64 on food, $5 on electricity, $25 on house rental fees in Phnom Penh where she work, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy a motorbike for traveling to work. Her husband plans to buy a new Tok Tok after finishing this loan because his current Tok Tok is old and can’t make good income. Her parent gave the house that they live together in the province to Phally, so she plans to repair her parent's house to be bigger than it is now.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for traveling to work.

loans.name: Rodella

texts.en:
Rodella is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. She has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 3 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Rodella has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Marisue

texts.en:
Though her family lives less fortunate lives, Marisue describes herself as a jolly person who is thankful to have a hardworking husband who provides motorcycle services to the people in their village, especially students. He earns a daily net profit of P200, just enough to cover their daily meals and allowances for their three children.

Marisue is now requesting a loan of P8,000 to buy a new pair of tires and side mirrors for the motorcycle in order to improve the services rendered by her husband. She hopes to continue financing their children's education so that they can achieve a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy a new pair of tires and side mirrors for the motorcycle.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hardworking entrepreneur with a wood lamination shop in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 25 years. Josephine earns more income from fish vending. She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials for her wood lamination business.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams of saving enough money so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional materials for her business.

loans.name: Chinda

texts.en:
Chinda, 28 years old, is running a computer shop and provides computer services with her husband, earning about $12 per day. They have three children, 10, 9 and 3 years old, two of whom are studying in school. Every month, she has to spend $50 on food, $20 on school fees, $25 on transportation, and $15 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $1,200 to buy a cow for her father to feed and sell. She is staying in Thailand with her husband and visits her home sometimes on holidays. All of her children are living with her parents in Cambodia. To pay the loan she has to send money every month to her parents in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a cow for her father to feed and sell.

loans.name: Yeium

texts.en:
Yeiun, 52 years old, is a farmer who earns about $1 per day. Her husband is selling coffee and earns approximately $8 per day. She has two children. One is studying and the other is working in the factory earning $4 per day. Every month, she has to spend $50 on food, $5 on school fees, and $15 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $200 to dig a well near her house. She wants to support one of her children who is working in Phnom Penh to sell coffee because this career can make good income.

loans.use: To dig a well near her house.

loans.name: On

texts.en:
Mr. On is a 43-year-old married man who has been living in Kompong Thom province with his wife and five single children. He owns a business of selling firewood, which helps him balance his household expenses. His wife doesn’t go out to sell the firewood with him, but instead she raises some pigs at home to help support their living. One of On's sons normally helps him to haul his firewood products to sell in a local market. 

On wants to have a motorcycle for using in the family because he spends a lot of money to hire a motor-taxi service to go anywhere he wants. However, he doesn’t have enough capital to buy one. Now he is seeking a loan from Kiva to buy a second hand motorcycle for his use. In the future, he hopes he’ll be able to build a food store for his wife, selling a variety of products for more income.

loans.use: to buy a second hand motorcycle for his use.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch, 29 years old, does tailoring and earns about $2.50 per day. Her husband is a construction worker earning $5 per day. They have two children, 5 and 2 years old, one of whom is studying. Every month, she has to spend $50 on food, $5 on school fees, $5 on transportation and $15 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $800 to buy a motorbike for use in the family. She also wants to buy cheap fabric, but good quality, to make clothes to sell so that she can make more income for her family. She has planned to buy two more sewing machines at home and hire a worker to sew at her tailoring shop.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for use in the family.

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.en:
Bernardita is 38 years old and married with one child.  She has a shop where she sells toys, souvenirs, and hair accessories.  She has had this business for one year.

Bernardita plans to use this loan of 7,000 Philippine pesos to buy more toys and hair accessories for her shop.  She has been a member of Kiva field partner HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Bernardita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy toys and hair accessories for a retail shop

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Liza works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines and also earns an additional income from buying and selling livestock.  Liza is borrowing PHP29,500 through NWTF to buy spare parts for her motorcycle transport business.

Liza has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business further.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for her motorcycle business.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with eight children. 

Luz has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for PHP 6,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Luz has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Luz hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en: Pov, 38 years old, is a farmer and, feeding animals to sell, earns $2 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns $5 per day. They have two children, who are both staying home because they still too young to be in school. Every month, she has to spend $50 on food, $10 on transportation, and $15 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy construction material to repair her house. She wants to feed pigs at home when she can save some money to start.

loans.use: To buy construction material to repair her house.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Julieta has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Julieta has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Julieta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en: Pov, 32 years old and working in a factory, earns $8 per day. His wife is a farmer who earns $4 per day. They have two children and both of them are studying. Every month, he has to spend $70 on food, $20 electricity, $30 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. He would like to request a loan of $500 to buy a motorbike for traveling to work. He wants to repair his house when he has enough money. For his children, he wants to support them to study and at least finish high school.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for traveling to work.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en: Rosa, a 33-year-old married mother of one child who is attending school, is a very hardworking entrepreneur who operates a general store in the Philippines. In business for two years, she is now requesting a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy stocks of groceries to sell in her store. Rosa would like to build and expand her enterprise to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy stocks of groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Philipp

texts.en: Philipp, a 29-year-old single father of one child, lives in the Philippines where he has had shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages for three years. A member of HSPFI since 2011, he has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for his store. In the future, Philipp hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for his store.

loans.name: Somaly

texts.en:
Somaly, 39 years old, is a tailor earning $10 per day, while her husband, a soldier, has an income of $5 per day. They have two children who are studying and one who earns $5 per day selling soy beans in the market. Every month, she has to spend $120 on food, $30 on electricity, $50 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses.

Somaly is requesting a loan of $700 to buy fabric to sell to other tailors who need it. She wants to extend her career so she can make better income.

loans.use: to buy fabric to sell to other tailors.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children.
 
Jessica has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for six years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Jessica has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Jessica hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Irish

texts.en:
Irish is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has one child. 

Irish has a shop that sells vegetables and spices like onions, garlic and spring onions. She has had this business for four years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy vegetables for resale.

Irish has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Irish hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has six children.
 
Virgilia has a shop that sells coconuts and sticky rice per kilogram. She has had this business for 10 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy rice and coconuts for resale.

Virgilia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Virgilia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy rice and coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase clothes in bulk for the coming winter season for sale.

loans.name: Suvsara's Group

texts.en:
Suvsara is the leader of this group. She is 77 and, unfortunately, she is a widow. She lives with a grandson, who is 24 and helps her with housework. 

In order to earn money, Suvsara cultivates agricultural products. She has been doing it since the collapse of the Soviet Union. 

At the moment she owns 0.7 hectares of land, where she grows corn. She expects to get about 2.5 tons of corn. 

Suvsara is applying for the loan because she needs money to purchase coal for the winter season. In the future she wishes to see her grandson get married.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase coal for winter season.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has one child. 

Edith has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Edith has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Edith hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.en:
Ermelinda is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has six children. 

Ermelinda has a shop that sells green and yellow bananas. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy green and yellow bananas for resale.

Ermelinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Ermelinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy green and yellow bananas for resale.

loans.name: Welma

texts.en:
Welma is 47 years old and married. She has 10 children.

Welma works hard to provide for her family. She buys and sells rice in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Welma has borrowed and paid 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been buying and selling rice for five years and also earns an income from farming rice and coconut.

Welma aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Evella

texts.en:
Evella is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 

Evella has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Evella has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Evella hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Nerma

texts.en:
Nerma is 24 years old and married with two children. Nerma works very hard to provide for them. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her store.

Nerma has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, soft drinks and other groceries. 

In the future Nerma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Maram

texts.en:
Maram is a 25-year-old married woman from Madaba, Jordan with three children.

Maram makes dairy products from goat milk and she is requesting a loan of 400 JD to purchase raw materials needed in making these products.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for her project.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. She has a food shop or "carenderia" where she makes & sells viands like "caldereta", "adobo" & fried fish. She has had this business for 18 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands.

Marites has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Marites hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a new engine for the taxi.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 44 years old, married, and has three children. Her goal is to improve her hog-raising business to support her family and continue sending her children to school. She has been in this business for almost 26 years, earning profits of P8,000 per head that she uses for their basic necessities and to finance the education of their children. Despite the hardships and difficulties of life, she has the strong determination to uplift their living standard and to give her children a better life.

Helen wants to raise more pigs to increase her income. She is asking for a loan of P20,000 to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for her piggery business. She does everything for the benefit of their under-privileged lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for her piggery business.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. She has a shop that sells clothing & beauty products from NATASHA & AVON. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stock from AVON & NATASHA to sell.

Jocelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jocelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock from AVON & NATASHA for resale.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie has been operating her retail store for five years and she is glad that her business is improving and growing. She is able to earn about P5,000 a month and uses her profit to pay for her family's electric bills and daily needs. 

Elvie suffers difficulties in her business due to many unpaid purchases on credit from her customers. She is requesting a loan in the amount of P20,000 to purchase grocery items such as canned goods, assorted biscuits, noodles, cooking oil etc. for her retail store business. She hopes to obtain this loan so that she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items such as canned goods, assorted biscuits, noodles, cooking oil etc.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Elizabeth has a shop that sells coconuts & bananas. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy coconuts & bananas for sale.

Elizabeth has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Elizabeth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts & bananas to sell.

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en:
Lenie has been operating her retail store for three years and she is glad because her business is improving and growing. She is able to earn about P500 a day and uses her profit to pay for her family's electric bills and daily needs. She is also engaged in a piggery business for her additional income.

She is requesting a loan P30,000 to buy groceries item such as soft drinks and assorted biscuits to sell and to buy feed and vaccines for her piggery business. She hopes to obtain this loan so that she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as soft drinks and assorted biscuits to sell and to buy feed and vaccines for her piggery business.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 62 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with one child.  She has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Susana has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Susana hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Elizabeth has a business that sells fish like sardines & milk fish. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy fish to sell.

Elizabeth has been a member of HSPFI since 2000. In the future, Elizabeth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Tamer

texts.en:
Tamer is a 24-year-old man from Marka, Amman, Jordan.

Tamer started his business some years ago from his home with only one sewing machine, then he expanded it by customizing a room to operate from.
Tamer is requesting a loan of 1500 JD to purchase cloth and materials for his business.

An aspiration of Tamer is to develop his business and do a maintainance on his house.

loans.use: To purchase cloth.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Elizabeth has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Elizabeth has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Elizabeth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Houng

texts.en:
Mrs. Houng is an intelligent and conscientious businesswoman. She is the 56-year-old mother of five lovely children; one of her children is already married and lives in a separate house, the other four are all single. Presently, she farms rice and corn in Baray District, Kompong Thom Province, Cambodia.  She learned how to farm from her parents and has been a farmer since 1980.

Now, she faces challenges like insect plagues and crop illnesses, as well as changes in the climate. She is requesting this loan through HKL, a Kiva partner, to buy agricultural supplies, pesticide and fertilizers.  She is very grateful for the loans she has received because, thanks to them, she was also able to fix up her house and buy some other things she needed.

loans.use: to buy pesticide, fertilizers, and other agricultural supplies

loans.name: Analy

texts.en:
Analy is 21 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Analy has a shop that sells clothing and beauty products from Natasha and Avon. She has had this business for two years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy stocks from Avon and Natasha for resale.

Analy has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Analy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks from Avon and Natasha for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new equipment for the educational center.

loans.name: Khetam

texts.en:
Khetam is a 44-year-old married woman from A. Russeifeh, Jordan. She is the mother of six children.
Khetam makes accessories from different kind of beads, a business which she operates from her own home. She is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to purchase more quantities of beads in order to expand her business.
Khetam did not want her picture on the internet for culturA. reasons, so her daughter appears in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase quantities of new beads.

loans.name: Recajoy

texts.en:
Recajoy is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 
Recajoy has a shop where she makes and sells home-made munchkins and peanut butter. She has run this business for two years. She has requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients to make snacks to sell.
Recajoy has been a member of Kiva partner, HSPFI, since 2010. In the future, Recajoy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to make snacks to sell.

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita sells vegetables such as squash, eggplant, okra and string beans. She has been operating this kind of business for three years and is able to earn about 3,000 PHP per month. Benita suffered from financial difficulties due to the high cost of basic commodities. For this reason, she would like to increase her vegetable crops so that she could earn a greater profit. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase vegetable seeds such as okra, eggplant and squash for her vegetable vending business. 
Benita is 59 years old, married and has one child. She is thankful because through her business she is able to support her family. She is hoping that she could improve her vegetable garden to make it more productive. She believes that with her small business she could provide for the needs of her family and save some for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable seeds such as okra, eggplant and squash.

loans.name: Lucilo

texts.en:
Lucilo is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with four children. 
Lucilo has a shop that sells bananas and coconuts. He has run this business for five years. He has requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy coconuts and bananas for resale.
Lucilo has been a member of Kiva partner, HSPFI, since 2011. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts and bananas for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to expand several small businesses..

loans.name: Khadeja

texts.en:
Khadeja is 22 years old, married (we see her husband here) and the mother of one son.
