Her husband works for the Palestinian National Authority, where he earns a good salary, but also works on the side as a taxi driver. Khadeja wants to help her husband increase his income by applying for a loan that they can use to paint and repair his taxi.

About this loan product:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. 

For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to repair and paint a taxi.

loans.name: Chinara's Group

texts.en:
Chinara is the leader of this group. She is 35 and married. Her husband works in the brick factory.  Together with her husband, she is raising three sons and two daughters. The sons study at school and the daughters are pre-school aged (under seven). In order to earn money to meet the family needs, Chinara breeds cattle. She sells dairy products and in this way she earns about 2000 soms per month. At the moment, she wants to increase the number of cattle she keeps, but she doesn’t have enough money to realize her plans, thus she applied for the loan. With money received from the loan she will purchase cattle for breeding. In the future, Chinara wants to provide her children with a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Eyad

texts.en: Eyad is a 38-years-old man. He is married and has two sons and four daughters. He is a municipality employee with a decent salary. Eyad wants to improve his family life conditions by purchasing new home furniture such as: bedroom furniture for his children, living room seats, and others, but the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay for this purchase so he needs to take a loan out in the amount of $1,200 from FATEN. When Eyad gets the loan which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will be able to purchase the home furniture his family needs and to provide his family with better and healthier living conditions. Eyad is photographed in the picture in a FATEN branch.

loans.use: To purchase new home furniture.

loans.name: So

texts.en: 36-year-old Mr. So is a hard-working and goal-oriented person. He has been living in the Kompong Chhnang province with his wife and three children. All of his children are single and some are studying in a local high school. Mr. So has had a business fattening and selling cattle for a long time. He also takes some time to run another business by buying bamboos from a local market, and then making different kinds of bamboo products to sell at a higher price. Currently, Mr. So has run out of economic resources used for the progress of his business. Now, he would like to ask for some funds from Kiva to buy additional bamboo to stock in order to keep producing his outputs. With the increase in income, he hopes he’ll be able to have better living conditions and reach a level of financial stability.

loans.use: to buy additional bamboo to stock in order to keep producing his outputs.

loans.name: Samar

texts.en:
Samar is a 36-year-old lady. She is married to Malek who works as a food products distributor. 
Samar is a housewife who has dedicated all of her time to raise her four children. For this reason, she couldn’t manage to find a full-time job, so she thought of a business that she can do from her home. She decided on a breeding business for speciA. types of birds that can be sold for a high price.
She has been running the business for a year now with the support of Malek. Samar has now applied for a loan to buy more birds such as canary birds to increase her profits and open a speciA. store for selling birds.
Since Samar is a conservative person, she preferred that her husband Malek appeared in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more birds such as canary birds to increase her profits and open a special store for selling birds.

loans.name: Fawzia

texts.en:
Fawzia is a 40-year-old woman married to Khalaf, a 43-year-old man who has retired from the air force. Since his retirement, Khalaf has started a business raising different types of animals such as cows, chickens, etc. and selling their produce, such as milk and eggs.
Fawzia wants to support her husband's business and so she has applied for a loan to buy a refrigerator for keeping the fresh milk in and more chickens and ducks to increase productivity. 
Since Fawzia is a conservative person, she preferred that her husband appeared in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and more chickens and ducks.

loans.name: Samar

texts.en:
Samar is a 44-year-old woman who is married to a car retailer.
Samar was able to open a small food market (mini-market) in her neighborhood at the beginning of this year. She has been filling it with all the products that the customers in the area are asking for. For this reason, she has gained a respectable number of customers each day. Now Samar wants to expand her business and turn it into a supermarket by merging another store with hers and bringing in more variety to what she sells.

loans.use: to expand her business into a supermarket by merging with another store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new home furniture

loans.name: Tahreer

texts.en:
Tahreer, a 34-year-old married woman, has been in the retail business for four years. She buys products such as blankets, clothes, cosmetics and perfumes and resells them. Having this kind of variety in the items she sells has given her the advantage – her customers can find a lot of what they are looking for in one place.
However, since her business is located at her house, Tahreer is unable to expand it by extending the work space or even including more products. So now Tahreer has applied for a loan in order to be able to earn more profit from her business and have her own retail store.

loans.use: to open her own retail store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new educational tools and equipment for the educational center she has

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa makes palm oil for sale. She also has a mill that she uses to mill cereals at Abura. Some of the cereals she mills are groundnut, corn, millet and others. She is married and has 5 children and has been in this business for 20 years. Her husband is a farmer.

The loan will be used to buy palm fruits to make oil for distribution.  Any further increase as a result of the loan will be reinvested back into the palm oil business.

loans.use: to buy palm fruits to make oil for distribution

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is divorced and has 3 children. She has received a senior-high level of education. She sells slippers, creams and dresses at Abura, which she has done for 15 years.

She wishes to increase her income and so a loan will help her obtain more slippers and creams to resell. The new profit she hopes to get will be reinvested for further growth.

loans.use: to obtain more slippers and creams to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more food items to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, and other products to cook for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more food items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter used his previous loan of 10,000 Kenya shillings to buy a dairy cow.  He was able to increase his income with increased milk production. He has also used his savings in Faulu Kenya to boost his business.  
He was able to improve his standard of living. Now, he hopes to improve his retail shop business. Hence, he has requested 60,000 Kenya shillings to add a stock of soap, sugar, salt and rice in his shop.

loans.use: to add a stock of soap, sugar, salt, and rice for his retail shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase new home furniture.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena makes a living selling clothing, hair and body creams, different types of pampers and others items. She does her selling by moving from place to place, while also taking time out every day to manage her home. She completed high school and now is married and has two children.  She is applying for this loan to buy more items to sell to her customers. Her goal is to increase her profits so that she can pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy various items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena makes a living by selling fried doughnuts, moving from one place to another to serve her customers. She is a single parent who cares for six children. She also runs a business on the side making palm oil. Abena is applying for this loan to buy more of the ingredients she needs to make donuts, including flour, sugar and oil. By selling more donuts, she hopes to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make more donuts to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fruits to make oil and plantain for resale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace cooks food to sell near a school in Abura. She is married and has 5 children. She has received a high school education.

Grace cooks food such as rice and banku (fermented corn dough and cassava dough). She uses her income to help her husband provide for the basic needs of the home. She will be using the loan to purchase more ingredients to cook food to sell. She plans to reinvest the profits from her expanded business for further growth.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients to cook food to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more biscuits, pens, and other items for resale.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama fries fish for sale in Abura. She has received a high-school education. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a farmer. She assists her husband in taking care of the home.

Ama has been selling fried fish for 2 years. She will use her loan to buy more fresh fish to fry for sale. She hopes to save the profits from her business to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish to fry for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, oil, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina operates a mini provisions shop in Abura. She has been through senior high school. She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a farmer. She responsibly helps her husband to educate, feed, and clothe the children.

Paulina will use her loan to buy provisions for the shop. She hopes to use the profits from her business to build a bigger shop.

loans.use: to buy provisions for her shop.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua is a palm oil extractor in Abura. She has been in this business for 5 years. The yellow jugs shown in the picture above are full of palm oil. Ekua is also a single parent taking care of 4 children. She sees to the well-being of her home with the income from her palm oil sales.

Ekua will use her loan to buy more palm fruit to make oil. She hopes to reinvest her profits back into the business.

loans.use: to buy more palm fruit to make oil.

loans.name: Foriwa Yaa Doris

texts.en: Foriwa cooks wakye and is a palm oil extractor at Abura. She has received a senior high education. She is married and has seven children. Her husband is a farmer. Foriwa supports her husband to provide for the general needs of their household. Her loan will be used to buy beans, rice, tomatoes, and other ingredients for cooking wakye. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, tomatoes, and other ingredients for cooking wakye.

loans.name: Les Amis Sincères Group

texts.fr: Le groupe "LES AMIS SINCÈRES" est composé de trois membres qui se connaissent depuis leur jeune âge et qui sont des amies. La représentante de ce groupe du nom de Félicité est celle qui à une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupe sollicite pour une deuxième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Félicité est âgée de 36 ans et est mariée à Octave, un commerçant. Le couple n'a pas encore d'enfant. Félicité a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Pour subvenir à ses différents besoins, Félicité mène comme activité la vente de tissus dans sa boutique au Bénin. Félicité exerce cette activité depuis une dizaine d'années. Félicité s'approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer leur activité et de mieux satisfaire leur clientèle, Félicité et les autres membres du groupe "LES AMIS SINCÈRES" sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Leur ambition est d’accroître le niveau de leur activité.
texts.en:
The "Les amis sincères" group is made up of 3 women who have been friends since they were young girls. The group is asking for a second loan from ALIDé so that they can raise their level of business activity and better satisfy their customers. The group´s representative, Félicité, is the woman with her hand raised in the picture. She is 36 years old and married to Octave, a trader. The couple do not yet have children. Félicité left school before high school and has been earning a living selling fabrics in her shop, in Benin, for about 12 years. She gets her supplies locally.

Félicité and the other members of the "Les amis sincères" group will use the loan to strengthen their businesses and better satisfy customer demand. Their ultimate aim is to grow their businesses.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase palm fruits to make oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more biscuits, toffees, creams, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more poultry and fodder.

loans.name: Betty S.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is a group of teachers from one of the primary schools in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, to seek a loan of 7,400,000 SLL. With the help of this loan, they will be able to buy items or invest in projects that their salaries alone cannot afford. At the end of each month, using their monthly salaries, these teachers repay the loan. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for making the repayment on their behalf. 

The leader of this group of teachers is Betty. A native of Damawulo, the 57-year-old has been in the teaching profession for 36 years now. Betty is married and has 4 children – 2 in primary school and 2 in secondary school. Betty has requested this loan in order to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a hardworking businessman who is 54 years old. He is married and blessed with 4 children who are still in school. For the last 3 years, he has been operating a motorbike transport business to earn a living. He also engages in dairy farming and selling timber to earn more income. In the next 5 years, he wants to buy a van. He is requesting a loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a power saw for his timer selling business.

loans.use: To buy a power saw for his timber selling business

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 29-year-old married man and father of 2 children. He has been manufacturing floor tiles and mosaic tiles for 10 years. He is well known in his region because of his high-quality products and speciA. prices. He is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua, a Kiva partner, to buy necessary machinery for his business.

Hassan is a hardworking man who seeks perfection in his work. This is his first time requesting a loan, and he hopes it will be with a positive effect on both the sociA. and financiA. sectors. He will also do necessary work on his house before the winter season to keep his family living under healthy conditions.

loans.use: To buy needed machinery for his business

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa is married and has 5 children. She sells cooked rice with tomato sauce, biscuits, toffee, and other products in Elmina. Her husband is a trader. Adjoa uses her income to assist her husband in providing daily meals for the family. She will use the loan to purchase bags of raw rice, tomatoes, onions, and other items to promote the sale of her cooked rice.

loans.use: to purchase bags of raw rice, tomatoes, onions, and other items to promote the sale of her cooked rice.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba moves around the vicinity of Elmina to sell cloth, plastic bowls and pans (as shown in the picture above). She is married to a farmer and has two children. As part of her responsibilities, she supports her husband to take care of the home. Her loan will be used to buy cloth to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop.

loans.use: to buy cloth to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sugar, salt, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Manaan

texts.en: Manaan sells tomatoes, watermelon, spring rolls and local drinks in Elmina. The picture shows Manaan in the process of making spring rolls. She has four children and is married to an electronic repairer. She responsibly supports her husband in the well-being of her home. Her loan will be used to buy more items to enable her to make spring rolls for sale. She hopes to save the new profits from her business to open a snack bar.

loans.use: to buy more items to enable her to make spring rolls for sale.

loans.name: Alfred B.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust, a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from Kenema city, in eastern Sierra Leone. They have applied for a loan of 9,500,000 Sierra Leone leones (SLL) from Kiva field partner SMT. With the help of this loan, they are going to solve most of their immediate financial needs, and at the end of each month, they repay SMT/Kiva using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayments and paying SMT/Kiva on their behalf. 

Alfred is the leader of this group of teachers. Born in Sumbuya, southern Sierra Leone, the 57-year-old has served in the teaching profession for 36 years. He is married and has three children: two in secondary school and one no longer attending school. Alfred has requested this loan in order to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more sheep.

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat is a hardworking businessman aged 42. He is married and blessed with two children, both of whom attend school. 
For the last three years, Josphat has been selling sweets, biscuits and cakes to earn a living. He uses his bicycle to transport his goods. The main challenge he faces is competition. But he has been able to retain some of his customers because of his good reputation. In the next five years, he wants to manage a wholesale business. With his loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings, Josphat wants to buy more cakes for resale.

loans.use: to buy cakes for resale.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua displays food items for sale such as garden eggs, okra, plantain, palm oil, and others on a table at Ampeyin near Elmina. Her husband is a welder. They have six dependants. Ekua has been in this business for some time now. She wishes to buy other food items requested by her customers and so is seeking a loan from Kiva partner, CRAN. The loan will be used to buy other food items in addition to what she already has for sale. Ekua hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop.

loans.use: to buy other food items for resale.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a hardworking businesswoman aged 51. She is married and blessed with four children, all of whom attend school. 
For the last three years, Catherine has been practising farming to earn a living. She has retained her business because of her good reputation with her customers. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business. She expresses gratitude to Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya, for training her in good customer care. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy pesticides, seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy pesticides, seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mahuena Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUENA est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Abla est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Abla est âgée de 25 ans et vit au Bénin. Abla est mariée à un technicien du nom de Bienvenue. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés, à leur charge, dont deux sont les leurs. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Abla n’a jamais été à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Abla prépare de la nourriture (pâte de maïs accompagnée de sauce) qu’elle vend depuis huit ans environ. A côté de cette activité, Abla vend des tissus et des chaussures. Abla s’approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Abla sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUENA un deuxième crédit. Le premier crédit a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: The Mahuena group is composed of three people who live in the same neighborhood in Benin. The group’s representative, by the name of Abla, is the one  raising her hand raised in the photo. Abla is 25 years old  and lives in Benin. Abla is married to Bienvenue, a mechanic. The spouses have three children in their care, all of whom are in school and two of whom are their own. The children together with them. Abla never went to school. To provide for herself and her children, Abla cooks food (corn mush with sauce) for sale, something she has been doing for about eight years. In addition, Abla sells fabrics and shoes. Abla stocks up at one of the Benin markets.  With the goal of meeting customer demand and increasing her sales volume and her revenues, Abla, together with the other members of the Mahuena group, is seeking a second loan. The first loan has been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy bags of corn, sauce condiments and fabrics.

loans.name: Samuel N.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from a primary school in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They have applied for a loan of 9,600,000 SLL in order to solve their immediate financial problems. At the end of each month, they will repay the loan using their monthly salaries.
Samuel is the leader of this group. A native of Moyamba, the 52-year-old is married and has six children – two in secondary school, two in primary school, one in college and the other not attending school. Samuel has served in the teaching profession for 32 years now. He has requested this loan in order to buy a plot of land for the future construction of a family house.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land for the future construction of a family house.

loans.name: Mawutin Group

texts.fr: MAWUTIN est un groupe constitué de trois personnes et dont la  représentante (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) se nomme Chantal. Les membres du groupe résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la troisième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Chantal est âgée de 42 ans et vit au Bénin. Chantal est mariée à un frigoriste du nom de Maurice. Le couple n'a pas d'enfant.Chantal n'a jamais été à l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Chantal mène comme activité, la vente de la farine de maïs. Chantal s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à ainsi assurer les diverses charges de la famille. Ce troisième prêt permettra certainement à Chantal et aux autres membres du groupe MAWUTIN de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
Mawutin is a group with three members.  The group's representative (who is raising her hand in the photo) is called Chantal.  The members of this group live in the same area of Benin. With the goal of increasing their working capital, the group are requesting their third loan from ALIDé.

Chantal is 42 years old and lives in Benin.  She is married to a refrigeration technician called Maurice.  The couple do not have any children.  Chantal never went to school.  In order to provide for herself, Chantal runs a business selling cornstarch.  She stocks up in one of the markets in Benin.  This business makes her income which helps her to cover her family's various expenses.  This third loan will allow Chantal and the other members of the Mawutin group to expand their businesses and increase their number of customers and their income.

loans.use: to buy sacks of corn

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To complete the price of purchasing a new taxi

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is a married woman and blessed with six children. For the past 5 years, she has been practicing farming to make a living. She also practices dairy farming. Nancy has employed three people to help her manage the business. In the next 5 years, she wants to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 KES to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy farm fertilizer

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is married and blessed with three children all whom attend school. For the last 7 years, she has been practicing poultry farming to earn a living. She has employed four people to help her manage the business. In the next 5 years, she wants to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to buy more chicks. Since she decided to join Faulu Kenya, she has been able to access business loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To buy chicks

loans.name: Rosaline

texts.en: Rosaline is single and blessed with one child. For the last 6 years, she has been operating a dental clinic business to earn a living. She has employed 2 people to help her manage the business. In the next 5 years, Rosaline wants to have another outlet of her business in another place. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 KES to renovate her business premises. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has adopted the culture of saving part of her income.

loans.use: To renovate her business premises

loans.name: Gandjenou Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GANDJENOU est composé de trois  personnes qui se connaissent et qui habitent dans le même quartier. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Ahouélidé est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Ahouélidé est âgée de 41 ans et est mariée à un maçon du nom de Christophe. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Ahouélidé n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Afin de subvenir à ses besoins et pour contribuer aux dépenses du ménage, Ahouélidé mène comme activité la vente de divers produits (bois de chauffage, lait, produits vivriers, etc.) à son domicile. Ahouélidé exerce cette activité depuis cinq ans. Ahouélidé s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Ahouélidé sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GANDJENOU, un troisième crédit. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Gandjenou group is made up of three persons who know each other and live in the same neighborhood. This is the third time this group is requesting financial help from ALIDé in order to increase their business.

The leader of the group goes by the name of  Ahouélidé. She is the one with her hand raised on the photo. She is 41 years old and is married to a mason named Christophe. The couple has three dependent children all attending school. The children live together with their parents.

Ahouélidé did not attend school. In order to meet her needs and to take part in covering household expenses she sells various items (firewood, milk, food products) from her home. She has been practicing this activity for the last five years. She gets her supplies in Benin.

With the objective to meet her customers' demand and to increase her sales and her income Ahouélidé, along with the other Gandjenou group members, is requesting a third loan. The previous loans have been fully reimbursed.

loans.use: to purchase firewood, corn and milk cartons.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is 41 years old, married and has three children. To earn a living, he sells curios. He has been in the business for 10 years. He also does poultry farming for more income generation. Robert works hard in his business so as to provide for the family. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has become more focused in his business. His desire is to expand his business and get enough income to build his own home. Robert has requested 50,000 KES to buy wood carvings.

loans.use: To buy wood carvings

loans.name: Vidole Group

texts.fr: Le groupe VIDOLE est formé de quatre personnes qui habitent dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Bernadette, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Bernadette est âgée de 63 ans et est mariée à un certain Joël. Le couple a un enfant qui est scolarisé et qui vit avec eux. Bernadette n'a pas fréquenté l'école, mais a appris la couture, une activité qu'elle exerce passionnément depuis cinq ans. A côté de cette activité qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins tout en assurant les charges de son enfant, Bernadette vend des friperies dans son quartier. Bernadette s'approvisionne au Bénin. Dans le but d'augmenter son stock de produit et donc son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu, Bernadette et les autres membres du groupe VIDOLE sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur servira à renforcer leur activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
The Vidole group is made up of four persons who live in the same neighborhood. The leader of this group is Bernadette whose hand is raised on the photo.

Bernadette is 63 years old and is married to Joel. The couple has one child who attends school and lives with them. She did not attend school but learned sewing, an activity she has been practicing with passion for the last five years. In addition to this activity that allows her to provide for her needs while covering her child's expenses, she sells used clothing in her neighborhood. She gets her supplies from Benin. 

In order to increase her stock and thus her turnover and income, Bernadette and the other Vidole group members are requesting a loan from ALIDé. This loan will be used to strengthen their activity in order to better meet their customers' demand.

loans.use: to purchase used clothing and various notions.

loans.name: Pedro Fernando

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “KANCHARY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Pedro Fernando; el tiene 46 años de edad y es soltero y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de materiales de construccion, el socio vende ladrillos, cementos, clavos pinturas entre otros materiales de construccion, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de materiales de construcción. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar cemento, pinturas, clavos y ladrillos al por mayor.

 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Pedro Fernando, 46, belongs to the “Kanchary” communal bank that’s located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province and Department.  He’s single and has two children.  He alternates his daily activities with a business selling building materials and supplies.  He sells bricks, cement, nails and paint among other building supplies.  He works from 8am until 7pm.  He supports his children through this business.  He wants to expand the building supply sales business and is asking for a loan to buy cement, paint, nails and bricks at wholesale.  He is happy with the loan and pledges to make his installment payments.

loans.use: to buy cement, paint, nails and bricks at wholesale.

loans.name: Yenny

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KANCHARY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yenny ; ella tiene 22 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa, ella vende pantalones,chompas,polos,casacas y blusas, la socia también se dedica a trabajar en una cevicheria,ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m y el negocio de la ropa lo vende en forma ambulatoria, por medio de estos pequeños negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de ropa y mejorar en su trabajo en la atención de la cevicheria. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar pantalones, blusas, casacas y polos al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Yenny, 22, belongs to the “Kanchary” communal bank that’s located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province and Department.  She has a spouse and a son.  She alternates her daily activities with a clothes selling business.  She sells pants, sweaters, polo shirts, jackets and blouses.  She also works at a marinated seafood snack bar from 8am until 7pm.  She’s a street vendor of the clothes.  Through these small businesses she’s able to support her children.  She wants to expand the clothing sales and improve customer service at the snack bar.  She’s asking for the loan to buy pants, blouses, jackets and polo shirts at wholesale.  She is happy with the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy clothing at wholesale.

loans.name: Idania Araceli

texts.es:
Idania tiene veinte y nueve años de edad, actualmente solo una persona depende de ella y este es menor de edad, se encuentra en la escuela.
Idania acude a las oficinas de ceprodel para solicitar un préstamo el cual va ser invertido en compra de una computadora y para pago de un postgrado, es primera ves que solicita prestamo con la institucion.
cabe mensionar que con este financiamiento me viene ayudar en parte a mi peersona y a mis estudios ya que soy madre doltera de una niña.
texts.en: Idania is 29 years old.  At present, only one person, who is a minor attending school, depends on her.  Idania comes by the Ceprodel office to request a loan that will be used to buy a computer and to pay postgraduate fees.  This is the first time she’s asked the institution for a loan.  She states that it’s worth mentioning that this loan will help her both personally and with her schooling since she’s a single mother of a little girl.

loans.use: to buy a computer and pay postgraduate fees.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica used her previous loan of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy carrots. Her business improved and she was able to raise her living standards. Her desire is to become financially stable in the future. 
Veronica has requested another loan of 100,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy carrots and potatoes.

loans.use: to buy carrots and potatoes

loans.name: Wangnigninan Group

texts.fr: Le groupe WANGNIGNINAN est formé de trois personnes qui résident toutes dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Sidonie Micheline, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Sidonie Micheline est âgée de 58 ans et est mariée à un commerçant du nom de Justin. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés, dont deux sont à leur charge. Sidonie Micheline vit ensemble avec sa famille dans une ville du Bénin. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Sidonie Micheline a arrêté l'école à l'Université. Il y a près de dix ans que Sidonie Micheline mène comme activité la vente de divers produits (maïs, farine de manioc, huile végétale, pétrole, etc.) dans son quartier. Sidonie Micheline achète ses produits dans l’un des marchés du Bénin. C’est la troisième fois que Sidonie Micheline et les autres membres du groupe WANGNIGNINAN  sollicitent de crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur servira à renforcer leur activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
The 3 members of the Wangnigninan group all live in the same neighborhood in Benin. The group's representative, Sidonie Micheline, has her hand raised in the photo. She is 58 years old and married to a retailer named Justin. The couple has 3 children, all of whom have received schooling, and of whom 2 are in their care. Sidonie Micheline lives together with her family in a town in Benin. Together, the couple takes care of family expenses. 

Sidonie Micheline stopped her schooling at the university level. For about ten years she has been selling various items (corn, cassava flour, vegetable oil, gasoline, etc) in her neighborhood. She buys her products at one of Benin's markets. 

This is the third time that Sidonie Micheline and the other members of the Wangnigninan group have asked for a loan from ALIDé. This loan will allow them to expand their business, so that they can better meet their customers' needs.

loans.use: to buy corn, barrels of  vegetable oil, and gasoline.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy dairy products.

loans.name: Fifaton Group

texts.fr: Le groupe FIFATON est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Yvette, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Yvette est âgée de 40 ans et est mariée à un maçon du nom de Sylvain. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Yvette et sa famille habitent ensemble. Yvette n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a environs sept ans que Yvette mène comme activité la vente de produits vivriers(maïs, farine de manioc, etc.) dans son quartier ; ce qui lui permet de subvenir sans grande difficulté aux besoins de ses enfants. Yvette s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. La clientèle de Yvette devient de plus en plus grande, et Yvette voudrait renforcer davantage son activité afin de mieux répondre à leurs exigences. Pour ce faire, et ne disposant pas suffisamment de moyens financiers pouvant lui permettre de réaliser son rêve, Yvette et les autres membres du groupe FIFATON se sont rapprochés de AILDé, en vue d’un troisième crédit.
texts.en:
FIFATON Group is made up of three persons who live in the same neighborhood in Benin. The group's representative, named Yvette, is the one raising her hand in the photograph.

This is the third time that the members of the group are seeking financial support from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, in order to bolster their businesses.

Yvette, age 40, is married to a mason named Sylvain. The couple has two school-attending children they have to support. Yvette and her family live together.

Yvette never attended school. Approximately seven years ago, she started selling food products (corn, cassava flour, etc) in her neighborhood, which enables her to provide for her children's needs without much difficulty.

She gets her supplies from one of Benin's market. Her clientele is increasing, and Yvette would like to bolster her business in order to meet demand. Lacking sufficient financial means to make her dream come true, Yvette, together with the other members of the group, came to ALIDé to seek a third loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of corn and manioc flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase products for his general store.

loans.name: Nonvignon-5 Group

texts.fr: NONVIGNON-5 est un groupe constitué de trois personnes et dont la représentante (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) se nomme Houéssamana Lydia. Les membres du groupe vivent dans le même quartier au Bénin. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Houéssamana Lydia est âgée de 42 ans et est mariée à un certain François. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Houéssamana Lydia assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la famille. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Houéssamana Lydia mène comme activité la fabrication de savon local, qu'elle vend de façon ambulante. De façon secondaire, Houéssamana Lydia vend de l'huile végétale. Houéssamana Lydia exerce cette activité depuis près de cinq ans, ce qui lui permet d’assurer les diverses charges de sa famille. Houéssamana Lydia s’approvisionne dans l’un des plus grands marchés du Bénin. Ce prêt permettra certainement à Houéssamana Lydia et aux autres membres du groupe NONVIGNON-5, de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
NONVIGNON-5 Group is made up of three persons. Its representative is named Houéssamana Lydia and is the one raising her hand in the photograph.

The members of the group live in the same neighborhood in Benin. In order to bolster their working capital, the members of the group are seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, ALIDé.

Houéssamana Lydia, age 42, is married to François. The couple has four school-attending children they have to support. Houéssamana Lydia and her husband provide for the family expenses together.

In order to provide for herself and her children, Houéssamana Lydia sells local soap as a traveling saleswoman. As a secondary business, she also sells vegetable oil. She's been doing so for almost five years, which enables her to provide for the various expenses of her family.

She gets her supplies in one of Benin's largest markets. This loan will certainly help her and the other members of the group to bolster their businesses and increase their clientele and income.

loans.use: to buy cans of vegetable oil

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es: Emilia tiene 48 años D. edad elL. es originaria D. una localidad donD. el aguacate es su principal actividad económica, tiene un hijo que depenD. D. elL. y se dedica a L. venta D. frutas y legumbres, platica que venD. mas que nada aguacate por que tiene una pequeña huerta D. este fruto y sale a venderlo a L. central D. abastos, dice que cuando no es temporada D. aguacate venD. nopales, chiles manzanos, uvas, misperos, guayabas etc. mas que nada fruta D. temporada. Dice que esta pidiendo un crédito a L. financiera por que quiere comprar algo D. abono para sus árboles, también comprar algo D. fruta D. L. temporada. L. meta D. L. señora Emilia es sembrar mas matas D. aguacate para después dedicarse por completo a su huerto.
texts.en: Emilia, 48, is native to an area where avocados are the primary economic activity. She has one son who depends on her and earns a living selling fruits and vegetables. She comments that she sells more avocados than anything because she has a small garden plot of that fruit and goes to sell them at the wholesale food market. She says that when it is not avocado season she sells nopales, manzano chile peppers, grapes, loquats, guava fruit, etc., primarily seasonal fruits. She says she is requesting a loan from the financial institution because she wants to buy a bit of fertilizer for her trees, and also a bit of seasonal fruit. Ms. Emilia's goal is to plant more avocado trees in order to devote herself fully to her orchard.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her avocado trees.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.es: Doña Anastacia es una mujer con ganas de salir adelante ella vive con uno de sus hijos ya que casi todos son casados, el le ayuda a vender frutas y legumbres en su casa. Ella a veces sale a vender también a las calles de una población cercana a su localidad dice que desde muy temprana hora va a la central de abastos a surtirse de las frutas y legumbres. Doña Anastacia esta pidiendo un crédito por que quiere seguir invirtiendo en su negocio ella comprara, cebollas, chiles, jitomates, lechugas, chicharos, zanahorias, chayotes etc. y un poco de abarrotes ya que quiere hacer crecer su negocio. El deseo de doña Anastacia es mejorar sus condiciones de vida mas que nada de su casa ya que es de madera y con las inclemencias del clima se le mete el agua. Ella agradece lo que hace la gente através de la financiera ella dice “Dios los siga socorriendo para que nos sigan ayudando através de los créditos”.
texts.en:
Anastacia is a woman with a desire to get ahead in life.  She lives with one of her children as almost all her children are now married.  Her son helps her to sell fruit and vegetables from her home.  Sometimes Anastacia also goes out to the streets of a nearby town to sell her products.  She says that she goes to the wholesale market very early in the morning to stock up with fruit and vegetables.

Anastacia is requesting a loan as she would like to continue investing in her business.  She will buy onions, chilis, tomatoes, lettuces, peas, carrots, chayotes, etc. and also some groceries as she would like to grow her business.  Anastacia's wish is to improve her living conditions and her house because her house is made from wood and when the weather is bad the water seeps in.  She is grateful for what people do through the financial institution.  She says "May God continue to help you so that you continue helping us through these loans".

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Alondra

texts.es: La mujer de la actualidad lucha mas por el bienestar de su familia, trabaja a diario y se hace cargo de su hogar es el caso de Alondra que desde muy jovencita se caso y ha luchado con su esposo por darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida, ella es originaria de una localidad donde la mayoría de las personas se dedican al cultivo de Aguacate ya que la tierra es muy prolifera para ese tipo de fruto. Alondra tiene 2 hijos los cuales estudian la primaria, comenta que tiene una tienda de abarrotes desde hace años y dice que emprendió ese negocio para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa. Ella esta pidiendo un crédito a la financiera para surtir su tienda, comprara, aceite, huevo, leche, arroz, frijol, shampoo, papel higiénico, pañales etc., y también un poco de verduras como cebolla, jitomate y chiles que es lo que mas se le vende. La meta que tiene Alondra para su negocio es hacer un local de cemento ya que donde tiene sus productos es de madera y en temporada de lluvias abecés se le mojan sus productos y se le echan a perder. Comenta que esta agradecida con las personas que hacen realidad los créditos por que así las personas pueden tener un negocio con el cual pueden mantener a sus familias.
texts.en:
Today’s woman struggles more for her family’s wellbeing; she works every day and takes care of her home.  This is Alondra’s case.  She married very young and she and her husband have worked hard to provide their children with a better quality of life.  She’s from a location where most of the residents are avocado farmers since the soil there is very apt for this type of fruit.  Alondra has two children going to elementary school.  She comments that she has had a grocery store for several years now and she says that she started the business in order to help her husband meet household expenses.

She is asking for the loan to buy stock merchandise for her store.  She will buy oil, eggs, milk, rice, beans, shampoo, toilet paper, diapers, etc. and also a few vegetables like onions, tomatoes and chilies which are the best sellers.  Alondra’s goal is to build a cement store because the place she currently has her merchandise in is wood and during the rainy season it get wet sometimes and some of the products are ruined.  She comments that she’s grateful to all the people who make the loans a reality because people are able to have a business that they can support their families with that way.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy lumber.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Doña Juana tiene 34 años de edad es casada y tiene tres hijos que dependen de ella, platica la señora que ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y lencería por catalogo desde hace 3 años dice que empezó con este negocio por que una amiga la invito y vio que si tenia buenas ganancias y eso la motivo a seguir adelante con este negocio. Comenta que a diario sale a vender a sus conocidas y gente que tiene negocios estables o tiene trabajos estables ya que vende subproductos en pagos. Juana esta pidiendo un crédito para la compra de más productos que ella vende como Cremas, perfumes, lencería, cosméticos etc. la meta que tiene Juana es comprar mas productos para así tener un poco mas de ganancias.
texts.en:
Juana, 34, is married and has three dependent children.  She comments that she sells cosmetics and lingerie via catalogue.  She started this business three years ago because a girlfriend invited her and she saw that she earned good profits so she was motivated to stay in this business.   

She comments that she goes out every day to sell among her acquaintances and people who have stable businesses or steady jobs because she sells her products on credit with payment plans.  

Juana is asking for a loan to buy more products that she sells like creams, perfume, lingerie, cosmetics, etc.  Juana’s goal is to buy more products in order to earn a bit more profit.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Las ganas de salir adelante y darles una mejor calidad de vida es lo que ahora hacen las mujeres de la vida actual, Juana es una de ellas tiene 4 hijos los cuales 3 estudian ya que para el mayor por falta de recursos no pudo entrar a la preparatoria, ya que en ese tiempo doña Juana no tenia para pagar la inscripción, es por eso que a diario ella va a surtir a muy temprana hora frutas y verduras de temporada a la central de abastos donde también le dan buenos precios, platica que cuando es temporada de duraznos y aguacates ella tiene varios árboles en su casa y de ahí ella los corta para vender. Doña Juana esta pidiendo un crédito para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, el sueño que tiene Juana es poner un puesto estable para asi poder estar mas al pendiente de sus hijos y no andar con sus cubetas vendiendo en el mercado por que abecés ya se cansa muy fácilmente de cargar cosas muy pesadas.
texts.en:
The desire to get ahead and provide a better quality of life is what makes today’s women.  Juana is one of them.  She has four children, three of whom are going to school since the oldest one was unable to enroll in high school for lack of resources because at that time Juana did not have the money to pay tuition.  Because of this, every day she heads out very early to stock up on seasonal fruit and vegetables at the central foodstuffs supply center where she gets good prices.  

She tells us that when it’s peach and avocado season she has several trees in her yard that she picks to sell.  Juana is asking for a loan to continue investing in her business.  Juana’s dream is to set up a fixed stand so that she can better care for her children and not be wandering with her buckets in the market selling because sometimes she’s easily tired from carrying very heavy things.

loans.use: to stock up on seasonal fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es: Blanca es una mujer muy trabajadora y con ganas de salir adelante es casada y tiene una niña la cual acaba de ingresar a la primaria. Ella se dedica desde hace un año a la venta de artículos de belleza por catalogo como desodorantes, cosméticos, cremas, shampoo, artículos para el hogar de diferentes marcas. Platica que ella empezó con este negocio por que veía que las demás personas que vendía esos productos tenían buenas ganancias y para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de su casa decidió invertir poco capital que tenia aparte que tenia muy poquitas clientas. Ahorita dice que gracias a Dios y a las ganas de salir adelante ya tiene muchas clientas y que vende muy bien sus productos que ofrece através del catalogo. Ella surte sus productos cada mes en una tienda autorizada, dice que esta pidiendo un crédito a la financiera para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y dice que su sueño es poner una local estable y poner una tienda de ropa interior para dama en su casa para que así sus vecinas no se desplacen hasta población y así no gasten en pasajes.
texts.en:
Blanca is a very hardworking woman with a strong drive to get ahead.  She’s married and has a little girl who has just started elementary school.  She’s been selling beauty supplies like deodorants, cosmetics, creams, shampoo and items for the home of various brands via catalogue for a year.  

She relates that she started the business because she noticed that other people who sold those products earned good profits and to help her husband she decided to invest the little capital she had set aside because she had very few customers.  Now, thanks to God and to her drive to get ahead, she has many customers and the products she sells via catalogue sell very well. 

She stocks up monthly at the authorized distributor.  She says that she’s asking for a loan to continue investing in her business and she says that her dream is to set up a stable locale and open a women’s underwear shop at home so that her neighbors won’t have to go all the way to town and have to pay transportation costs.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase stock of second-hand shoes to sell.

loans.name: Ma Santos

texts.es: Doña Santos como es conocida en su localidad tiene 4 hijos pero nada mas 3 viven con ella ya que la mayor es casada. Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en su casa desde hace 6 años, comenta que surte sus productos en diferentes tiendas de una población cercana a su localidad donde le dan precios bajos para ella ganarle algo, ella esta pidiendo un crédito para la compra de artículos que vende como jabón, azúcar, leche, huevo, arroz, lentejas, café, cerillos, etc. la problemática que tiene doña Santos es que su hija la mayor es madre soltera y tiene que salir a trabajar y doña Santos le cuida al niño pero ella quisiera que su hija mejor le ayudara a vender en su tienda de abarrotes para que este mas al pendiente del bebe, por eso quiere ella tenerla muy bien surtida y meter un poco de frutas y legumbres para que la gente de su localidad no se traslade a la población mayor y no gaste en pasajes. La meta que tiene doña Santos es hacer crecer su negocio y poner un puesto de antojitos mexicanos.
texts.en:
Doña Santos is well-known in her town. She has four children, but only three of them live with her since the oldest one is married. Santos has been selling groceries from her home for the past six years. She says that she stocks her business by purchasing products from different stores in a village near her town because the prices are low enough for her to earn some profit. Santos is requesting a loan to buy products to sell such as soap, sugar, milk, eggs, rice, lentils, coffee, matches, and other items. Doña Santos says that her problem is that her oldest daughter is a single mother who must leave for work, so she is left with caring for her grandson. She must ask her younger daughter to help with managing the store so that she can look after her grandbaby.

For this reason, she wants to be well-stocked and acquire a few more fruits and legumes so that people in her town do not have to go to a larger city and accumulate travel expenses. Her goal is to grow her business and then open a Mexican street food stand.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 11 sacks of poultry food and 100 chicks

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: La señora Yolanda tiene 3 hijos la mayor estudia la secundaria y los otros dos pequeños en la primaria. Ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su localidad, platica que tiene con esa tiendita desde hace 15 años, comenta que primero era de sus papas pero debido a que estaban enfermos ella se hizo cargo del negocio y después ellos le traspasaron el negocio. doña Yola como de cariño le dicen esta pidiendo un crédito para la compra de artículos para surtir el negocio como leche, huevo, harina, frijol, desinfectantes, agua embotellada, refrescos, enlatados, galletas, sopas, etc. para así tener su tienda mas surtida. La meta que tiene Yolanda es hacer un local más grande pero de cemento ya que en donde tiene sus productos ya no le caben, también dice que los días sábados y domingos vende cena como pozole, enchiladas, tacos dorados, tostadas etc. ella esta muy agradecida por lo que esta haciendo la financiera por que gracias a los créditos que le hacen su negocio esta mejorando.
texts.en:
Sra. Yolanda has three children. Her oldest child is in high school and the two younger ones are in elementary school. She has a grocery store in her town. Yolanda says that she has been in business for 15 years. Her parents started this business, but when they became ill, she was left in charge of looking after it. Afterwards, they passed the business on to her. Doña Yola, as she is known affectionately, is requesting a loan to buy products to restock her business such as milk, eggs, flour, beans, disinfectants, bottled water, soft drinks, canned goods, cookies, soups, and other items so that she will have more inventory.

Her goal is to have a larger store because she has spaces where her products no longer fit. In addition, she sells dinner on Saturdays and Sundays. Yolanda prepares stew, enchiladas, hard tacos, tostadas, and other dishes. She is very grateful to have financing and that the loans have helped to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Brenda Guadalupe

texts.es: Brenda tiene 23 años es casada y tiene una niña pequeña de 4 meses, ella se dedica a vender frutas y legumbres de temporada en el mercado de su población, tiene con su negocio aproximadamente 3 años y dice que emprendió el negocio por que primero le ayudaba a sus papas con los gastos de la casa y ahora que esta casada a su esposo, platica que a ella le gusta tener su propio dinero por cualquier imprevisto, ella vende aguacates, nopales, uvas, capulines, zarzamoras etc. Brenda dice que es la primera vez que trabaja con la financiera y le esta agradando como trabajan, ella pidió un crédito para comprar fruta y venderla y surtirá parte la corta de sus árboles y parte la compra en la central de abastos de la población donde vive, el sueño de Brenda es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda ya que es de madera y cultivar aguacates.
texts.en:
Brenda is 23 years old, married, and has a four-month-old daughter. She sells seasonal fruits and legumes at the local market. Brenda has been in business for approximately three years. She says that she started this business at first because she wanted to help her parents with the household expenses. Now that she is married, she says that she likes having her own income for any unexpected emergencies. Brenda sells avocados, cactus pads, grapes, cherries, blackberries, and other items. She says this is the first time she has received financing and is pleased with how the loans work.

Brenda is requesting a loan to buy fruit to sell. Some of the fruit will come from her own trees and the rest will come from the central supply depot in the town where she lives. Brenda’s dream is to improve the condition of her wooden house and to cultivate avocados.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: Doña Cristina es una mujer muy trabajadora pese a su edad ya que tiene 63 años sale a diario a muy temprana hora a la central D. abastos a surtir las frutas que venD. en las calles D. una población granD., ella venD. aguacates, nopales, guayabas, limones, duraznos, etc. también ella se dedica a cultivar en su casa el durazno y tiene varios árboles D. aguacate que cuida para que en temporada D. ese fruto D. mucho. Ella vive con una hija la cual tiene 3 hijos y ellos cuidan D. Cristina. La meta D. doña cristina es mejorar su casita ya que en temporada D. lluvias se le mete el agua por que es D. madera.
texts.en:
Doña Cristina is 63 years old and a hardworking woman. Despite her age, she leaves at an early hour every day for the central supply market to stock up on fruit so that she can sell them on the streets of her large village. Cristina sells avocados, cactus pads, guavas, lemons, peaches, and other items. She also grows peaches at home and has several avocado trees that she maintains for when the fruit is in season.

Cristina lives with one of her daughters who has three children who she helps to look after. Doña Cristina’s goal is to improve her small wooden house so that it is protected during the rainy season.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia es una mujer trabajadora tiene 37 años D. edad y tiene 4 hijos los cuales 2 estudian en la secundaria y 2 en la primaria. Ella ayuda a su esposo a hacer tabique para vender también hacen tabicon desD. hace 5 años dice que a el lo enseño su papa desD. hace mucho tiempo y ahorita esta pidiendo Alicia un crédito a la financiera para la compra D. material para hace tabique como graba, cemento, arena etc. la cual la compraran en tiendas D. venta D. material para construcción en su población. El Sueño que tiene Alicia es  mas adelante comprar su propia maquina para hacer tabique ya que donD. lo hacen es D. su suegro. Platica que esta muy contenta por que es la primera vez que trabaja con la financiera y que se le hace poco los intereses que va a pagar y no se le va hacer tan pesado los pagos.
texts.en:
Alicia is a hardworking woman. She is 37 years old and has four children, two of whom are in high school while the other two are in elementary school. Alicia helps her husband with making bricks to sell. They also make cinder blocks. She has been in this business for five years and says that her husband learned from his father, who worked in this traD. for a long time.

Now she is requesting a loan to buy materials for making bricks such as gravel, cement, sand, and other items. She will buy these items from a store in her village that sells construction materials. Her dream in the future is to buy her own machine for making bricks because the one that they use belongs to her father-in-law. Alicia says that she is very pleased because this is the first time she has worked with a loan. She is also happy that the interest rates are low and that the payments are not a heavy burden.

loans.use: to buy materials for making bricks.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es: Raquel es una joven con muchas ganas de trabajar y salir adelante con su joven esposo, ella todavía no tiene hijos ya que esta recién casada, ella dice “primero quiero tener algo estable donde vivir con mi esposo ya que los hijos son una gran responsabilidad, yo quiero darles a mis hijos una buena calidad de vida por eso quiero tener mi negocio para que cuando los tenga no les falte lo necesario”. Ella esta pidiendo un crédito para la compra de artículos para surtir su negocio ella quiere comprar cloro, azúcar, un poco de pan empacado, leche, dulces, frituras, jugos, sabritas etc. ella tiene con ese negocio 5 meses y surte su mercancía en diferentes tiendas de su población. Esta muy contenta por que dice que es la primera vez que trabaja con una financiera y que se le hacen los pagos fáciles y no pesados.
texts.en:
Raquel is a young woman who desires to work and move forward along with her husband. She still does not have children since she is recently married. Raquel says, “First I want to have some stability living with my husband since children are a huge responsibility. I want to provide my children a good quality of life, so I want to establish my business so that they will not lack the things they need.”

She is requesting a loan to buy products to restock her business. Raquel plans to buy bleach, sugar, a little bit of packaged bread, milk, candy, fried foods, juices, snacks, and other items. She has been in this business for five months and restocks her inventory by going to different stores in her village. Raquel is very pleased because she says this is the first time she has worked with a loan. She says the payments will be easy instead of a heavy burden.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Mahutin Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUTIN est formé de trois personnes qui résident toutes dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Augustine, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Augustine est âgée de 50 ans et est mariée à un commerçant du nom de Sylvestre. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Augustine et sa famille habitent ensemble. Augustine a très peu fréquenté l’école. Pour assurer ses besoins et ceux de sa famille, Augustine mène comme activité depuis dix ans, la vente de charbon de bois dans son quartier. De façon secondaire, Augustine vend du riz et du pain. Augustine achète ses produits dans une ville du Bénin. La clientèle de Augustine devient de plus en plus grande, et Augustine désire rehausser un peu plus le niveau de son activité afin de mieux répondre à leurs exigences. Pour ce faire, et ne disposant pas suffisamment de moyens financiers pouvant lui permettre de réaliser son rêve, Augustine et les autres membres du groupe MAHUTIN se sont rapprochés de ALIDé, en vue d’un autre crédit.
texts.en:
MAHUTIN Group is made up of three persons who live in the same neighborhood in Benin. The group's representative, named Augustine, is the one raising her hand in the photograph.

It is the third time that the members of the group are seeking financial support from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, in order to bolster their businesses.

Augustine, age 50, is married to a merchant named Sylvestre. The couple has two school-attending children, whom they have to support. Augustine and her family live together.

Augustine didn't attend school much. In order to provide for herself and her family, she's been selling charcoal in her neighborhood for ten years. As a secondary business, she also sells rice and bread.

She gets her supplies in one of Benin's towns. Her clientele is increasing, and she would like to bolster her business in order to better meet customer demand.

Lacking financial means to make their dream come true, Augustine and the other members of the group came to ALIDé to seek a new loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal, as well as rice

loans.name: Jasmani

texts.es: Jasmani, de 25 años; habita en el Centro Poblado Villa Ashaninga, ahí formó su familia junto a Lisbeth, su esposa. Producto de su amor nació Jack, su único hijo, al que educan y crían en su casa propia. Este joven padre de familia; forja su futuro con la actividad que le enseñaron desde niño “la agricultura”. Sus principales cultivos constan de café, cacao y piña que se encuentran sobre sus 2 terrenos productivos. Ya tiene 7 años de experiencia y lo que más le gusta, son las temporadas de cosecha, ya que ahí puede ver las frutas maduras y listas para ser comercializadas en la ciudad de Pichanaki, donde tiene clientes fijos. “La cosecha es una vez al año, por ello me dedico a otras actividades”, afirma mientras cuenta que, en sus tiempos libres trabaja en un taller de soldadura y construcción. Ahí obtiene 50 soles de ganancias diarias, con los que solventa la alimentación y educación de sus hijos. Ahora el desea abrir su propio negocio, con lo que pueda obtener mejores ganancias, ya que desea forjar un futuro para su familia, brindándole una mejor calidad de vida. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Los Naranjales” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde agradece la oportunidad que le brindan. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Jasmani de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de mil plantitas de cacao para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Jasmani, 25, lives in the town of Villa Ashaninga, where he made his family together with Lisbeth, his wife.  The product of their love, Jack, was born.  His only son, they nurture and raise him in their own house.

This young father is shaping his future with the job he was taught from the time he was a child, agriculture.  His main crops are coffee, cacao, and pineapple, which he has on his two productive fields.  He already has seven years of experience and what he likes most is harvest season, since there he can see the ripe fruit ready to be sold in the city of Pichanaki, where he has steady customers.

"The harvest is once a year, which is why I work other jobs," he affirms while he says that in his free time he works in a welding and construction shop.  There he earns 50 PEN daily, with which he pays for food and his children's education.  Now he wants to open his own business, with which he will be able to have better profits, since he wants to shape a future for his family, giving them a better quality of life.

He belongs to the Los Naranjales Community Bank, and this is his first loan with MFP, whom he thanks for the opportunity that they are offering him.  In addition, he promises to be punctual with his payments.

If he receives his support, Jasmani will use the requested money to buy a thousand young cacao plants for his next planting.

loans.use: to buy a thousand cacao plants.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise to restock her inventory.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is a widow and has four children. She is responsible for the well-being of her home. 
Angela buys sacks of raw rice and retails them in her community of Elmina in Cape Coast. Her loan will be used to purchase bags of rice to keep to retail  later as the price of rice keeps increasing. She wishes to reinvest her new profit.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice to retail.

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es: Bernardina, D. 56 años es una mujer ejemplar. Vive en compañía D. su esposo Donato, con quien se casó desD. hace 16 años. Ambos tienen 8 hijos, pero solo viven con uno D. ellos: Roger, el menor; en su casa propia ubicada en el Centro Poblado Villa Ashaninka. Como todos los días desD. las primeras horas, sale a cuidar D. su pequeño recreo turístico a las afueras del centro poblado. DonD. ella venD. diversas bebidas, dulces y demás productos comestibles. Le va muy bien en su negocio, pues se ubica en una zona estratégica. Además comparte su tiempo con la actividad D. la  “agricultura”, principal ingreso económico D. su familia; cuenta que desD. hace 40 años comenzó a sembrar plátano, café y cítricos en toda su variedad, los cuales venD. a los comerciantes D. la ciudad D. Pichanaki, que visitan su zona constantemente. En todo este tiempo D. trabajo, logró obtener 5 terrenos, cuenta que hace 4 años que lo adquirió y se siente orgullosa D. ello; ahora su reto es mejorar la calidad D. sus cultivos y D. su negocio. Sabe que lo logrará, pues siempre para activa. “También crío cerdos, gallinas y cuyes, los que engordo para luego vender su carne”, afirma contenta. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los Naranjales” y este es el octavo crédito con MFP, donD. agradece el apoyo D. todos ustedes, pues le permiten continuar con sus objetivos. Además promete ser puntual con el pago D. sus cuotas. Bernardina, D. recibir su apoyo invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra D. diversas bebidas, galletas, dulces y demás productos para su pequeño recreo turístico.
texts.en:
Bernardina, 56, is an exemplary woman. She lives with her husband, Donato, who she has been married to for 16 years. Together they have 8 children, but only one lives with them: Roger, the youngest. They own a home in the area of Villa Ashaninka. Every day very early she goes out to work at a small tourist attraction on the outskirts of town. There she sells various drinks, sweets and other food items. The business is going very well because she has a strategic location. She also spends some time farming, the main source of income for her family. She has been farming for 40 years and plants plantains, coffee and a variety of citrus, which she sells to the merchants in the city of Pichanaki who come to her zone frequently. After all of her time working, 4 years ago she was able to buy 5 plots of land and she is very proud of it. Now her challenge is to improve the quality of her crops and her business. She knows that she will achieve it because she is always active. "I will also raise pigs, chickens and guinea pigs, which I'll fatten up to sell for meat," she says happily. 

She belongs to the village bank Los Naranjales and this is her 8th credit with MFP. She is thankful for all of your support because it has allowed her to continue working towards her goals. She promises to be punctual in her payments. Bernardina will invest the loan in the purchase of different kinds of drinks, cookies and sweets and other products for her small tourist attraction.

loans.use: to buy sodas, cookies and candies to stock her business.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: La Sra. Martha tiene como actividad la venta D. dulces, refrescos, chocolates otros en su kiosco que esta ubicado dentro D. las instalaciones D. una institución publica del departamento D. La Paz, esta actividad la desarrolla D. lunes a viernes, constituyéndose en la principal fuente D. ingreso para ella y su familia que esta compuesta por ella y sus dos hijas, solamente son tres personas  ya que su esposo falleció hace dos años, cuenta la Sra. Martha que la perdida D. su esposo fue un golpe para ella pero supo salir adelante por el bienestar D. sus hijas, el destino del crédito es para la compra D. material D. construcción para la construcción  D. una habitación en la casa donD. vive ya que será para su hija  mayor que próximamente contraerá matrimonio, la Sra. Martha es un dedicada a sus hijas a pesar D. su trabajo siempre vela por su bienestar, ella es muy trabajadora y se encuentra agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. Martha has a business selling candy, soft drinks, chocolates, and other items from a kiosk located next to the facilities of a public institution in the Department of La Paz. She operates her business from Monday through Friday. It is the main source of income for herself and her family, which consists of Martha and her two daughters. There is only the three of them because her husband died two years ago. The loss of her husband was a huge blow to Martha, but she has been able to move forward for the sake of her daughters’ welfare.

This loan will be used to buy construction materials for building a room in the house where she lives. It will be for her older daughter who is getting married soon. Sra. Martha is very dedicated to her daughters despite having to work constantly to proviD. for their welfare. She is extremely hardworking and shows her appreciation for the support Emprender has provided.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for building a room for her daughter.

loans.name: Fifa Group

texts.fr: FIFA est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Pélagie Reine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 43 ans et est une veuve. Pélagie Reine a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et qui sont ses propres enfants. Pélagie Reine vit seule avec ses deux enfants. Pélagie Reine a très peu fréquenté l’école. Pour subvenir sans difficulté aux besoins de ses enfants, Pélagie Reine vend depuis sept ans environs, divers produits (produits vivriers, conserves, huile végétale, savons etc.) dans son quartier. De façon secondaire, Pélagie Reine vend des condiments de sauce. Pélagie Reine s'approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Pélagie Reine sollicite un crédit avec les autres membres du groupe FIFA. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
The "Fifa" group is made up of three women who live in the same area of Benin. The group´s representative, whose hand is raised in the picture, is Pélagie Reine. She is 43 years old, widowed and lives alone with her 2 children, who both attend school. Pélagie Reine herself does not have much schooling. In order to support her family, she has been selling various products (food, canned goods, vegetable oil, soap) to customers in her area for around 7 years. She also has a sideline business selling condiments for sauces. She gets her supplies in town.

Pélagie Reine and the other members of the "Fifa" group are requesting a loan so that they can invest in their businesses in order to better satisfy their customers´ needs and increase their profits.

loans.use: to buy corn, rice and vegetable oil.
